Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Pierrette P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week vacation with daughters. Excellent service from every staff member and they all made us feel welcomed. The room was very spacious, clean, beds were very comfortable. The pillows (firm and soft) were a nice touch. Fridge (no freezer) can fit big container of milk and other food products, small microwave was an added bonus. Small coffee maker (1 cup) did not get to use it, hotel provides the coffee (special pouch) for it. Small safe in closet. Pool is clean and heated as well as hot tub was nice after an exhaustive day in the parks. Washrooms at the pool area are kept very clean. Some pool toys left by other guests were available. We were on the 6th floor (room 636) with balcony (chairs & table) with view of the pool and could see the fireworks at night and a random falcon on a balcony on the opposite tower. Had dinner at the Palms Breeze restaurant one night and it was very good with excellent service. Small Disney store on site with some toiletry items available. Exit hotel and turn left to Downtown Disney, it is a 7 min. walk with a very nice path with trees and flowers along the way. I have a daughter with a disability and this was no big deal for her to walk. Turn right when exiting hotel for a 10 min. walk to a shopping plaza with restaurants (Chevy’s, Uno pizzeria and some fast food), grocery store (expensive but convenient) and for those from Ontario there is alcohol (wine and beer) in this grocery store, hard liquor is in the store next door. Had dinner at Chevy's for an excellent Mexican meal. Inquire at hotel concierge as they had 20% discount cards on meal. Also ate at Uno pizza which was good as well. There is a free shuttle that takes you to Downtown Disney and runs starting at 6 p.m. only and pick up is in front of the Pleasure Island sign. Free shuttle to all Disney parks is convenient. No shuttle to Universal so we took a cab to get there that cost $30 one way. There is a shuttle that goes to the Outlet mall at 10:30 and 1:30 but you must inform front desk to have it come by. We went to the Florida Mall for shopping, very expensive cab ride to go there (not worth it). This was our first visit to Orlando and we were very impressed by the friendliness of everyone we encountered on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Londonandrew007
Reviews.Content: The Holidayinn is actually a suprisingly good hotel. Let's face it, if you're not staying in a Disney property, you won't have extra magic hours, and transport will usually be a problem. Not with this hotel (and indeed the others in Lake Buena Vista). They have a dedicated resort bus which makes trips to Magic Kingdom, Downtown Disney and Epcot / Animal Kingdom. The buses go by every half an hour or so, so you're not too disadvantaged by not having a Disney bus. If you want to use the Disney transportation system (useful during the morning / late night when the bus is really full) Downtown Disney is a 10 minute walk away, and from here you can get connecting buses to all the resorts (but not to the parks). But most of the resorts are pretty close to the parks: To go to Magic Kingdom take the bus to: Grand Floridian, Contemporary or Polynesian To go to Epcot take the bus to: The Yacht and Beach To go to Animal Kingdom: Animal Kingdom lodge. The rooms are very comfortable with a fridge, microwave and tv. The room size is bigger than some Disney resort rooms. Plus there is a good supply of towels and cosmetics in the bathroom. Coffee is provided. The Swimming pool has a great character and there's a good area to lounge in. You can also have your Disney park purchases delivered direct to the hotel for free. The concierge desk provides cheap-priced park tickets. So I suggest you check the prices before you commit! Now the downside... The fitness centre is really disappointing; it has several running machines and a dumbell rack and that's it. So if you want to excercise, I suggest enquiring at the Hilton (next door) to see if you can use their gym. Also, late night food is a problem. I was back at the hotel by 12.15 one evening and they told me they couldn't make any food after 12. This is a problem because there are no restaurants open later than 12 ish in the area. The nearest restaurant is a good 20 minute (and several complicated crossings) away in the area known as the Crossroads. It would be really helpful if they offered some form of late night menu. There is a small shop on site, but it was prohibitively expensive. A pint of milk cost us $2.40. Arguably the most expensive milk we've ever bought! Overall the staff are friendly and very knowledgeable about the local area. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mommytravelplanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn because we had points for a free stay. I was pleasantly surprised as how easy it was to walk to Downtown Disney and how nice the area was with all the trees. The hotel and room was very clean. The shuttle buses were great and we used them to go to all 4 Disney parks. Te buses only stop at four hotels (the Holiday Inn is #2 on the route and even going to the second park the bus stopped at, the ride was no longer than 30 minutes). The breakfast buffet was tasty and a good deal if you have kids eating for free. I would definitely recommend staying here and I hope we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: Joanne B
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay, Alex and Chebiliz at the front desk were hospitable, friendly and full of knowledge. They gave us a lot of helpful information. Jorge, as our server was both friendly and thoughtful. He went above and beyond to ensure we had an enjoyable dinner. All of the staff were extremely pleasant, always offering us to enjoy our stay, making our visit a pleasant and relaxing experience. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good but over-rated”
Reviews.Author: DrEitan
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and yes, new...which is very helpful. Noise level was excellent and the bed was great.They could have touched up a few areas in the bathroom like paint off the wall, etc. The commode was not flushing and I had reported it and I think they fixed but no one left me a message. Elevator was fast. Breakfast was good- we have had better for the same price of $15 per adult. I wish they honored my request for a free upgrade and to have a room with a view towards Downtown Disney. The management never followed up and it was not a busy or high season week. I would not stay here again but it was clean. Downtown Disney is not next door! Its a good walk if you have a family with kids at least 20 minutes with kids with stroller.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Clean, Convenient, Overall Pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: craig0581
Reviews.Content: From arrival, Parking is easy, hotel staff is friendly, courteous and very helpful. The food in the little restaurant by the lobby is wonderful, we ate there as we were early for check-in. A few times that week we went back for a bite to eat and enjoyed it just as much! The pool is wonderful for children as I never saw it empty, always were friends to be made for the little one. The rooms, halls, bathrooms were very clean, well taken care of. I liked that it was located IN Disney, but is a bit away from all of the hustle and bustle of the parks such as Epcot, Magic Kingdom etc. I like to be around the amusement park action during the day, but I also like to relax at night and step a bit outside of it all. MONEY SAVER TIP: Right up the street (where you came in at the light) There is a supermarket (Goodlngs) straight ahead where we bought bottled water, a styro-foam cooler for the car, milk, cereal, plastic bowls and spoons for breakfast. We would fill a bag with ice each morning on the way out to the car and put it in the cooler with a few bottles of water for each day. The parks charge $2.50 per bottle, we got 24 bottles for $3.00 at the store.

Reviews.Title: “5N stay at the Holiday Inn Buena Vista, Disney World, Orlando”
Reviews.Author: NareshShanbhag
Reviews.Content: A satisfying stay at the Holiday Inn Buena Vista, Disney world, Orlando. Clean & well maintained rooms. Courteous and friendly staff. Notable among them - the bartender (don't recall his name - balding chap, friendly and if i recall right with some arm bands). Cheers to the Summer Ale !! As also the friendly information & assistance provided by the attendant outside the hotel - Gilbert and the 2 lovely ladies - the lovely Morrocan lady and the lady Pullela and the chap John in the Coffee shop - Palms. Was absolutely delighted to see the Mickey shaped pancake !!! :-) Limited choice of food in the restaurant. But then i guess, most guests eat out at other specialty restaurants outside. Nice, clean rooms. very well managed and maintained. The pools and jacuzzi looked very, very inviting but unfortunately did not find the time to make use of the facility. The room tariff's were a tad higher than what i would have wanted it to be but then no regrets....see next reviewed hotel where i had to stay as i could not get the internet booking for another 2 nights that i wanted after a few days stay elsewhere (on the official segment of my trip)....that not-so-happy experience happened 4 days later at the Best Western Buena Vista. Overall experience - good will i want to go there again - absolutely !!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Disney area”
Reviews.Author: macbethLivingston
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel right next to the Hilton. Rooms spacious and very clean, beds comfortable. Downtown Disney Marketplace within a 10-minute walk. Shuttle buses to WDW stop at hotel, but we used cabs ($22 each way) to get to Magic Kingdom because that bus was sporadic. Breakfast buffet ($9.95) included scrambled eggs, oatmeal, pancakes and waffles, juice and coffee, muffins, bagels and breads, sausages and bacon and fresh fruit -- great value. Hotel has 8 floors; rooms are accessed by a glass elevator allowing you to see the courtyard below. Ice and soda machines are on odd-numbered floors. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - nice renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: GenPQ
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, nice staff, fully renovated and clean hotel. Great for families. The new pool is very nice. My only negative comment would be that the pool water was cold compared to other hotels we stayed in. Other than that great location within short walking distance of Downtown Disney. Convenient (and cheap) self-parking. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Disney world Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Justin5570
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort just 10 mins walk from dowtown disney, great pool and cafe. Shuttle buses to the 4 Disney worlds leave very 30 mins. Great quiet rooms overlooking the pool and Disney. Great place for the family to relax at between our days at disney and universal.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lynnday
Reviews.Content: There for tow show. Very convenient staff very helpful. In fact Paul in Valet Parking was very helpful I told him I forgot my phone charger and needed to get into my car to charge phone. He asked what kind I told him and he had charger I needed and loaned it to me . How nice! The room was nice and bed very comfortable. Not fancy but very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “More than your average Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: pgwill
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable and well run hotel with the great advantage of being within walking distance of the shops, restaurants and bars of Downtown Disney. Breakfast is available at reasonable prices and wifi is free. The only irritant was the charge for self parking ($10 per day). The room itself was not particularly cheap but it was probably good value for a hotel located on WDW property at the height of Spring Break. We were in Orlando to watch Braves Spring Training and the drive to their ballpark could not have been easier, and obviously to all the Disney parks as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: ftoman
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and close to Downtown Disney. We had just spent 6 days in a Disney hotel so had become used to the easy transport to the parks. If like us you do not know the area just be aware that the main parks (apart from typhoon lagoon) are about 25 minutes away in the bus. One thing that was possible here and not so easy in the Disney hotel was access to free shuttles to the outlet malls which we used to fill a case. Staying with kids and would recommend eating in the hotel rather than Downtown Disney as it is cheaper and much better quality (especially with the kids eat free)

Reviews.Title: “Fantasmic”
Reviews.Author: Graham J
Reviews.Content: We satyed here in May 2011 for 2 weeks to celebrate our anniversary, the hotel is great and so close to downtown disney, the staff were all very friendly and the room was nice and clean and modern. We are going back in June 2012 for 16 nights as we liked it so much and the price is very reasonable compared to disney hotels like Port Orleans. I have recomended this place to our friends because we loved it and all the staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: This is in a nice location right next to Downtown disney. We walked over and it was about 10 minutes. They offer buses to the parks and downtown disney. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help you. We were given adjoining rooms as requested and check in was easy. The rooms are basic Holiday Inn rooms and the pool is a basic holiday inn pool, but everything was clean. If you plan to spend all your time at the Disney Resort I might suggest staying on the Disney Property but if you plan to take in other Orlando theme parks this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: mricciomack
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and his son (15, boy) visited Florida during April school vacation week. We are typically a Disney World family but this time my husband really wanted to see the new Harry Potter attraction at Universal Hollywood Studios and I also wanted to spend a day relaxing at the ocean. So we flew into Tampa (cheaper than Orlando, especially during school vacation week) and spent a few days in Tampa and a few days in Orlando. To get my Disney "fix" I booked a hotel on Disney property but not one of the Disney themed resorts. The Holiday Inn at Lake Buena Vista turned out to be a very short walk to Downtown Disney, allowing us to walk over at night and browse the shops. The Staff: All the staff we encountered at this hotel were extremely nice. We were pleased with the level of service we received here. The atmosphere: The atmosphere was very average at this resort. According to the website the hotel had recently been renovated but we saw no signs of that. It wasn't in bad shape but, again, nothing really stood out to me as new or different; it was all quite average. The room: We had a standard room with two double beds, one bathroom. The beds were fine...after a long day at the park I don't typically have a problem sleeping at night. The bathroom was very disappointing. There was NO storage. The sink had an open bottom that was filled with clean towels and there was very little counter space. We stored most of our toiletries outside of the bathroom and had nowhere to put our clothes to get dressed after our showers. The worst part was NO towel racks other than the one where a bunch of clean towels were hung. There was lots of empty wall space so plenty of places to put towel racks but none were there. As a result our room was cluttered with drying towels. Extremely, extremely annoying! Amenities: There was a basic fitness room, a large outdoor pool and a hot tub. The pool and hot tub were clean and we spent a nice afternoon lounging in the sun. It was quiet, as not many people were staying there (as far as we could tell). There was onsite parking but the cost to park was $10 per day ($16 per day for valet). Charging to park at a hotel does not impress me one bit so that was a huge turn-off. The hotel also has an onsite Disney store and they sell park tickets. I believe there is also a free shuttle to and from all the Disney parks but we were not going there so did not use it. Dining: Breakfast was not included in the room rate (another thing I was not impressed with....at least include a continental breakfast!). There is a restaurant (called Palm Breezes, I believe) and they serve breakfast, lunch and supper. They also have an indoor bar area for a quick bite and a store with snacks. The buffet breakfast is $14.95pp and the continental is $9.95pp. The food was all right, nothing special. The gentleman cooking up the omelets was very nice. Overall this hotel was quite average. Other than the great proximity to Downtown Disney there is nothing about this hotel that stands out and we probably will try another hotel in the same area next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: chrisha1627
Reviews.Content: i stayed there feb 15 through 17 and the valet outside and front desk clerk was so nice, upbeat and helpful. Spencer checked me in and out and he was so sweet. His friendly smile made my family feel welcomed after a long 8 hour drive! we r coming back in June and i cant wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fab location and good price”
Reviews.Author: finnrb
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to Disney but not pay the high prices of staying on site then Holiday Inn DTD is worth a try. This hotel is located a 5 minute walk from DTD and easily accessible for SeaWorld and Universal. The hotel is located very close to loads of good reasonably priced restaurants. There are a few supermarkets close by, within walking distance, Winn Dixie being the one with the biggest range of goods and most reasonable price. Walgreens pharmacy is close by too for all medicines and toiletries, they also have a small range of foods. For those of you with a car there is a Super Walmart a 5 mins drive away up Turkey Lake Rd. It is an expensive taxi ride and cost approx $20 each way in May 2011. Saving Tip - if planning to shop at Winn Dixie, when you go to the store register for a saver card, this entitles you to money off certain items and 2 for 1 etc on items. Definately worth using and it doesnt cost anything. The Holiday Inn is close to the I4 making it easy to find from Orlando International Airport, also very easy from Sanford. Hotel Info The hotel has good sized rooms with 2 queen size beds or 1 king size bed. We had a kingsize bed. Comfy beds, choice of pillows. Rooms v clean and nice and light. Rooms had sliding doors onto balcony which alot of hotels in Orlando don't have. For me a bonus as i love to open these in the morning and get fresh air. Some rooms are in the tower part of the main building, other located in the lower building around the pool. There is a nice pool, quite large with water fountains. It does have a zero entry section too. Towels are provided. The toilets around the pool are nice and clean. Kids eat free in the main restaurant with an adult, however not in the bar or room service. It is the same menu regardless of where you eat so it is a bit of a strange rule. Good food at a decent price, good breakfast buffet options. The hotel is served by the DTD hotel shuttle buses which take you to each park every half hour. The shuttle also goes to DTD. A variety of good value restaurants are within 10 minutes walking distance, Chillis, Steak n Shake, Orlando Ale House, Dennys, IHOP, Olive Tree, Burger King, Fuddruckers, Sweet Tomatoes, Cicis, to name but a few.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Thorn054
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3-nights during a recent trip to the Orlando area. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Downtown Disney (about 10-minutes or so) so it's a great place to stay if you plan to spend any time there. The hotel is clean, the rooms were comfortable and the pool area was nice. We also found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They also have a free shuttle service to the parks (though we never used it). I can't comment on the frequency of the shuttles but people seemed to be using it. We ate dinner one night in the restaurant (burgers, etc) and it took quite a while to get the food. Maybe it was a bad night for them but it seemed like an exceptionally long wait. I'd recommend that you skip eating there because there are plently of places to eat in Downtown Disney or in other areas nearby (albeit--you'll need to drive to those other eating spots--it would be kind of a long walk to some of them). You should be aware that they do charge you to part your car (around $10 bucks a night--more for valet parking). Overall, it was a good experience. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms, lovely property, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: job86
Reviews.Content: Hassle free stay at the Holiday Inn. Amazing value for money! Well appointed rooms - very clean! Great room service breakfast! Free shuttle was very useful and close proximity to Downtown Disney was appreciated. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: litchfield1959
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and the online room rate. The reviews were right on target. My top priorities in a hotel are cleanliness, location and customer service. The rooms were spotlessly clean and included a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The beds were very comfortable and had a choice of soft or firm pillows which I thought was a nice touch for a moderately priced hotel. The bathroom was a good size with plenty of space for toiletries and had plenty of fluffy towels. Nice pool area. Everything was in very good condition - bed linens, carpet, drapes, furniture, etc. - no spots or stains on anything. Rooms were very quiet. All the employees we encountered were pleasant and friendly and went out of their way to help. We loved the location - about a 10-15 minute very pleasant walk to Downtown Disney. This hotel is in a very nice area with about 5 or 6 other hotels and is conveniently located right off of I-4. They have free buses that run to all 4 Disney parks all day long, coming about every 30 minutes. We loved not having to drive our car to the parks - we saved the daily parking fee and were dropped off close to the entrance. Overall a very nice hotel and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and value!”
Reviews.Author: juliekenben
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for a quick trip to Disney and Sea World. I did a lot of research prior to booking this hotel and it was perfect for our needs. From the beginning, the valet staff were outstanding. Alex was very helpful during our entire stay. The check-in staff was very accomodating. We requested Downtown Disney view and had great rooms and were able to see the fireworks at night. Our rooms were spotless and even though we were there at the busiest season, it was quiet. We got a great package on the Marriott website. The breakfast was delicious. Great omelet station and Mickey waffles. The staff was so friendly. We ended up eating dinners in the restaurant as well, very relaxing after busy days in the parks. The pool was very nice for our 6 year old daughter. The hot tub was ok, but not too bubbly. The location is close to Downtown Disney - drove once and took the shuttle once. The shuttles to Disney were as expected - every 30 minutes. It was a little hectic a few times, but I expected that as we were there during the busiest time of year. The Disney store was fantastic. We bought our tickets here. I would not hesitate to return here myself and hope to. I would also highly recommend this location to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise - location, service, value”
Reviews.Author: johnsonevv
Reviews.Content: I used Hotwire to find a hotel close to Walt Disney World, but not a Disney property. Good rate and it was the Holiday Inn on Hotel Plaza Blvd. Friendly and helpful staff - even the parking attendants are friendly. Every staff person I saw was friendly and hoped I had a nice day. The pool is wonderfully warm with zero-entry as well as a lap pool. Loved it! Breakfast options at the hotel were more than adequate. Even with the families there it was not noisy at all - only heard the baby next door once and hall noise only once. We were by the elevator in the Tower and never heard it. Room was clean and plenty big. Bed was comfortable. Hot water and water pressure were good. Only bathroom complaint is the small counter area near the sink, but it is a minor inconvenience. Parking was plentiful and only $10 a day with unlimited in & out. The bus to the WD parks was an unexpected joy - saved $14 parking at the parks and gave you door to door service. The t.v. resets itself to the Disney station and comes on VERY LOUD; so, be ready to hit the volume button immediately. Also, the timer feature didn't work on our particular set. While this is not a luxury hotel, it is a nice clean hotel with amenities at a good price in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: Melody H
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent last night at this hotel and were pleasantly surprised! Well-priced, CLEAN and everyone was very professional and happy to help. Beds super comfy, too!!! My only negative remark would be about the pool. The pool area itself was very nice, but the pool really needed to be skimmed. It was quite breezy and a lot of mulch, leaves and bees were floating in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and service excellent!”
Reviews.Author: flipflops53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week of March. My wife has a bad back and she picked this place based on previous reviews about the comfortable beds. She said she thought she was sleeping at home every night. Pool was heated and very warm. Water felt great. Rooms were clean and modern. The service staff was very friendly and really acted like they wanted to assist you in any way. The shuttle busses to Disney World ran every half hour and were very nice. We had a great relaxing stay and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place - great value”
Reviews.Author: Rorysmomma
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here, while my husband had a conference in the area. While we usually stay in Marriott hotels ( cuz we have the marriott visa), this Holiday Inn was more convienent. I was a bit skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised. IT was a lovely hotel - super good food in the restaurant downstairs. The pool was very nice - and super sunny. The only negative was the water was really warm, since it was such a warm spring. There is an outdoor shower though, to cool off if necessary. The staff was very hepful and the rooms were great. The Beds were VERY comfortable too. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: maureen04958
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in March and enjoyed it very much. The Hotel has undergone a renovation and it is very nice and the the rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. The pool area was also very nice and clean. The staff were great and I think it is an excellent value. The hotel has free shuttle to all the Disney attractions and you can even get a free shuttle to the local outlet stores for those who like to do a little shopping. I would have no hesitation to stay here again and would certainly recommend it to anyone visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Greg7931767
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights for a quick Disney World trip. The hotel is very well kept. The rooms and common areas were clean and had a pleasant smell. The customer service was very good. Everyone was knowledgeable and attentive. We drove ourselves to Downtown Disney the first evening we were there - big mistake. It took us about 30 mintues to park. You can easily walk there in that amount of time. There is a sidewalk that you can use for this, and several people were seen using it during the weekend, especially at night. We had an early dining reservation at Chef Mickey's one morning and used a taxi. The valet was great in helping us get a taxi and everything went smoothly. We utilized the shuttle for everything else. The shuttle does have its downside: waiting, very full buses. But it beats all of the alternatives in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: Caroline M
Reviews.Content: It was good for two nights but I wouldn't stay there for anymore than 3. If you are spending a week long trip to Disney and want to stay off the property for prices, I would just spend the extra money and book a Disney hotel. More cleanliness and better service. Nice for Holiday Inn though. Also watch out for high prices on little things. The walking distance to downtown Disney is great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: dklondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and used it as our base for Seaworld, Aquatica, Universal Studios and Orlando Premium Outlets. Everything was within 15 minutes drive, and there is a great restaurant area (Crossroads) about 5 mins away from the hotel with everything from McDonalds to Red Lobster, so all tasted are covered. The hotel is basic but clean, and the staff were very helpful (especially Crystal, who was very friendly and efficient with checking us in, and also excellent when dealing with a very difficult guest that I observed from a distance during my stay). Overall, a good value stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel near Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: WCox
Reviews.Content: We live in Tampa and wanted to see Cindy Lauper perform at the House of Blues in Downtown Disney. Traveling back home at te wee hours of the morning after parting and drinking didn't sound right. We stayed here at the Holiday Inn because it was just five minutes from Downtown Disney and at that time recently remodeled. It's always cool to stay at a brand new place. The lobby looked great and the rooms were fantastic. We got two connecting rooms with pool view. So we saw Cindy Lauper, went back to our rooms and crashed, then next day we spent the day at Downtown Disney again (yeah we like it). I will be coming back next summer. This was a much nicer hotel than the Dolphin Hotel near Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was outstanding. The room was very large and comfortable. The breakfast buffet and omelet station was incredible! Within easy walking distance of Downtown Disney but there was also a free shuttle service. My family will plan to book this hotel again next year!

Reviews.Title: “not so great this time around”
Reviews.Author: hotelguide1950
Reviews.Content: still a very clean hotel, but poor service , no pool towels saturday and sunday , went to reception, they said they were drying them had to wait for some time ,not all the balconies are good most have a four foot six wall, so you have to stand up to see the view, as a holiday inn priority ,gold member, i was supposed to get express checkin, did'nt get it or the daily newspaper, but the worst is the $12 a day self parking , at a $150 a night it should be free,

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was in early March 2012. We've stayed right on Disney property in the past so we were a little apprehensive as to the convenience of this hotel. We stayed 9 nights and right from the time we arrived until our departure we can't say enough about this Hotel. All the staff was so pleasant and accommodating but our biggest bouquet MUST go to Manney, Chief Chef and his crew. They were outstanding. Every morning we were greeted with such hospitality that it made the start of each day great. Manney never failed to take a few minutes of his very busy day to come out and chat to find out our plans and wish us well. As an added bonus kids under twelve eat free with their parents. On Saturday night when the Hotel was completely booked the restaurant staff ran their legs off trying to accommodate everyone and did a great job considering they were short staffed. The quality of the food was in no way compromised even under these stressful circumstances. My grandson left his DS case in the restaurant and it was taken to security and locked up until we finally realized it was missing. Everyone at this Hotel was so professional and caring right from Valet to the staff in the Gift Shop. They even sell Disney Theme Park tickets, same price but you can avoid the long lineups at the parks. The Housekeeping Supervisor, Josue and his staff were incredible and we "THANK YOU Josue" for going the extra mile on the Saturday night when our adjoining room needed extra attention. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION...just a few blocks from Downtown Disney. There is bus transportation; however it's only a 5-8 minute walk even with kids. The Disney Theme Park buses arrive every half hour at the Hotel and are always on schedule, Our biggest joy was finding the rooms so spacious and CLEAN with a fridge, microwave and safe so you don't have to carry all your valuables with you. One suggestion for the Tower Rooms would be to hang a longer rod in the closet area. We can't wait to return; maybe we can spend more time at the lovely pool. THANK YOU ALL for your wonderful home away from home! The C & T Cdn. families

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: wpgwinner
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 7 nights. We were given a free upgrade to a downtown view room. The view was ok (not worth paying extra for if though). The room had a small balcony. The room was clean and comfortable. It is a great alternative to staying at a WDW resort. You get the shuttle to the parks for free. The front desk staff are fantastic. The boys working concierge were great. The cleaning staff were always friendly...in fact, everyone at the hotel was very friendly. The only reason I did not give a rating of 5 was because I found the buffet waitresses to be lacking in service. We ate there every morning so this began to irritate me. Once the hostess seats you, a waitress brings you one beverage then you never see her again. No refills, no plates cleared.So what would I be tipping on? As I said, this occurred every day. Every day I would ask for a refill on orange juice. If they remembered to bring it, it would come 10-15 min later. Perhaps the Holiday Inn could look at a self service juice area to avoid this issue. Otherwise, a fantastic stay. I would highly recommend it. Pros: Service of everyone except wait staff in restaurant was fantastic Friendly, pleasant rooms and hotel are clean, no wait times for elevators pool is just a basic no frills pool but my 7 yr old loved it Cons: limited menu in restaurant--look at eating out Laundry-aweful...try to avoid. $4.50 for wash, $3.00 for dry. Located in separate building, no chair provided in the laundry area so you either have to take your chances with leaving your clothes and walking back to your building or stand and wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Theresa W
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 9 nights. Room was clean, well maintained, and spacious for our family of four. Ask for a room facing away from the freeway as it is noisy. The kids enjoyed the heated pool (that was actually warmer than the hot tub) and the fitness facility was adequate. Restaurant was good, particularly the kids eat free feature, but was often busy at breakfast. Staff were very friendly and responsive. Shuttles to Disneyland were reliable, but would have really appreciated shuttles to other theme parks. The hotel is a 10 minute walk away from Downtown Disney along well kept pathways (great for running too). Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelIntl
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 5 nights. The room is spacious, clean, and comfortable. The bathroom is small but adequate. We asked for and got a room with balcony overlooking the pool, which was nice. We didn't use the pool as we were busy at the Disney parks every day. We did have dinner twice at the restaurant and it was pretty good. Our rate included breakfast for two, and we bought additional breakfast buffets. The buffet is priced at $14.95 which is a little high. The omelettes and Mickey waffles were good. One morning, we came down for breakfast at about 10 am and all the bagels and pineapple were gone and not replenished. Our biggest disappointment were the shuttle buses. They come every 30 minutes. We were there during Spring Break and the buses were crowded. It would have been better if they had more buses running during the peak times. Also, the buses don't go to Downtown Disney until after 6 pm. Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel. We'd stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: jules0497
Reviews.Content: I do not often post on Trip Advisor but had to share my thoughts about this wonderful hotel. My 14 year old daughter and I spent 3 nights at the hotel and could not have asked for more. Over the past 10 plus years we have stayed at one of the onsite WDW properties. I stayed at this hotel for a business trip in September and given the positive experience I had decided to give it a try for a pleasure trip. I am so glad I did. From the moment I checked in I felt welcomed. The employees were kind, professional and made sure that all of our needs were met. The hotel, including the rooms is clean and modern. The room is well appointed and offers a microwave, fridge, safe and coffee maker. We had a balcony and it was so nice to sit outside and relax. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel has a lovely pool that never seemed too crowded or noisy. You could order drinks or food if you desired to. We did eat breakfast at the restaurant 2 days and got a to-go breakfast at the take and go area. They offered yogurt, cereal etc. It was perfect. My biggest worry prior to staying was the shuttle service to the parks. This turned out to not be a problem at all. The shuttles were reliable and once you knew the times they would come you could plan accordingly (get there about 5 -10 minutes prior to be safe) and it was no problem at all. We always had a seat and while the trip to and from the parks varied timewise it was never extreme or problematic. The walk to Downtown Disney is not very far at all. There is nice path to walk on and it took no more then 10 minutes. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. It is evident the employees (from the valets, to the front desk, to the housekeeping staff, to the restaurant folks) love working at the hotel and their happiness shows by the way they treat their guests. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good food and comfy”
Reviews.Author: spikey27
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here from March 9, 2012 thru March 18, 2012 and had a great time. Since we stayed more than 7 nights, we were offered to pay $10 more at booking and that would include daily breakfast and kids under 12 eat for free. The breakfast in the Palm Breeze restaurant was buffet style with made-to-order omelets and Mickey Mouse waffles, fresh fruits, pastries, yogurt, toast, bagels, cold/hot cereals, bacon, sausage, potatoes, eggs, pancakes, french toast, and corned beef hash. It was a great deal for us. Our server most days was Edwin and he was great. (We also had dinner here one night and it was good too) In fact the entire staff was helpful and very friendly from valet to the check-in people. The room was clean, nice and the bed was comfy. We stayed on the 12th floor and never had a problem with noise. We did not have a car so the free shuttle worked very well for us. The hotel was the second stop on the "A" route which serves 4 hotels so even though it was Spring Break, we always had room when the bus picked us up. Two buses come every 30 minutes beginning 1 hour before park opening and then 1 1/2 hours after parks close. One bus runs to EPCOT and Animal Kingdom and the other runs to Magic Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. It was a 5-10 min walk to Downtown Disney and if you walk 15-20 minutes in the opposite direction you'll find a grocery store and many other dining options. It's also close to Universal Studios, we just had to schedule a separate shuttle for that. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property.”
Reviews.Author: jayshaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to see a concert at House of Blues in Downtown Disney. Very clean, well-kept property. Both days we were there, numerous members of the maintenance crew were busy with various tasks from washing the baseboards in the hallways, to touching up paint. Not enough hotels keep up with basic maintenance like these days, so this was nice to see. We had a small snag after we checked in (we arrived at our given room with our luggage to find it was still being cleaned). A member (supervisor, perhaps) of the housekeeping crew immediately made a phone call to the front desk, and escorted us to another comparable room and let us in. Keys to the new room were delivered ten minutes later. This would have earned the hotel a 4-star rating, but the keys were delivered with $30 in comp certificates for the bar/restaurant/snack shop...5-star rating is restored. Nice to see a management staff that knows how to take care of snags when they happen. The room was nice; balcony overlooking the pool and very clean. Had a late dinner in the bar after our concert that night, which was good--above average for a late-night menu in a smallish hotel. I would definitely stay again if in the area. Great value for a hotel within a short walk to Downtown Disney, and a good alternative to the giant resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: notseniorsyet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days in Feb. Our flight was late and I was crabby but from the moment the valet met the car I was soothed. We got an upgrade without even asking to a pool view room. Everything in it was clean and fresh. The bed was so comfy. The room safe was large enough for our laptop and other sundry electronics.There was a microwave and fridge. We used the fridge for drinks mainly as there is so much good dining in the area and in the hotel too. We had purchased the bed and breakfast package. The buffet was excellent with a wide variety of foods. The omelette /waffle bar was great too. I loved the Mickey waffle. It was a terrrific way to start the day for your trip to the parks. We usually had dinner at Disney or Downtown Disney but we did eat dinner in the restaurant one night and it was really good. We used to stay at another hotel on this street but this will be our "go to" hotel from now on. When the staff ask you how you are they mean it and really seem invested in your stay so you can enjoy it. I can't say there was any part of our stay I didn't like.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ryanpmoore24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as my wife and I came in a couple days before our cruise departed. We wanted to take in some of the Disney vibe before hitting the Bahamas. I will say that I was a little disappointed in this hotel. After reading the other tripadvisor comments I was expecting greatness, not mediocrity. Upon arrival I asked for a room with a Disney view. Although I'm a Priority Rewards Club member, they told me it would be an extra $30 a night for that room so we declined. What we got was a small room with no balcony and a view of a parking lot. I've stayed in many hotels either in or just outside of Disney, and the room we were in at the Holiday Inn is probably the smallest we've stayed in. In addition, the bathroom offers very limited space. I will say that the beds are comfortable and the overall decor of the room is nice. The hotel offers little visual appeal for Disney enthusiasts. If you want the Disney vibe, I would suggest going somewhere else. If you're looking for a good location inside Disney without the Disney ambiance, then this may be a good option. The location of this hotel is what sells it, but other than that it's pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy, great breakfast, great location.”
Reviews.Author: lovenaples1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights. This was the best overall deal I could find in downtown Disney. Other reviewers were right about getting a room away from the highway. We chose a poolview room and it was perfect. Nice and quiet. The pool was very clean and so warm! Hottub was nice, too. We had great drinks in the bar at a really good price. The best thing, though, was the breakfast buffet. Not your typical buffet; the chef's eggs made to order were awesome. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RiMac925
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and can highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious, with mini-fridge and microwave..staff is friendly and helpful. Great location, only a few minutes to Disney, and close to Crosswinds Plaza, which features a 24 hr grocery and wide array of places to eat.. Hotel offers a nice breakfast, and kids eat free. We enjoyed the heated pool, too. The Disney Store on-site sells the park tickets. A small store offers quick, pick up to go items like cereals and yogurt parfaits.Great value!

Reviews.Title: “So close and so good”
Reviews.Author: rogersowerby
Reviews.Content: What a find-A very clean welcoming hotel only minutes to the magic Kingdom..Our Son and family were staying inside the Kingdom but we wanted something reasonable .This hotel was GREAT, only a few minutes to WDW and close to shopping and highways. Very clean and quiet. We Stayed twice in two weeks and will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “did not meet expectation”
Reviews.Author: aniram648
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is very nice and clean, but nothing special. Downtown Disney walking distance is pretty long if you are walking with 5yo and its 88 degree outside. The worse part of our trip was the food. the breakfast "deal" is$10 or $15 for something that you get including in a price at most hotels in the Disney area. Lunch and dinner options are very poor and tasteless. There is a Crpossroad Plaza with the restorants, but the walking distance is not for little kids. recomendation: If you driving- find something cheaper, but with the breakfast and restorants around the hotel. if you depend on transportation- shop around, there is more hotels with better offers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 6cathy
Reviews.Content: we payed for the standard room,and when we arrive we were very happy . the room had 2 queen beds, a fridge, and a microwave. the pool is great... heated. every one is very helpful. the hotel is only a 5 min walk to downtown disney

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Klgma
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel specifically because it claimed to be "steps from Downtown Disney" and while it is one of only 7 hotels in the area, you probably won't be able to walk to Downtown Disney. It's quite a distance away and you'll have to cross a very busy road and navigate a huge parking lot - better to just drive and park closer. And if you're going to do that, then you'll want to stay somewhere nicer than this Holiday Inn. There's nothing exceptional in this hotel and as a budget friendly option you'll see plenty of school groups staying here, with the associated noise and commotion in the common areas. I was expecting something nicer, would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5min walk to downtown disney”
Reviews.Author: Irish G
Reviews.Content: This hotel has brand new rooms w/microwave, fridge, flat screen, and balcony. Rooms from the 6th floor and up can see fireworks (with pool view). There are sidewalks to downtown disney which is 5min away. The hilton is directly next door and much more $$. The bartender Donna at the holiday inn is awesome, she runs the show and serves up awesome drinks and great dinner! Great hotel for families with nice pool, arcade, washer and dryers on every other floor, and shuttles to all disney resorts. If you take the bus to the Magic kingdom it will take about 41min, thats b/c of the amount of stops and the bus drops you off at the monorail/boat dock to go from there. I guess this would be the same for any hotel shuttle, if you don't wan't to wait I would take a cab. This hotel is hands down the best we've stayed at on the strip of downtown disney.

Reviews.Title: “One of our all time favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: jski812
Reviews.Content: We have had to spend a lot of time in Orlando for both business and pleasure since this hotel reopened under the Holiday Inn name. We love it. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Ask for a disney view and you can watch the fireworks every night. The pool is spacious and warm. The breakfast is worth the price the eggs cooked to order, omelets and waffles are all delish. The staff is wonderful. From the front desk to the maintenance department. Very friendly and helpful. We have been here 4 times and will return at our first chance. Convenient to the parks and close to the marketplace and downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable-Clean-Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rhollisatl
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days to have access to DW and Universal. Convenient location to all parks. Walking distance to Downtown Disney and other restaurants. Very clean hotel and the staff was very friendly. Pool was great... Only negative was the bar is weak...limited selection, small pours.... this was a 4.5 star place..we would stay there again and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Disney on a "tighter" budget”
Reviews.Author: 1969kelly1990
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a great choice for us, a family of 4. The staff was super friendly and helplful. The rooms were very nice and well maintained. After a long day at the parks it was nice to go back to a well cleaned and comfortable room. The heated pool was a great relaxer for the kids. The restaurant had a delicious breakfast buffet. We didnt have to worry about parking at the parks, the shuttle takes you to each park. Very convenient. We would definitely stay here again (and we've stayed at Disney resorts the other 2 visits to Disney World). What a great way to save a little money--you'll need it in the parks!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Boston54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, wish I would have stayed here the other night since my other hotels weren't that good. The bathroom was a little small but no biggie. The beds were so comfy. You can valet park for i think 16$ and park your own for 10$. The bag man was so helpful bringing our bags up and making sure we had what we needed. The front desk was so helpful as well. I wasn't even going to disney but if you are this is a great location that isn't too much money. Oh and the pool was awesome. it was actually pretty cold out when I was there but the pool is heated so even thought it was like 54 outside i was still able to go swimming and not be cold besides running for your towel after :) I would recommend this place if i was going to disney or not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - great value for everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: WendyWN
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a hotel that provided reliable shuttles to the theme parks but without having to stay at an "official" Disney resort hotel. First of all, before we even arrived, Holiday Inn staff e-mailed me back regarding questions I had and I was a bit indecisive which view I wanted - whether I wanted the tower with DD view with balcony or a pool view was sufficient but also wanted to be nearby my sister who wanted the DD view in the tower - eventually Kelly helped me to book a 7 night breakfast rate for $139-149 rate/night with DD view with balcony during the busy President's week while my sister unfortunately who was not staying for 7 days paid a slightly higher rate per night with her AAA deal for same type of room. We were placed on the 9th floor and we had a view of the pool below us as well as the DD view. What's nice about being in the tower instead of the wing is that when you are on the inside, you can look down to the restaurant below. The staff is very friendly, always saying hello as you pass through, lobby is very bright and smells good. Check in was quick as no one else was there in front of us. Check out was easy too and they were able to make corrections as they accidentally charged us self parking fee when we had no car. I also was able to do late checkout by 2 PM b/c I was a priority club member. Guest services also helped arranged car service pickup to the airport. Cost of car service was $65 plus tip and able to use credit card for such. My sister used taxi that was metered and her trip back to airport cost $48 plus tip. Room/amenities: nice comfortable beds, refrigerator and microwave available, Bath and Body works shampoo/conditioner/body lotion provided, along with citrus mint bar soap and mint mouthwash. Rainforest alliance coffee and coffeemaker (not used). Rooms are clean. Bathroom shelf convenient - would have liked another towel bar besides the one towel bar and the hook provided. Nice flat screen TV. In-room safe a plus. Daily newspaper. Can hardly hear any noise from the other rooms. In room electronic thermostat - not noisy when A/C or heat is on. Used the pool one afternoon - it is moderately sized and heated - would have preferred that the spraying sprinklers were off on that windy day b/c it's cold to have water sprayed in your face - it's zero entry and goes as deep as about 4 feet 5 inches in the center. Also there is hot tub (not used). Towels are provided. It was never crowded. Also has fitness center and gift shop and grab and go food outlet and business center that we did not use. Food: buffet bkft was great - they make omelettes and Mickey mouse shaped pancakes to order, also the usual hot items: pancakes, toast, hash browns, bacon, sausage, corned beef hash, various cereals and pastries - I didn't always sit down for buffet but also can take items to go - they gave us 2 vouchers/day for bkft since I had the 7 day bkft rate and so only paid tip. We've also eaten dinner at the Palms Breeze restaurant for late night at 9 PM and the food was actually very good and reasonably priced, esp since the kids 12 and under eat free. We've also eaten lunch as well but had to sit in the bar b/c at the time we arrived, it was not busy so service in the bar to eat lunch was a bit slower but still reasonable b/c there was not the entire wait staff available. By the time we were done, we noticed that they did eventually open the main restaurant area for other to have lunch. Food choices are pretty good. Great option when we're too lazy to walk to Downtown Disney or when DD is very crowded. Definitely try the T-Rex (make advanced reservations), Earl of Sandwich and Wolfgang Puck Express. Shuttles: shuttles come about every 1/2 hour - supposed to come on the hour and half hour but hard to predict b/c sometimes they arrive 5 minutes after or even later. we are the 2nd stop with Hilton being picked up first and then followed by Royal Plaza and Doubletree suites. we are on Bus A. There is another Bus B that picks up 3 other hotels on the other side of Hotel Plaza Blvd. Most of the times, the shuttle buses does 2 drop offs to the theme parks: usually it's MK then DHS and the other bus goes to Epcot than AK. When dropping off to MK, it's really the TTC (transportation & ticket center) location which then you have to take either Monorail or ferry boat to actually get to MK. Other times, I've seen the buses only go to one park so it does vary. One time, Bus B also picked us up from theme park to go back to the Bus A hotels too. It seems that the buses are most crowded around the 9 and 9:30 AM times that sometimes it has to skip picking up at the other 2 last hotels so I think they have other back up plans for that. Pickup times at the theme parks are announced usually and pretty accurate. At times, I've seen the shuttles come to Epcot and then pick up from DHS before heading back to the hotels and not to AK so it seems which two parks they drop and pick up vary. Downtown Disney - the marketplace is about 8 minute walk with Hilton being the closest hotel to DD. They also have shuttle buses that go to DD starting at 6 PM but we've never taken such. At times, when we are already in Downtown Disney, we take the Disney transport buses to one of the Disney hotels and then take the monorail or buses to one of the theme parks so we don't have to walk back to our hotel to catch the shuttle. Plus the white Disney transport buses come more often at evey 20 minutes. Our buses are blue with a yellow oval that says Downtown Disney Resort Area so they are easy to spot from a distance. Overall, we loved our stay at this hotel and these Tripadvisor reviews did help me pick this hotel and I'm glad I did. I've stayed at Disney resort hotels twice in the past and in comparing cost/convenience - I think staying at the Holiday Inn was a better deal and experience - it's a moderate sized hotel so it has a cozy feel without feeling the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn = Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucas_2020
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience at this Holiday Inn Hotel. Everyone was always willing to help and did not expect anything in return. Their hotel staff always had a smile on their face and made it very pleasent to stay. They were willing to go up and beyond the call of duty for certain requests we had.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Barbaralee45251
Reviews.Content: The main reason I booked this hotel for our family (myself, husband and 79 year old father) vacation (5 nights) at Walt Disney World was its proximity to Downtown Disney and the reviews on this site. We knew about the $10 per night parking fee, so it was fine. We reserved an ECV from Scoot Orlando for my father and the hotel front desk brought it to us immediately upon check-in which was quick and easy. The rooms were exactly what I requested - 2 rooms next to each other, in the tower, Downtown Disney view (which as it turned out also had a great view of the pool - nice!). There was some noise from I-4 when sitting on the balcony, but it was not bad. You couldn't hear anything when the sliding door was closed. We used Disney buses during our stay to go to EPCOT, Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom (dad's a scooter expert, so he could back on the buses with no problem). In the evening we walked (dad scooted) to Downtown Disney for entertainment and dinner. It's only 10 minutes EASY walk to Downtown Disney. FANTASTIC. We only used the car twice to go to a store at Crossroads shopping strip-mall and dinner at Landry's which are 4 or 5 minutes away by car. The rooms were spotless. Housekeeping did a great job. Beds were very comfy!!! Bathroom has shelf under vanity and shelves behind door for storage. Staff was accommodating and super nice. The restaurant was adequate with a limited menu, the servers were very friendly. The gift shop staff was very helpful with maps and tips. Valet staff had good tips on getting around on the Disney Transportation system. All-in-all great value for the money and the location was FANTASTIC. I was very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights in Feb purely as a base to visit the WDW parks and we didn't want to hire a car. Location could not have been better. A 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney one direction and 10 minute walk in opposite direction to "Crossroads" which has a large selection of restaurants and a few shops including a Goodings supermarket (very expensive but cheaper than Disney parks). Half hourly shuttle bus to and from Disney Parks - very reliable and never had any problem getting a seat (Holiday Inn is 2nd pickup). Hotel was very pleasant, we were upgraded to a room overlooking Downtown Disney so had a fantastic view of the fireworks at Magic Kingdom and Epcot. Lovely outdoor pool which was heated to bath water temperature! Quite a poor selection in the hotel restaurant but this wasn't a problem due to proximity of nearby restaurants. Room was a good sized and perfectly clean - I never heard a peep from anyone in adjacent rooms and would say the soundproofing was excellent. Staff were very pleasant and helpful and we would definitely stay again if we were to visit Orlando again

Reviews.Title: “Convenience a plus”
Reviews.Author: NorthFlorida
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in the Walt Disney Resort provides free bus service to the Walt Disney theme parks. The hotel room was spacious with a comfortable bed. The bathroom had a shower which could use a good cleaning with clorox to remove black discoloration from the tile (couldn't tell if it was mold or just stained). The restaurant serves a decent breakfast, but lunch and dinner are below par. Eat elsewhere. Self park is $10.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: A H
Reviews.Content: We initially found the Holiday Inn at WDW on trip advisor. After staying at a Disney resort all 5 of my past visits, and being thoroughly disgusted the last 2 times, there was no way I was taking my family back. (They need some serious refurbishments) Was I nervous about staying off property for the first time? You bet! But the minute we pulled up I knew I had nothing to worry about, and I was right. I planned this trip for my 7 other family members, so there was a little pressure to do well :) The staff were more than accomodating, and extremely friendly! Everyone welcomed us back at the end of each day, and greeted us each morning as we headed out. We had adjoining rooms on the 5th floor of the wing building. It was great! The shuttles to the parks were exactly the same as the shuttles you get at the Disney resorts, except they are blue. Honestly, I felt like we were staying at a "mini-disney resort". It wasn't giant and loud and run down, it was small and quiet, and new and clean......and still offered most of the same perks as when staying on property. It was perfect for our trip. We will be back, for sure! I work at a hotel in the midwest, and we are known for our great, Mid-western hospitality. This is something that I am always looking for at other properties, and the staff at Holiday Inn at WDW definitely delivered! Kudos to a great staff and a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: edwards1970
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here last year for 18 nights only just got round to leave a review as i don't normally do this but i have to make an exception here the hotel was lovely really clean and modern. rooms were spacious enough room for the four of us and spotlessly cleaned daily the pool was perfect never to packed and clean. the staff were always polite and helpful but i must mention spencer as he was so helpful and a genuine gentlemen on the front desk great time had by all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: Scuba_girl81
Reviews.Content: Our first time at WDW staying in a non-Disney hotel. Room was very average with an exceptionally narrow shower, but we were pleased to see it was a shower and not a tub/shower. The transportation was very much like the buses for the Disney Hotels and took us where we needed to be. I was surprised to have to pay for parking, but we would have had to pay at Disney parks anyway.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Spring Lake Heights, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fourth time here.”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Lovely rooms, great staff, perfectly heated pool. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with omelettes and eggs cooked to order. It is centrally located and there are disney buses available. We come once a year for business sometimes twice a year. This is our fourth time here and we could not be happier. I am a Holiday Inn platinum member. I stay in many many properties each year and this ranks at the top of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Revisited”
Reviews.Author: Iaincsb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel last when it was a Courtyard by Marriott and was closed down for years by a Hurricane. It had just changed names to Holiday Inn. It has been completely gutted and rebuilt inside. I have to come clean and say at the outset that we stayed across the road BUT , and this is a big but, we have been using the hotel for breakfast and evening meals + the bar as it offered far better facilities than where we were staying. The staff (knowing this) have always been rally welcoming and cannot be faulted. There is free WiFi (for which we were give the code) + when we asked we were given a key card to a room to look round. The reason we have not been staying there is simply that our tour operator does not yet offer this hotel. It is a short walk from Down Town Disney. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with freindly staff:”
Reviews.Author: Deborah M
Reviews.Content: I looked at all of the hotels on line that were walking distance to Downtown Disney. Sometimes the pictures on the internet do not represent the rooms, and I did not feel comfortable making the reservations in advance due to the charges if I was not happy with the room. In fact, I would look at the pictures of the rooms at some of the hotels in that location and then call and ask about some of the amedies in the room and I was told some of the rooms were not the same as the pictures. I narrowed my choices down to two hotels and decided just to go in when we arrived in Orlando and ask if a room was available and to see the room before making a reservation. We stopped at two of the hotels when we arrived and the rooms at the first hotel was awful. It was not updated and it looked dirty. However, when we arrived at the Holiday Inn, we spoke to Chrystell at the desk and she gave us a great rate of $114.00 for a room for four nights with a balcony (great view of Downtown Disney) and the pool. Our room was updated and very large and so, so clean. The staff, (Chrystell and Ernie) were so friendly and did everything they could to make us happy during our stay. We were very pleased and would stay at this hotel again and again when we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: mauro p
Reviews.Content: Nice place, very nice employees. Near Disney Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: TRVLSWLL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a quick weekend trip to Orlando and wanted to stay near Downtown Disney to enjoy the restaurants and shops. This was perfect; newly renovated with modern updates, within walking distance to the Marketplace, and Disney park shuttle service every hour and half hour had we gone. Upon checking in, we were upgraded to a room with view of pool at no extra charge. The cost was very reasonable. We were impressed with our clean, updated room and with the renovations, the hotel looked brand new. Our room had a nice-sized balcony with chairs, LG tv, safe, refrigerator, and free wi-fi. I could definitely see us staying here again, especially when we bring our kids. They will enjoy the huge pool for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: cinnamongirl2
Reviews.Content: We searched high and low for a hotel within Disney resort that would not break the bank, accommodate my husband's business, and offered good food and friendly service. We got much more than we bargained for! If you don't like mega hotels that break the bank this hotel is for you. The rooms were very clean and bright. I am a frequent traveler for business as well, so one of the first things I check is the bath tub. It passed the test...no gross soap scum, but shiny clean :). We were so tired after long days at Disney that we ate at the restaurant three times. Twice for dinner, once for lunch. The pool is great and perfect for the little ones. The Disney shuttle picks you up and drops you off right at the door.....downtown Disney is a 5 minute walk. You can even buy your Disney tickets right there in the hotel because Disney employees work there and sell them. My husband could work and I could take my kids to Disney, no problem. We will stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service!”
Reviews.Author: MP1133
Reviews.Content: My organization recently held a conference at the HI Walt Disney World Resort and could not have been happier with the service we received. The staff was always pleasant and accommodating, timely and efficient... and they were patient and flexible with last-minute changes. They went above and beyond to serve those who had dietary concerns. The food was good, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. The only (minor) complaint was that it was a bit too cold in the meeting space.

Reviews.Title: “That little bit of class to add to your Disney holiday.”
Reviews.Author: dunk21
Reviews.Content: On arrival the Valet was very pleasant and informative. Reception staff were great and check in was quick and easy. The car park is designed so that you are never far away from the hotel so parking was quick also. The rooms were well fitted with a nice bath, fridge, safe, coffee machine and LCD tv. Our balcony overlooked the pool. The pool was very clean and is open til 11pm. Perfect for some relaxation after the parks. Breakfast was good and there was a generous selection including a cooking station for eggs, omelettes and waffles. The staff were pleasant at breakfast but not over friendly which I would expect within a hotel that is in the Disney resort. They seemed more business than pleasure. The shuttle bus to Disney is great and runs on the dot, no messing around. We would definitely return. Try get a rate that includes taxes, parking and breakfast. That's where the value is. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BagmanNZ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location,10 minutes walk from Downtown Disney. Buses to the the Disney parks on a regular basis made getting around the parks easy. Very friendly staff and a clean room, you can't ask for too much more. There was an error in our bill where we were charged $50 too much for one of our nights. However, I emailed them when we got home and they fixed it up quick.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and better value than Disney World Hotels”
Reviews.Author: sarahaussiegirl
Reviews.Content: My Mum, sister (18) and I (19) stayed here for two nights. The staff were invaluable helping us with the free shuttle to the nearby Orlando Premium Factory Outlet (be warned there are two different outlets on the same road with different stores, but an hour apart) and information about Disney World. Downtown Disney is approx. 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Buses to every park can be caught from here and is quite lively at night. The rooms were spacious, clean, amenities were easily accessible and plentiful, including free wifi throughout the hotel. For example, mum had a bottle of wine but forgot an opener and it took less than 5 minutes for someone from the front desk to come up with one and offered to let us borrow it for the night. In addition, the beds were like clouds, so beautiful and soft. Breakfast was lovely, the buffet was about $15 and had most things from tropical fresh fruit to cereals, hot stuff and an omelet and mickey waffle plate. Given we were not travelling with small children we appreciated the slightly more contemporary/ business/ family feel to the hotel. It was very civilised and relaxed which is refreshing when going to Disney World all day. Wish we did not transfer to the Disney World Hotel after staying here for half the price, and will definitely return for the entire duration of future trips to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Renovation Job”
Reviews.Author: Karen F
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that used to be Marriott Courtyard on Hotel Plaza Boulevard. I stayed several times while it was the Courtyard. It was nice, but getting old. Holiday Inn completely renovated it. It is great. The restaurant has a great selection of breakfasts including 3 buffet options. There is a very nice little lounge off the lobby. The staff is wonderful. They were always happy to fill any request. You should watch out for the transportation provided to the parks. We had someone with a scooter and some of the bus drivers were less than courteous about helping. Also, there was one day when the bus we were on broke down. They sent a bus to get us that was not handicap accessible. This used to be Disney transportation, but it now farmed out to Mears. It really could be better. The only complaint we had was the laundry facilities. They were really bad. However, the front desk told me that they expected the laundry facilities to be up to same standard as the rest of the hotel very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Marg1970
Reviews.Content: We loved the service and close location to Downtown Disney. It was a whole lot cheaper than a Disney hotel, but it had Disney service levels. Breakfast was great and we had it included. The free shuttle to the factory outlets was appreciated. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Kellcass
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for my birthday last week and could not have been happier. The rooms are large with both fridge and microwave. Pool was nicely heated and swim friendly for January! The hot tub by the pool was a bonus! Walking distance to Downtown Disney. Disney parks very close, but the shuttle does come to the hotel to take you to any Disney park with no extra charge! We had room service once- it was timely and very good. There are also many restaurants nearby as well. Would highly reccommend, even if your not going to the parks. Very good night life at Downtown Disney and Disney Boardwalk near by!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: holidayforever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, for the purpose of going to Disneyworld on a 3 day pass. The front desk staff are very good, lovely smiles & helpful. The shuttle to the disneyworld parks is very convenient, just make sure you find out from the driver which stop he will pick up from when you want to leave the parks & the times they return. Our hotel room wasn't cleaned until quite late, so upon arriving back around 4pm it still wasn't cleaned which wasn't the best. The rooms are average but adequate. The pool is lovely and the kids really enjoyed it. It is a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney which is really handy.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit which exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Wilson2010
Reviews.Content: An exceptional experience throughout, from the excellent clean comfortable facilities to the lovely breakfast each morning. We received a truly warm welcome back, these guys really care. The hotel's location and standards need not be mentioned again by us but it is the staff which really make this hotel stand out from the many others to choose from. We have stayed at a lot of hotels on our visits to Disney World but this is our number one.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: singletraveler040
Reviews.Content: Took family to WDW for a three night trip. Tried booking an onsite resort and all value and moderate ones were booked. Found this one using Tripadvisor and booked three King size bed rooms with Sofa beds. Parking was $10 a night, room with taxes was $120 a night. Hotel was fantastic. Rooms were much bigger than at a Disney Resort, beds were extremely comfortable, bathrooms were big enough and clean. Pool is very big and heated with plenty of seating around it. Free buses to disney parks and also to downtown disney (downtown disney buses start at 6pm) or you can walk there leisurely in 10 minutes. Buses pickup every 30 minutes and never had a problem going to and returning from the parks. Was able to get on the first bus back to the hotel everytime, unlike disney resort buses which you can wait for up to three buses due to them filling up when you stay until the parks close. Restaurant and Bar had good food and drinks with more food choices a short walk or drive down the road. There is a Disney Store inside the hotel where you can buy Tickets to the parks and souvenirs from. Will definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it over Disney Value resorts and most moderate ones.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: catloversCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Everything works. The rooms were huge, the beds soft, the bathrooms big and clean. The breakfast was lovely. This was definitely the best hotel I have stayed in in years and I see no reason not to encourage people to make use of the hotel. We stayed four night and the only hiccup was that the wireless password changed during this period and we were not informed of the change. But one phonecall later and it was working again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location for Disney Parks!!”
Reviews.Author: npsNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Park your car and use the free shuttle to all of the Disney Parks. We found the hotel to be very nice. The rooms have a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot. There was a grocery store within walking distance, and Downtown Disney was at the end of the block. With the relative closeness to stores, we had the option of having breakfast and supper in the room. I found the staff to be both very friendly and helpful. I have no reservation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Psnivy
Reviews.Content: After staing in other WD hotels, this one was the cleanest one. The staff of the hotel was also friendlier than in the other hotels. The hotel is not a fancy one, but if a clean room is of value to you, than this is the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for disney”
Reviews.Author: EB1WestMidlands
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a Disney trip right in the centre of all parks and downtown.If you are looking for a clean modern hotel this is great.The room on the 14th floor overlooking disney is great. What makes this hotel is the friendly waiters and really friendly door staff.Not forgetting the really friendly breakfast cook. The pool is also the best-really warm even on a cold day. We have only 2 complaints which are minor that would make 5 star opinion.Room 1408 air con was noisy most of the night(we did inform the hotel twice) but the problem not sorted. The second is not the hotels fault.They give you a card for a restaurant called Jonnies hideaway which was the worst restaurant in 18 days. The staff here are ignorant and aggressive just looking for huge tips.We spent 200 dollars plus for 2 adults and 2 kids in less than an hour.The waiter could not bring bill quick enough and once paid just wanted us out.
