I would use Bull and Bear for a quality meal a little more expensive but by far superior. Def use this hotel for a disney holiday.Best value all round/the kids eat free(under 12)

Reviews.Title: “customer service makes the hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisonpalk
Reviews.Content: This is a nice but nothing special hotel -- though they are renovating so next year it might be even nicer. what made my stay, however, was the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. I was really blown away about how everyone seemed genuinely cheerful and happy to go out of their way to make our stay pleasurable. when you're traveling with small children, as most people going to Disney World are, it really makes a big difference to be surrounded by friendly, helpful people. Also, the pool is really, really nice. the rest of the hotel is fine, nothing special as I said, but clean, comfortable, and serviceable. I had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Ravi S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 days during our Disney visit. It was one of those hotels where everything was excellent. We had a 14th floor room in the Tower building with excellent views of Disney Worldr resort. The staff was really good and they all helped us with a smile. The room was really good and the bathroom was a bit small. We ate breakfast thrice in the hotel and dinner once and every meal was real good. The room service was great too. The buses to Disney was added bonus and you can stroll to Disney Downtown from this hotel. We reallyenjoyed the stay and will surely return. One suggestion to remove the 10$ parking. This will increase the value for buck on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel bed!”
Reviews.Author: jo_sox
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults/2 teenagers) stayed here for 4 days. We didn't spend any time during the day at the hotel as this was a theme park vacation. However, the room was very large, clean, and comfortable - perfect for a family of our size. Our room had 2 queen beds with comfortable quilts, bedding, extra pillows, etc. The bathroom was a good size, clean, renovated. Big screen tv, mini fridge. The lobby was basic, simple, typical Holiday Inn. We didn't use the pool, but it looked like a very nice, clean, large pool area. My only negative comment is the $10 parking per night, (but we knew this in advance). Very quick drive to Disney and Universal. Down the street from Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Staff”
Reviews.Author: alwHerts
Reviews.Content: We visited Disney and the Gulf Coast during the two-week half term. We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 5 days whilst in Orlando visiting the Disney Parks. The staff could not have been more helpful as we initially moved rooms 3 times until we were happy. We picked the hotel based on reviews and its location, within walking distance of Downtown Disney. I had initially selected a hotel slightly further out due to no hotel parking charge but the review mentioned traffic noise. On arrival we were given an adequate room but it overlooked the Freeway and though you could not hear car noise you did hear large motorbikes racing. We immediately request a move as we wanted a good nights sleep due to the jet lag and were moved to a room overlooking the pool. Similar room (1st floor) though across the corridor from the ice machine, which needed a service and was very noisy. Finally they moved us to the end block, 8th floor, (a long walk from reception) but the room was lovely and quiet and overlooked the pool. During the process the reception staff were very helpful and completely understood. We had buffet breakfast everyday and were completely full prior to spending long days at the parks. We could not fault the hotel, rooms and general level of customer service. They print the Trip Advisor result in reception, so they’re proud of the comments they receive.

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: Karena1stof4
Reviews.Content: I decided to add a day to the beginning of our vacation and booked through Hotwire, not knowing exactly what I would get but trusting the Trip Advisor rating that was shown. I booked for 12/19. I was very pleasantly surprised after finding out where I had booked and the great reviews of the hotel. Upon arrival, the young man at the parking booth was very helpful. He appeared to enjoy his job and even kidded me about having to park "across the street" (we did not really have to park across the street). There is a $10 charge for self parking. At check in, staff was very professional and helpful. The hotel was very clean and bright with several amenities to enjoy. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable. They even gave you a choice of using a firm pillow or a soft pillow as both were on the beds. There was a microwave, mini-fridge and coffee maker. There was also a flat screen tv. We did not experience any internet connectivity problems. We were in a 2 queen bed room on the 12th floor.The hotel is within walking distance of Downtown Disney. There are a variety of restaurants on the main road before turning onto Hotel Plaza. Check out was easy and staff was pleasant and cheerful. I was allowed extra time to check out as a was running a little behind. My children wanted to know why I only booked here for one night. I guess that means we will be booking a longer stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best option in WDW”
Reviews.Author: ACampos
Reviews.Content: A refurbished hotel in a great location and in very good condition, nothing luxurious but what you need for a trip to Disney. The package with breakfast is good since the buffet has all the basics. Free Internet and super good service from all employees. My only complaint is that the pillows are not good, but the rest was excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: mikamu_904
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed December 16th - 22nd. Overall, I rate this property 4 out of 5. Included in our room were the standards; mini fridge, coffee maker, microwave, nice flat-screen T.V., mini safe, desk and chair. A hi-speed wireless network was available, however we were unable to connect at any point during our stay. The WIRED hi-speed worked like a champ, however. THE GOOD... Customer Service - OUTSTANDING (5/5) I arrived late (after 10pm) yet front desk staff were pleasant to speak with and worked quickly to get me checked in. I was offered the 'package deal' for Disney/timeshare which I declined and did not feel pressured to accept. There was a mix-up with regards to parking ($10 per night/self and $16 per night/valet) as the Priceline.com website which I booked through listed parking as 'free'. While it raised a few eyebrows when I brought the error to their attention, the hotel honored the mistake and waived the parking fees for not only myself, but my daughter (who joined me 2 days later), saving us a total of $100 +tax in parking fees (Woohoo!) Super Comfy Bed! - 5/5. I love a softer bed, so a soft yet supportive pillow top mattress was a pleasant surprise. The bedding was comfortable and I liked having a choice between firm and soft pillow. The A/C in the room was a bit tricky to master, but very efficient (very cold to very warm in only minutes). Adequate Water Pressure - 4/5. Both my daughter and I have long, thick hair, so this is a big issue for us. Water pressure on the 10th floor was sufficient for washing our hair without too much fuss. Bathroom Storage - 5/5. I'd read reviews stating limited shelf/counter space in the bathroom, however I found the wall shelves behind the door more than adequate for my plethora of haircare items! There is only one hook, so I ended up using clipper-hangars to hang my towels to dry (or leave them on the floor and housekeeping will replace daily). Interior Atrium - 5/5. Very nice! The glass elevators made for a stunning ride up and down from our 10th floor room. We were located quite near the elevators, yet never heard any noise. Exterior Noise - 4/5. While I-4 was just outside our window, the noise was minimal. Both of us are light sleepers and it was not loud enough to prevent us from falling asleep or wake us up. It is noticeable, but not a nuisance. Easy Access - 5/5. There are MANY hotels on Hotel Plaza Blvd and not all of them are easy to access. Holiday Inn is located at a LIGHT, which makes entry/exit a breeze. Fun/Functional clock radio - 5/5. Has a nightlight (which can be turned OFF) and a plug for MP3 devices. Little things, but I thought they were nice touches. THE BAD... Balcony - 3/5. We had a lovely balcony with a table and 2 chairs, perfect for a cup of coffee in the morning or enjoying the night air in the evening...too bad it faced I-4. The road is busy (read NOISY) 24/7, so while the balcony looked inviting, it was never used our entire stay. Access to Hotel Plaza Blvd - 2/5. While not Holiday Inn's fault, access to HPB is a nightmare if going in blind. TIP - If coming from I-4 Westbound (North), use the INSIDE of the two exit lanes to make that right turn. The left turn onto HPB is about 100 yards down. Without exception, each time I traversed this section of road, there were at least 8-10 cars attempting to cross 3 lanes of traffic to get into the left turn lane onto HPB. Shuttle Service to the parks - 3/5. Free is free and while I can't really argue the quality of a free service, I will anyway. Route A picks up Hilton, Holiday Inn, Royal ??? and DoubleTree (in that order). We were always able to get on the bus, however seating was unavailable all but two times (and we are only the 2nd pick-up). Coming home in the evening was even more chaotic with large groups of people jockying for a spot on the bus. They do seem to have additional buses in the evening, to offset the high demand as it was only about a 25 minute time lapse between the first, second and third bus. This is off-season and it was still a headache. I would be wary of depending on shuttle service during peak season (summer months). THE DISAPPOINTING... Holiday Inn is ON Walt Disney World property, however IT IS NOT A WDW RESORT. This may not be a big deal for some, but for us, we were really looking forward to utilizing the Extra Magic Hours (extended park operating hours available only to resort guests). The Magic Kingdom was open an additional 3 hours our first night, however we were unable to take advantage because I didn't know Holiday Inn wasn't included until it was too late. The Hilton (next door) IS a WDW Resort and DOES get passes/access to EMH if that is something you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marguerite D
Reviews.Content: All the staff are very friendly and Spencer went above and beyond to help us get 3 rooms together on very short notice. The hotel is very clean and has good amenities the beds are comfortable and the food is good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant time!”
Reviews.Author: bluesmanw
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with our 7 year old daughter for three nights over the Thanksgiving Break. It is conveniently located in Downtown Disney and the shuttles to the DIsney Parks and Downtown Disney are a big plus as well as one of the main reasons we stayed here. I would say one negative is the charge to park your car daily. That should be eliminated. The front staff was good and the restaurant was above average for a hotel based eatery. The room was extremely clean, large and very comfortable all the way around. Price was good at $108 a night plus the aforementioned charge for parking. The pool is very large, nicely landscaped and warm enough to swim in even at night. We have stayed before in hotels located in the Lake Buena Vista area when visiting Disney as well as at a Disney resort as well. All were nice but this is likely where we are going to stay from now on when we visit Disney or the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever”
Reviews.Author: LianeFurtado
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Orlando, I´ve been there before in other hotels, much more expensive than this one, and I have to say: Excelent price, the staff was very kind and helpfull, one of the best team I have ever seen. I will centainly go back to this hotel, and the location is great too, 5 minutes or less from Downtown Disney. Rooms are clean (I´m very picky with that), and I got view of the pool.What else do we want?

Reviews.Title: “You'll Love it!”
Reviews.Author: B S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and each was pleasant. The staff was very friendly and professional, hotel was very clean hotel. The conference rooms were nice as well, and the food was fantastic! Even more the hotel is within walking distance of Downtown Disney. As far the amenities, the pool area was pretty large and the jacuzzi added the final touch to my stay. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great option; Would definetly return.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: Great rooms with beautiful views and within walking distance of the Downtown Disney. The staff was amazing; always helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting Disney, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lemans24
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with very friendly staff and within walking distance of Disney Village. We would stay here again. Free shuttle to WDW saving you the parking fee in WDW. Pool is large with plenty of loungers and seating for the bar by the pool. You can choose between park yourself or valet parking which costs extra. Very useful is the serve yourself snack service which is located near the bar and allows you to get tea, coffee, chocolate and snacks anytime of the day or night. The kids used it for breakfast before boarding the bus to WDW. I also was given an amount to spend each day in the snack area as part of the deal we got. The rooms are a bit tired but fine for the amount of time you spend there. We were out all day and just fell into the very comfortable beds each night and then up early the next morning to go visit the Mouse. 5 Minutes walk and you are at Disney Village which has restaurants, bars and shops. It is also where Disney Quest is and the cirque de soleil shows are. The public areas of the hotel are modern and clean, the staff are very helpful and polite. we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option for on Disney property hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BeaverB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights over Thanksgiving and planned on visiting all Disney parks and downtown Disney. The shuttle service was decent and only had a few extra stops to pick up and drop off at other hotels and one other park. Self parking at the hotel is $10 a day compared to $14 at the parks. No shuttle to downtown Disney was the only draw back to the transportation. Rooms were nice and pretty quiet. We were near the elevator so we heard people early and late in the hall. Overall we liked the location and price and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney theme parks, friendly & clean”
Reviews.Author: SingaTrav3ll3r
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in Dec 2011. Room on 12th floor with king-size bed was comfortable and clean. While our interactions with hotel staff were mainly at breakfast, we found the staff friendly especially the chefs at Palm Breezes Restaurant who made good egg omelete and waffle. Breakfast is same everyday but covered the standard range - fresh fruits, cereals, bread/pastries, pan cakes, yoghurt, sausages and bacon...Our business interactions took us away from the hotel whole day so the comfortable bed and pillows facilitated good night sleep. About 15 mins of leisure walk to Downtown Disney. Regular shuttle bus available from hotel to the Disney locations. Singapore friends found good buys at Lego shop in Downtown Disney- significant savings compared with Singapore prices. We had corporate rates so value-for-money stay at Holiday Inn. It was one of the coldest week in Orlando so didn't try the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Second year at this new Hotel - It's ideal for the brits!!!”
Reviews.Author: buddy13IOM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families or couples. Good accommodation, really friendly hotel staff to ensure you have a great vacation (seriously nothing is too much trouble for them). Good restaurant available. Nice patio area outside the bar to enjoy a meal or drink. Superb swimming pool with walk in beach type entry at the shallow end for children. There are lots of good restaurants to enjoy within easy distance of the hotel. For shoppers the premium outlet centre is easy to get to and for the disney theme park visits there is a free bus service to take you to all the attractions. If you want to travel to other parts the Lynx Bus service stops close to the hotel. The Walt Disney Marketplace is a short 10 minute walk down the boulevard. It's the real deal at the right price for a disney area hotel. Don't miss out on this one folks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience,Will stay again,and again....”
Reviews.Author: lam968
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec 1st thru 5th. We had a double queen bed room with pool view with a balcony . Room was clean and spacious for 3 people. Beds were comfortable, pillows were firm and linens crisp, clean and soft. We had hot water,BUT poor water pressure. That was the only con with the accommodations. Had the freedom from fees package which included no fees for parking and 2 free breakfasts a day or 8 coupons to use your way. Breakfast was an all you can eat breakfast bar which included a made to order omelet station and mickey waffles. Breakfast was delicious. My only complaint was on Sunday that they only had one server at the omelet bar and there was a line of 7 people all staring at the poor server as she tried to prepare each omelet and waffles as timely as she could. They need will need to provide at least 2 servers for the weekend crowd. Many customers were giving the woman a hard time and I get bad for her. Overall, I loved my stay and found that this property meant our needs. Shout out to all the servers in the dining room who served us breakfast! You guys were great!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and convenient to Disney theme parks”
Reviews.Author: TwoCarolinians
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-day stay at this hotel and liked it very much. Our room was immaculate and the king-size bed quite comfortable. Our bathroom was a bit small but was otherwise just fine.The employees are friendly and helpful. There is no extra charge for the buses to the theme parks and they run on time. The prices at the hotel's restaurant could have been a little lower, but we suppose that's just the price for being in Orlando. The food was quite good, but my black Angus hamburger with grilled onions would have tasted even better if it hadn't cost $11.50. Since we're retired and try to be tight with our money, we decided to eat at various locations in Disney World. (There are some places there which are relative bargains.) All in all, this Holiday Inn is definitely worth a look. Two Carolinians

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great customer service...”
Reviews.Author: rfigari
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to celebrate her 50th birthday. We were greeted by such pleasant people at the front desk, and this place is immaculate!! It is convenient with the shuttle transporation for Disney and Disney Village is a nice walk. In the hotel itself, everything has been thought of. The hotel has the amenities of a "high end" hotel, the pool area is very pleasant and well maintained as well, and the beds and linen were just lovely. Everything about our experience was just wonderful..Chabeliz at the front desk could not have done more to make our stay special and we thank her and all the hard working folks at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lauradd29
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at The Holiday Inn on Hotel Plaza Blvd in Orlando. The hotel is a very nice. The room was clean and spacious, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a good size-we only had a shower in our room which was fine for us. If your bringing your children make sure you ask for a room with a tub. Our balcony faced the interstate which made it very noisy. Leaving the balcony door open for a while was not an option. We didn't have any problems sleeping and we were out of the room during the day so it didn't bother us too much but, if your family is one that likes to return from the parks and take a nap, your a light sleeper, or if you have young children make sure you request a room on the other side of the hotel. We ate at the hotel for breakfast everyday. The full buffet costs 14.99 per person. The food was good and the coffee was very good. The hotel has a free shuttle bus that runs between the parks every 30 minutes. The shuttle can get crowded especially with the strollers, but they were on time and beats paying $14.00 a day to park at the parks. The hotel is very close to Downtown Disney...a 10 minute walk you have many options for dinner, shopping and bars. There is also a pool at the hotel, gym and arcade. We bought our park tickets at the Disney store in the hotel. There is a Holiday Inn Vacation Club desk in the lobby that sells discount park tickets but you have to sit though a timeshare presentation. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mawood
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel. It was conveniently located, offered a friendly and on-time shuttle service, the room was both updated and clean and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. From booking to checking-out, it was a GREAT experience. And, I loved the price too which is why I will stay here again next visit and recommend you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy will use again!”
Reviews.Author: drawn4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well appointed and very clean with lovely decor that fits the Disney area theme. It is now one year since they had a total overhaul of the hotel and it is looking great. The rooms are spacious and very clean and the bed very comfortable. The restaurant was great for breakfast but we did not use it for dinner as we went out every night. The pool area was great and we had a lovely relaxing drink on the patio after a hectic day in one of the parks, the bar tender brought the drinks out to us and was very helpful. I can highly recommend the hotel for anyone looking to stay in the Downtown Disney area. The free shuttle bus for the Disney Parks was fine and ran on time. All in all we enjoyed our stay and will be going back another time!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not quite there”
Reviews.Author: HelGriff
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel. The pool was fab and the room was a good size. Like a big kid I enjoyed the mickey waffle in the mornings! It was a 5 - 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney which was fantastic. The front desk staff were very helpful and the serving staff were chatty and friendly. They are what make the excellent tripadvisor score. My main issue was a lift was out of service for the whole 12 days days we stayed in the hotel which I think is poor. I also think we could tell which day off the cleaner had because the substitute was never as good. However, saying that I would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Visit”
Reviews.Author: lscohiowv
Reviews.Content: We were in Florida for a family visit, and we stayed at the Holiday Inn across from Downtown Disney. The staff is excellent!! Chef King made me a pizza for breakfast. She is fun and wanted to please the customers. Steve S. at the front desk is the most helpful person. He went out of his way to make sure our stay and our room was perfect for us. Steve is the most professional and polite person. He is extremely kind and caring. Chef King and Steve S. deserve a bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kate8063
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this hotel and we will definitely be back! All the staff we encountered was very friendly and accommodating. We arrived very early (9am, check-in is at 4pm) and Danny was able to get us a room right away. The free shuttles (to parks and Downtown Disney) are very convenient, although the first few shuttles can be very full (the Holiday Inn is one of the last hotels the shuttle stops at). The pool was one of our favorite amenities as this hotel. Since we were staying in mid-November we figured the pool would be chilly, but it is actually heated to feel like bath water. AMAZING! Definitely sign up online for the Priority Club (free) to get points for the stay. We will certainly be back at this hotel for our next Disney World stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: flastatebucs
Reviews.Content: We live within driving distance to Disney so we usually drive for the day and then go home. This weekend we decided it would be fun to stay in a hotel instead. We chose this hotel after the number of good reviews it got. When we arrived the front desk agent was so friendly and quick. I was checked in within five minutes. We got to our room and it was a great size, clean and well equipped. Unfortunately, our AC didn't work the entire night. The fan just blew warm air which made the room stuffy and uncomfortable. IT was way too late to move my family to another room. So the next morning, I went to take a shower and their was barely any hot water. I was the first to go. I had lukewarm water at best for me and then the rest of my family had colder water. I consider these two pretty major components you need to have working when staying in a hotel room. Upon departure, I notified the front desk of these issues so they could fix them for the next occupants. The front desk agent gave me an insincere and robotic, "sorry for your inconvenience, have a great day." Hopefully, the next guest did not have to experience our room. Unfortunately, when we decide to stay overnight again, we will not be choosing this hotel. There are too many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit!”
Reviews.Author: simon72_11
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for a convention. Close enough to the convention center and everything else in Orlando without being gridlocked. All staff were wonderful, rooms were spotless, a very clean property. We stayed here a few months back and also had a great experience. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good service, great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: KerryH56
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel. Staff very friendly, food OK and rooms clean. The Swimming Pool and spa also lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for House of Blues/Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: pat1030
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night when attending a show at House of Blues and it was more than adequate. Clean and comfortable. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vand0joa
Reviews.Content: After checking out of another hotel after only staying for 1 hr, we booked this hotel online and it was the best decision we have ever made. The staff were wonderful. The hotel was gorgeous and we had the best time at disneyworld and at this hotel would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: LLSquared
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for a Conference and had the opportunity to stay at the Holiday Inn on Disney. It was a pretty nice hotel and had been recently updated. The bed was very comfortable and the room was a nice size. One complaint I did have with the room was that the bathroom vanity was very small, making it difficult to put all my things on the counter without knocking them over. The pool and hot-tub area were very nice and really warm... The pool temp had to be in the 90's with the hotub well above 100. One weird thing that happened during my stay was that 2 of the 3 elevators broke down for a day, making it a little hard to get to the room during certain times of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in a Good Location but Nothing Extra”
Reviews.Author: MCO_Addict
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Holiday Inn on Hotel Plaza Blvd for 8 nights. We had a pleasant stay, location was good, room was nice, bed was amazing, service was good, pool was good. All in all it was good. Not great. We paid extra for a room with a balcony with a Downtown Disney view but apparently this also means a highway view. We couldn't open the balcony door or spend any time out there because of the noise level. To give them credit once the door was closed we couldn't hear the noise, I just wish we hadn't wasted money on an upgraded view. The pool was like getting into a bath which was ok until we had to get out then we FROZE because the pool temperature was totally disproportionate to the air temperature. The self parking is about 50 feet from the front door so don't bother paying extra for the valet, it's not worth the upgrade. I guess that is the theme of the whole hotel. A good, comfortable mid range hotel but nothing extra so if that is what you are looking for then this is a great choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: tdot_traveller83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed her for the week of October 24th. Wasn't too happy with our room as it had two queen beds and a view of a parking lot, however we did not say anything as we did not spend much time in the room anyway-rooms were clean but only cleaned one time during our stay! We called the front desk and they informed us someone would come up, however no one came. OH WELL. We weren't going to let soemthing like that ruin our trip. Also at check-in we werent informed of what was available at the hotel or what was near the hotel. We had to go back a couple times and ask questions. Also we noticed other guests checking in were getting coupons-we didn't get any. But besides those couple of blips-the hotel was a good value. Breakfast buffet was really good in the am before going to the parks. Hotel pool was like a warm bath and open until 11pm, which was nice when coming back from a long day at Disney. We went to Downtown Disney almost every night for dinner as they have a lot of good places to eat. TIP-if going to Universal Studios contact MEARS. Its $19.00/person return. They pick you up at the hotel and you call approx 2 hours before you want to return and they pick you up at the same place they dropped you off. WE used Mears a few times and was really happy with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Alex!”
Reviews.Author: Gail M
Reviews.Content: Room not ready...bugs in room...A/C fan blows all the time on you in bed. Alex was GREAT though! He was the highlight of our trip to Orlando, Fla. You couldn't ask for anyone better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights whilst visiting the Disney parks. We booked through a third party site and though the room we were given was lovely, and very clean we didn't sleep well due to some external noise. We asked at reception if there was anything they could do and they happily moved us whilst we were out for the day. The customer service we received at this hotel was excellent, they exceeded our expectations in every way, all staff were very polite and helpful. The breakfast was good with a wide choice. The heated pool looked lovely and stayed open quite late. You are a 10 minute walk from Downtown Disney where all the Disney transport picks, up and the hotel does its own bus too, though we didn't try this. We ate in our room one evening and both meals were really tasty. They also have a small gym and a gift shop. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disney if you are happy to be out of the parks but near enough to walk to Downtown. We would definitely return if staying in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NicoArbus
Reviews.Content: Everyone was super friendly and we had a great stay. Arrived in the morning and they allowed us to check in at that time. Took the free shuttle bus (they run every 30 min) to EPCOT so we could enjoy the food & wine festival. We had the downtown disney view and could see the fireworks from our balcony which was pretty nice. There's a nice little bar in the lobby and a restaurant where we had breakfast. Your choice of either a full buffet or continental. The only bad thing was the coffee but the buffet was great and lots to choose from. You could easily walk to Downtown Disney from here. There's several HI in the area so make sure you get this one on Hotel Plaza Blvd. It was completely renovated a year ago. Pool and game room too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vls2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Holiday Inn while we visited the Magic Kingdom and Kingdom of Animals. The hotel has a great pool, a Disney shop, shop, decent gym (not great though) and a typical Holiday Inn restaurant/bar. They also have in hotel Disney services to help with bookings and advice. There is also a shuttle bus that leaves for the park every half hour from the hotel. There is also a laundry on site which was very helpful. Its a short walk to Downtown Disney which is worth checking out. They also have in there every type of food you could want and lots of lively places for a drink. WiFi was included and was pretty reliable. In all a good stay with easy access to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: scooter34
Reviews.Content: We had hoped to stay at the neighboring property Hilton but they were booked up. We usually do not stay at Holiday inn properties (Loyalty programs and all). What a pleasant surprise. We found the property in great shape....We found the room clean and well appointed....We had a balcony view of downtown Disney (or close enough to call it that). The staff at the hotel were supurb. there was one cranky pants every morning cooking omlets but that was just a comic diversion in an otherwise wonderful experience. I am so sorry i do not know the name of the gentelman who answered the phone early in the morning for room service (he also ran the small snack bar first thing). But his man was GREAT. There was confusion over what time the breakfast started but this guy didn't mind we called 1/2 hour early. he took our order (customized for our three year old) and did so happily and graciously. We will return to this hotel anytime because of him. Pool bar/snack retaurant was great (albeit slightly under staffed the day we hung by the pool). There was a cheerleader competition and four or five teams were staying at the hotel so there were longer waits for the hambuger and french fry menu that day. Front desk staff were great....found our daughters leap frog computer and got it back to us..... Pool was spacious and great

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: vbbound
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying 8 nights at this wonderful motel. We had a week to spend at Disney World (which was not enough time) and loved our location here. It's really nice to come back from the parks (which is a short bus ride away that you get on at the motel) and be in a nice quite location from all the hustle and bustle. No matter if it was day or night, all the staff were always helpful and smiling. It was really wonderful to feel so welcomed. If I ever do make it back to Disney World, this is definately the place I would want to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SWCUk
Reviews.Content: Great location with free half hourly shuttle to Disney. Staff are very polite, friendly & helpful. Lovely balcony room overlooking a very nice pool. Will certainly stay at this hotel again & would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: Kirk B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family vacation to Disney/Universal. I use TripAdvisor quite often and have not been disappointed yet. You have to throw out the bad reviews and the top rated ones and know the honest answer is some where in the middle. I am writing my opionin and please use it as a gauge and not gospel! We arrived to find our A/C not working properly and within a matter of minutes we were given an upgrade (free of course) to a Downtown Disney view on the 11th floor. That was very nice of them. (I had purchased the pool view on the 6th floor.) The view was nice and watching the fireworks was nice (but every night?)... too me not worth the extra money every night...go with the cheaper room but not the rooms facing I-4! The pool view would have been fine. There is traffic noise from I-4 with the upper floors but not when the door is closed. The room was decent and the beds very comfortable. Fridge was nice to have for leftovers and drinks. Nice too have balconies too to dry off clothes! Purchased package to get breakfast buffet every morning. It was worth it. The buffet had eggs, bacon, french toast, pancakes, home fries, grits, hash, cereal, toast, muffins, oatmeal, and fresh fruit!!! Plus an omelette and waffle station. What else more could you want every morning? The food was good...not great. The dinner food was good...not great. However...the prices were decent and kids eat free was nice. My kids tend to only eat chicken nuggets, hamburgs, grilled cheese and mac/cheese anyways! Do not get me wrong the dinner food was good...I liked the burger, chicken parm, turkey club, and pizza. My steak was very good but it took awhile to get it cooked right. The manager immediately told me that my meal was free because it took so long! My wife wished they would change the menu up because there is only a set list to choose from. The staff are all very nice and are there to help. The bell/valet's set me up with a taxi to get to Universal...expect about $30 one way. The pool was a very nice feature and my kids were in it every night! Very warm and relaxing. You can purchase Disney tickets right there in their store. The give you a paper every moring at your door for free. The buses were very easy to use and were there on time. You just need to make sure it says "A" and it has the Holiday Inn sign on it. You do not need the bus to Downtown Disney because it is less than 10 minute walk! Also there is a grocery store about a 20 min walk where we got food for our lunches for Disney. The bar had good drinks and there are two computers to use for checking stuff online or printing out tickets (airlines/parks.) So...I tried to cover everything...it fit my budget...it was close to Downtown Disney...the staff are nice...the food good...the rooms clean and beds comfortable. I would stay here again...and this is my honest opionin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay near Disney”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel357
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Holiday Inn multiple times and I have always been satisfied with the accomodations and the location. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff is friendly and very helpful. In addition, the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be led astray by the reviews...look somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Wombat21
Reviews.Content: I find it very hard to believe that people that have left glowing reviews for the Holiday Inn at WDW actually stayed there. This hotel is sub-standard at best. They may have spent millions of dollars on renovations, but new paint and fixtures can't hide the age of this property. They should have spent a few million of the dollars on a time machine to bring the property out of the 1980's. This property is made up of two sections--the tower and the wing. The wing is HORRIBLE! The air conditioning is non-existent, but the years old a/c system ROARS all night long producing no cooled air. The hallways are hot, smelly, and stuffy. We called the front desk on the second night of our stay to see if the air conditioning could be fixed. The person at the front desk was rude and no one was sent to see if the problem could be resolved. We found ourselves staying out as late as possible so we did not have to spend one minute more than necessary at this hotel. An additional "bonus" for our first night was a planned electrical shut-off at 1:00 AM that lasted several hours and further complicated that fact that there was no air conditioning. Also, if you choose to stay here (I don't know why anyone would with so many other options), be aware that when you reserve a room with two queen-size beds, the beds are in no way "queen size". This was one of the reasons we chose this property instead of a Disney value-property which was the same price per night, but only offered double-beds. Hot water is hard to come by as well. If your family is going to shower in the morning, get up and showered early if you want everyone to have a chance for lukewarm water. This is truly the first time that reviews on Trip Advisor has led me astray. I have used the reviews for restaurants, hotels, and sight-seeing reviews all over the world and have always found the reviews to be helpful and honest assessments of a property or tourist site. I seriously question the authenticity of the reviews for this property making it the #10 hotel in Orlando. The staff seems very skilled in telling customers that they are "sorry" for any guest issue that arises. They don't have the desire or skills necessary to resolve issues in a positive manner. Their smile and apology seems very disingenuous. The fact that no one even asked how our stay was at check out leads me to believe that they would prefer not to hear about it. To end on a positive note, I will say that the housekeeper for our room did an outstanding job. We always had clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Bed was great, friendly staff.....that's about all I can say. Woke up to take a shower and had lukewarm water at best. Toilet never seemed to flush completely without several attempts. I made the staff aware in which I got the following reply with a smile: "Sorry about that." Let's just say that I thought I'd give this hotel a chance, but will never make the mistake again. At $129/night, I expect a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Let's not get carried away - it's a good 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: thethreeofus41
Reviews.Content: I was persuaded to book the Holiday Inn for our first time family holiday to WDW because of this site’s excellent reviews and our desire to get value for money. For the latter I would say this was definitely true - you will pay a fraction of the cost of other hotels actually on the resort site. The reason is because you get in effect what you pay for - and you get a 3* facility despite the impression given by several of the over-enthusiastic reviewers. For the former, I am still at a loss as to where the astronomical sums of refurbishment money went. The lobby is functional but uninspiring, rooms are standard fare and not spacious, eg our room was a double queen and could not even accommodate a 2-seater couch, moreover we were forever tripping over our 4 suitcases. There is just one suite on the property. The bathrooms are clean and the granite countertops make them a pleasure to use. However, I have long since come to expect fluffy robes and slippers as a standard offering of the higher class of hotel. Neither was available here. This is disappointing (as robes are far too bulky to carry around with you). Hotel amenities are relatively sparse - however the games room and pool will keep the kids occupied if (heaven forbid) it is raining. No complaints re breakfast. Having said all that though, if the purpose of your hotel stay is solely functional as you will be spending almost all of your waking hours (and $$) at Disney and you are looking for a no-frills but comfortable place to rest your weary head, then this IS good value for money. We were hoping for more hotel ambience to add the extra special touch to our first time trip - and if this is you too - try elsewhere! PS: Our experiences at WDW itself exceeded our expectations, so the hotel, while not particularly memorable, did not detract from an overall fantastic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Mi_nombre_aqui
Reviews.Content: The management must be pretty confident of getting good reviews as they stapled a card to the invoice with a link to tripadvisor.com! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff was the highlight of this stay. We were there for a week so took advantage of the hotel's "free" breakfast offer every day. The omelette guy's cheerfulness was infectious. The restaurant was open in the evening too for typical hotel food but nicely prepared. We skipped the valet parking and self-parked just a few metres from the back entrance; very convenient for our pool-view room. There is a Benihana restaurant close by in the Hilton for those wanting a different dining experience, giving an easy 5-minute walk back after a glass or three of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alysha V
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT experience holding our conference here. The staff was a pleasure to work with before, during, and after our meeting. Throughout the conference the facilities were kept clean and staff responded quickly to and graciously to our every need. If something unexpected came up or we needed to make a change, they were more than happy to help in any way that they could. The rooms were a nice size with a good size balcony and the beds were so comfortable! Made it difficult to get up and work in the morning, but not a bad problem to have :-) Thank you Holiday Inn for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Have to ultimately give a failing grade”
Reviews.Author: Katie G
Reviews.Content: I actually really liked the Holiday Inn at WDW. We only ever stay at Disney properties and they were all booked for our weekend so this place had great reviews and we gave it a try. PROS: the staff were so friendly; rooms were clean; Grab N Go bar convient especially with 3 1/2 yo twins, parking lot was convienient, with good weather (which we did not have) it's a romantic stroll/hike to Downtown Disney. CONS: we picked this place above others because of the king bed and then pull out "sofa" for the girls to share, this thing wasn't even a twin size! Pull-out sofa to me is at least a double. We would've brought their blow up mattresses had we known. Now, none of that is too bad and they'd get 4-5 stars from me for the hotel alone. EXCEPT: driving two days ago I get a call from someone identifying themselves from the home office about a special offer for reward points members. But... Good only now and I had to give her my credit card. Explained that I was driving and shouldn't have even answered the phone, call me tonight or email me the offer and I would be interested we have a 4 day weekend together in November and we wanted to go back to Disney or Pensacola. She had the audacity to tell me she'd wait while I pull over. Kiss my foot. I'm now done with Holiday Inn. Either their corporate office employees are rude, they sold my information, or their fire wall sucks and my info was stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent our 15th Wedding Anniversary with a weekend escape to where we spent our honeymoon, Walt Disney World! Although we are Disney Vacation Club owners, we decided to stay at the Holiday Inn - in Walt Disney World Resort after reading about the recent renovations. I have to say that we were not disappointed at all with our choice! The hotel is immaculate and the staff is terrific. Albert at the front desk was extremely nice, our bartender John made a phenomenal martini, and manager Christine could not have been any more helpful. Our room was clean and spacious with a nice view of Downtown Disney from our balcony. All of this combined with the location and value make this hotel hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great loction, and service for Business meeting/seminar”
Reviews.Author: saragirl5515
Reviews.Content: Our company recently held a seminar at this location. The hotel was beautiful, location was great, and the staff very responsive. They really helped to make our seminar a success. They were great to work with, and ensured all our needs were met for our attendees. Very much appreciated! Would absolutely recommend this hotel for others seminars, conferences, or business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth stay!”
Reviews.Author: royh0206
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth time we have stayed at this particular hotel, and, as always the hotel and the staff have made every effort to be friendly and ensure the highest quality of service you could expect. The hotel is one of the best we have stayed in anywhere in the world We previously used to stay at the Holiday Inn International Drive, but when that changed this is the hotel we now use. Many of the staff from there also moved, and, they recognize you. The check in staff are always friendly and greet you, particular note to Rondell, Alex, Danny, but especially Kathleen, the Director of Sales who always looks after us. Other people to note are the Restaurant and bar staff Oscar, Debbie, Alex and Donna We even had our daughters wedding here last October, and whilst there, we have booked for next May. The manager has a staff at all levels of which he can be proud You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: bonnie l
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and we were very impressed with our visit..The valet staff were very nice and professional especially Alex..The front desk staff were very patient and polite especially Rondell..The rooms were very clean as well as the rest of the hotel..The quality of the food was excellent and the service was excellent especially Debby the head Chef and Mulela..It exceeded our expectations and will definitely stay here again next year..

Reviews.Title: “Jade-green”
Reviews.Author: Joanne D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely clean and the desk clerk, Stephen, was very accomodating. The hotel was totally redone about 1.5 years ago (it used to be a Marriott) and the upkeep is noteable. The pool is heated and was immaculate; it has a very unusual shape--- sort of like a vase atop a table -- and we all enjoyed swimmining in it. The buffet breakfast was excellent; the choices and food quality exceeded our expectations. Can't say enough nice things about this place and,as a bonus, it is about 2 blocks from the entrance to Downtown Disney!!!! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and we plan on going back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: pat2008
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nites. beautiful and clean. no pets allowed. very polite and helpful staff. great pool. had breakfast in restaurant. excellent. did not take shuttle, so cannot comment. easy walk to downtown disney or drive. rooms are beautiful. (stayed in tower 12007) could see fireworks from balcony. it is noisy from i-4 traffic when you are outside. great beds. no complaints. would definitely recommend and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectation”
Reviews.Author: Calfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and it exceeded all our expectations. Obviously you stay here because you are visiting the Disney theme parks and this hotel serves that purpose perfectly. The shuttle bus comes every 30 mins and very useful to get to the parks. We did not have a car and did not need it. It is 10 minutes walk to Disney Downtown and about 15 minutes walk to Crossroads. If you want to go from any of the parks to Disney Downtown, take the same shuttle bus and get off at Hilton, I think this is faster than what Disney recommends is to take a bus to a nearby Disney resort and then another bus to Disney Downtown, since there are no buses from any of the theme parks to Disney Downtown directly. Back to the hotel, the room is spacious and clean, the free Internet is bonus. We tried the breakfast, although the buffet is more value for money, ala carte is better quality. If you can get a rate under $100, this is a great hotel compared to any of the Disney resorts. Even the budget hotels can not compare with this price. I don't think Magic hours provided by other Disney hotels is very useful for people staying multiple days, because you get enough after 5-7 hours in the parks everyday. I recommend getting a Disney gift card to use in the park, for 4 days, we did not use any cash. We only needed cash to pay for cab rides to Premium Outlet, which the fare is $12 including tips. Overall, we really enjoyed staying here and will do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Disney Vacation (or any other reason!)”
Reviews.Author: jmvtravels
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels this past year, and I have to say this stay was one of the best experiences ever. I am happy that I had my family with me. Initially, I had difficulty trying to book my room online due to the website being down. The hotel manager, Danny, assisted me over the phone with my reservation. Very nice man. I was impressed with the friendliness of the entire staff, along with their great service. The rooms are spacious, clean, and quiet. Beds are super comfortable. Chose this hotel because my family and I were spending two days at the Disney parks. Shuttle busses run every half hour to the different parks, with pick up right at the lobby. Unbelievably easy and what terrific value!! We ate dinner in the restaurant one night, and the food was very good. Breakfast is superb. Full buffet and a chef that will cook to order for you! We enjoyed the full size pool one afternoon, and it was not crowded. Overall, this was a very, very good experience. Felt like home. I also want to mention that the Priority Club Rewards program is fantastic. Thank you Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Would give 6 stars if I could”
Reviews.Author: DKebabs
Reviews.Content: What can I say,, amazing, the hotel, the staff, the facilities, the food, the bed, especially the bed, the best and most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! If i could have taken the bed home with me, I would have done so. The room was fantastic, clean and bright, with a lovely balcony, a view of downtown disney. The staff couldn't do enough to help, everytime we went through the lobby, we were greeted in a friendly way, in a way which seemed genuinely interested in us. I've never asked for the manager in a hotel before, but i did this time, to congratulate him on his staff. I even asked for a job so I could stay on! We have stayed at Disney a lot of times, and have always stayed in the downtown disney area and this is by the best hotel we have stayed in and we will be back as soon as we can save up!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Flaneur1969
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family and had an outstanding hotel experience. The property itself was very nice; it was clean, well-lit, and very nicely appointed. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable with all of the amenities one would need. The location could not have been better. You are really walking distance from Downtown Disney and a short drive from all of the parks and other attractions within the Disney complex. But what really sets this hotel apart is the service. From the moment we arrived to the time that we left, we experienced happy employees that were so helpful, courteous, and polite, that we were just amazed. Everyone always greeted us, and everyone was so helpful with anything we needed. Great job to the management of this hotel for hiring such great employees and for making sure service is your top priority. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: andydrummond
Reviews.Content: what can i say about this hotel the people that work here are the friendliest i have ever met spent two weeks in this hotel not one negative iwill definitly be going back. the hotel is in a great location free transport to all disney parks and to downtown disney anyone going to orlando should give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to base yourself when visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: Davidb18
Reviews.Content: This is a great quality hotel ideally situated near Downtown Disney for those without their own transport. The good. Position to Downtown Disney. Staff who are knowledgeable about all things Disney. Free wifi. Decent breakfast. Staff who go out of their way to help. The bad. Small pillows. (if I would had had a vehicle I would have bought some, but to be fair I never asked housekeeping if they had others.). I could not work out how (if possible) to turn off the airconditioning fan. Slight road noise at night from our room on the top floor with a Downtown view. The other. There are 4 different bus routes. Each bus comes every 30 minutes, but there is no system which will tell you when a bus is due, or better still when the previous bus left. Also the bus to Downtown Disney only starts at 6:00. A hint: when leaving a park, if you miss this bus then take the one whiich will drop you over the road. Would definitely be my choice of place to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stumpbled across this hotel after a days drive from Boca Raton and Kennedy Space Centre (fantastic). We were intending to go to another hotel but discovered it was about 25-35 min drive from the resort (thanks to the Trip Advosr iPad app). When we arrived the experience started from there. The staff were friendly, accommodating and refreshing. They upgraded our room (thank-you) and it allowed us to relax and enjoy. The following morning, the staff in the Disney Shop were great. The advice they offered was sensational, as we had not planned that part too much yet. Breakfast was sensational and we loved the atrium feel in the centre of the hotel. All surroundings were great, along with the pool area. The staff we found to be particularly friendly and helpful. Thank you very much. This was one of the highlights to our trips to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: NevetsV
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation for a few days at Disney parks and selected this hotel based on reviews from this site. We're very glad we did. From check-in to check-out I think they were the friendliest and most helpful staff we've ever encountered. A fantastic value for the price. We arrived about 11AM and they already able to get us into a room. We walked to Downtown Disney (about a 10 min walk) where we had lunch, did some shopping and exploring, ate dinner and returned. When we returned to our room it was missing a TV remote, the front desk had someone at our door within 5 mins with one. We took the shuttle to the Disney parks each day, which worked out fine except the bus schedule was a bit erratic but we never waited longer than 1/2 hour at the hotel or parks. Be aware however that you'll have quite a walk to the park entrances from where the bus drops you off. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was excellent as was the pool area, workout room, etc. Rooms were cleaned well every day. Two more examples of the great service include the assistance I received when I wanted to print our return flight boarding passes. The other was when we were leaving and the shuttle company sent the shuttle to the wrong hotel. The staff was extremely helpful in checking into the issue and getting a dedicated shuttle there for us so we didn't miss our flight. If I have to go to this area again for business or pleasure I would definitely select this hotel again and would highly recommend it to any friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service! Outstanding Location! Outstanding Value!”
Reviews.Author: Jakkal99
Reviews.Content: From the initial phone call to book the reservation, to the checking out at the end of the trip, the visit was flawless. This was a last minute trip to hit Disney and some other parks with the family. We debated staying at a Disney property hotel, but found that staying within EASY walking distance to DT Disney, yet having access to the Crossroads shopping area restaurants was a better choice. There must be 15 restaurants there! Within a 1/2 mile of I-4, the location couldnt have been more convenient, Stephen at the front desk was more than helpful and offered me an upgraded room when we arrived... (if you can arrange it, DO get a room on the 14th floor and make sure you get the Downtown Disney view! It is SO worth it!) Mohammed was likely one of the most helpful and personable doorman that I've ever met... The restaurant staff was awesome and very attentive... and the bartenders were great to chat with. The cleanliness of the rooms was far superior to many other hotels I've stayed in. But the most impressive areas to see how much pride this hotel has in its appearance are in the common areas... the front lobby... the atrium... the conference room area... all spotless. Don't let the outside of the hotel scare you away... it may look like an older style HI, but once inside, modern and comfortable sums it up! Five thumbs up for the Team at this hotel... we'll be back for sure and we'll recommend it to our friends as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Thefeiks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn for 5 nights (both pleasure and business) and really enjoyed it. The hotel is very clean and the staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and to make sure you have what you need. The beds are super-comfy!! Although the room I stayed in was very spacious, the bathroom was rather small. I would suggest they add more shelving and towel bars/hooks. They did a nice job remodeling this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for going to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: MACJacksonville_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June for two nights during our Disney stay and it was great! We normally stay atthe Hilton but it was booked and too pricey for what we wanted. So we decided to stay at the HI..much to our surpise it was recently renovated and very updated.The room that we had with a king bed was nice and spacious and the bed VERY comfortable. The only downfall I will say is that the bathroom was very small. We were able to walk to Downtown Disney in about 10 minutes and we took the shuttle both days (no charge) to Disney which is very nice. There is breakfast buffett that my husband got one AM-but it is rather pricey for my liking. But there is a small little shop where you are able to get fruit and yogart, pastries etc. for more a reasonable price..Overall the hotel is really nice and great value for being a Disney Resort hotel. Would def. advise to stay here and would plan to again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: meltzer25
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights recently, found the hotel to be modern, clean and a great place to stay. Yes its a bit of a rabbit warren as described in earlier posts but it isn't really that hard to find your way around. The staff are great, especially Spencer at the front desk, happy to give out any advice, all of which was accurate and useful. Room was cleaned daily and to a high standard, we were near the main highway but never heard any noise. Shuttle to the Disney parks is handy. Free wi fi is always good! Breakfast buffet was good also. Only two low points were one of the concierge on one if the days did not give out accurate or very helpful advice which we later found out when talking to the reception staff about the same topic and also the price of the breakfast was a little steep but if you eat alot then it probably isn't too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great desk staff, especially Chabeliz. Super personality and service provided”
Reviews.Author: z06mike
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this place to all. Great rooms and outstanding pool. Thanks Kelly and Chabeliz, from the Conte family of Miami Lakes, FL

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: Location, very friendly staff, pool, clean rooms everything was great. Walk to Downtown Disney shopping and Restaurants or take shuttle every 1/2 hr. Parking is extra, as with all I guess. One of the reasons it won't get a 5* rating. Restaurant in hotel itself is ok, food was very good, waiters were very nice but slow and very unexperienced it was like it was they're first day on the job, every one of them. The restaurant is open and kind of feels like your eating in the Lobby. Another reason no 5* from me. Also we went the Labor Day Weekend and once the crowd left it was great. The pool was practically all ours. Pay a couple bucks more and get pool view, it's worth it. But when all's said and done, I would definitely stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: jessica w
Reviews.Content: the staff was amazing, the place was so nice and clean!!!!!! nice pool and hot tub, and the disney store stays open till 1 am, we had an amzing downtown disney view, amazing!!!!!!! loved everything about this place even the price and since i have a handicap parking placker free parking all 3 nights ;) i like!! i will so be back, and loved the buses didnt have to use my car at all the whole time i was there, and when i bought something from disney guess what they take it back to my hotel for me !!!!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. I chose it because of it's rating on trip advisor. We went with the freedom from fees package which was great value. The breakfast buffet was amazing. The transfer to the parks were great. They did seem to take a long time as they stop at other hotels but we always had a seat so were able to relax. We did have problems with housekeeping. When we arrived in our room my son noticed there were a pair of crocs & socks left under the bed. There was scribble all over the bathroom door. We made sure that we told the front desk as I didn't want them to think our children did it. The next day we left for the park and came back at 3:30 pm. The room was not made up. I called down to the front desk and they apologized and said they would send someone right away. We went for a swim and came back and it was done. The next day we got back to our room at 4pm and it was not made up again. We called again to the front desk and they apologized again and said they would send someone right away. We went for a swim came back and it was still not made up. The manager apologized and offered us dinner at their restuarant. We already had plans for dinner so he offered to reduce our room rate for 1 night. When we got back from dinner the room was made up but the maid didn't dust or clear used glasses in the room. The hotel was not busy so we couldn't understand why this was so lack. The hotel staff was good at handling it but there was obviously a problem with housekeeping. We moved to another resort for the rest of our stay in Orlando. Orange Lake Resort Holiday Inn. I will leave another review there. I am happy with our choice of hotel even with the house keeping mishap. It was close to downtown disney which was great. I agonized over the right hotel for our 1st trip to Disney. My family felt I made the right decision (did I say how great the breakfast buffet was????).

Reviews.Title: “Great deal. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: The_real_scoop
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after analyzing location versus price. I found that there is a huge difference between the advertised price and the final tab at many hotels after adding on pool fees, parking, breakfast, and Internet. Here the price included all the "extras." The location in my opinion was the best of all worlds. A short drive down a scenic road to the Disney parks and quick drive to Downtown Disney. In my opinion, "staying in the park" is all hype and from what I saw those resorts were far away from Disney but at the same time totally isolated. And of course very expensive! As for the Holiday Inn, the hotel was very nice. The pool amazing, and much more impressive than the pictures. The restaurant was very pleasant for breakfast, although the food was not great in the evening. Note: We did not find any great meals in Orlando. The hotel structure itself is old and has been remodeled. The rooms were nice and the elevators efficient. My only gripe was that the bathrooms were so small it was hard to access any of your toiletries. Also there were no hooks to hang anything. Beds were also on the soft side. The Downtown Disney hotel area was a pleasant surprise. I had assumed it would be an urban area, but actually it is a very nice grassy boulevard. The hotels are all in a row on both sides of this road. Our parking lot was back to back with the Hilton, which would have been much more expensive with all the fees. Seeing that we were barely in the hotel and the time we spent was at breakfast and at the pool, I was overall extremely pleased with the pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: murmaniac
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The whole property is clean and well kept. All of the staff who we interacted with were very friendly and went out of their way to make sure our stay was exceptional. Don't be thrown off by the older looking style of the building because everything inside is new. The beds are sooooo comfortable. Breakfast bar is really nice. Did not eat any other meals here besides breakfast so I can not comment on the quality of lunch and dinner menu. We will definitely be back. Our new favorite hotel in Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: 63Johnson
Reviews.Content: We planned our annual vacation for a number of months and finally decided on this hotel. I am so pleased that we did, as everything was perfect. The staff are welcoming and attentive, the rooms and communal areas are spotless, and the pool is just perfect. We hope to visit Florida again next year, and if we do, then I shall not hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Neighbor Hotel to Disney World, Period!”
Reviews.Author: NMSoccerDad
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the service of the entire staff at this hotel. With Downtown Disney and transportation to the park right there via shuttle or boat from Downtown Disney, I felt like we were on Disney grounds, at less than half the cost. The rooms were extremely comfortable, we slept very well. The food was exceptional for a hotel as well. More than anything, I was extremely impressed by the hotel's staff. They took care of us like we owned the place and went out of there way for everything we needed, consistently. For the money a family can spend on a Disney trip, stay here and get the same service levels, and so much cheaper than staying on premise.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: cupvacker
Reviews.Content: We booked for a 2-night stay for our first visit to Universal Studios, yet still wanting to enjoy that magic Disney feeling, too. This hotel was perfect. All employees were exceptional as one has come to expect from actual Disney employees. The bus was prompt for traveling back and forth to Disney Village/Marketplace for evenings. Breakfast buffet was good. Everything looked brand new. Our room was meticulous with fridge and microwave. And the 1-serving coffeemaker even satisfied the coffee lover in our bunch! The usual traffice noise sitting outside on the balcony, but close the sliding glass door and total silence! We were very pleased with our choice and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tariqsmom
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Aug 20-26 for our 4th Disney World vacation. This was our first time not staying in a Disney Resort so I was a little worried. I was very impressed with the staff and cleanliness of the hotel. We arrived a couple of hours before check in but was to able to get checked in early which was most helpful. Rooms were very spacious and beds very comfortable. we were given a room on the 14th floor, balcony overlooking I-4, which was an issue with traffic noise the first night, but after talking to the front desk I was able to move to another room on the 5th floor w/ a pool view. They were most helpful and wanted to make our stay enjoyable. Shuttles to the parks were every 30 mins, on time and hardly ever crowded. we had a wonderful Disney vacation thanks to the staff at The Holiday Inn!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! What a GREAT place to stay! We WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: Roy W
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but we liked the Holidayy Inn so much I thought we owed it to them to let eveyone know. If you want a nice, clean and affordable place to stay on the Disney property in Orlando, Holiday Inn is the way to go! The room was nicer (cleaner too) than the Disney hotel we stayed at last year and it was half of the cost!!!! Sorry Disney, the Holiday Inn was just better! The staff was great, pool was nice and the kids eat for free. It had a modern look and feel. We were impressed. Some of our inlaws couldn't believe we were going to stay at a Holiday Inn. They thought it would be old and run down. Boy were they wrong! We liked it a lot. Don't let the name fool you. Its not your parents Holiday Inn. We have one more day left on our 3 day Disney pass. We will stay there again when we go back to use it. Here are two tips we learned that will save you some money. The AAA discount was better than the Florida resident discount. Not a lot but it did save us a few extra bcuks. At breakfast we were asked if we had the discount buffet tickets. The waiter said if you book online you can get tickets for 1/2 off of the breafast buffet. Not sure if that's true or not?? I'll try that next time though. Oh yea, the breafast buffet was great too! Great job Holiday Inn! You won our business!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very clean stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlHamilton
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from August 20-25 we really enjoyed our stay. the hotel was so clean, I found the staff so nice and helpful, they seem to enjoy working there which makes a huge difference. We used the pool and thought it was great. We used the daily shuttle service to the Disney parks it came every 30 minutes as promised we never waited to get to the parks. We ate in the restaurant once and it was great my daughter ate free which was a bonus. The beds were so comfy and we had a great nites sleep after a long day at each Theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: rssings
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights for a Disney trip, and had low expectations of a Holiday Inn. We were delighted to find that the property is newly rebuilt (just a couple of years) and everything is very lovely, new, fresh, and clean. The room was not enormous, but fine for our family of 4, and it was helpful to have a fridge. The bathroom vanity was a little small with 4 of us, but it was okay - and everything was spotlessly clean. There is a parking fee ($10 for self, $16 for valet), which other posters complained about, but it's totally worth it: the location is excellent, with free transportation to the Disney attractions, and Downtown Disney is an easy 10-minute walk. There are no other "resort" fees. The breakfast buffet (not included in our rate, but kids eat free) was fantastic, fresh, widely varied and included an omelet station, and the service extraordinary and attentive. Every single staff member (valet, front desk, housekeeping, etc) was friendly and helpful. There's a lovely pool & hot tub and decent fitness room. We would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALISTAIR64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 16 nights in July , can fault this place , 5 min walk to Downtown Disney , pool never to busy , check in was easy , the only drawback was I asked for a downtown disney view and was told it would cost an extra $40 per night !! There is also a $10 per night parking charge , free buses to all the Disney parks , close to the shops at the crossroads shopping centre , will be back at this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Roesy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews we read on trip advisor and we weren't disappointed. It was a lovely place to stay. It was very clean and the reception staff were very friendly. The pool area was large and there were plenty of sun loungers. It is an ideal location for the Disney parks and the hotel has a very reliable shuttle service. We did not have a car when we stayed here so we were a little bit limited in our options for dining. The food in the hotel was very nice aside from one disappointing dish. The service at dinner was a little patchy and one of the evenings we ate there we had a very long wait for our meal and our appetiser was forgotten about. The breakfast is quite pricy but very tasty. It was a buffet set up which offered lots of choice including a waffle and omelette station. We found the waiting staff at breakfast to be far more efficient. The hotel itself is not too expensive to stay at but but drinks and breakfast were quite costly in comparison to other places we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Phillyhotelsnob
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent meals and close to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Back.......and darn glad to be here”
Reviews.Author: MikeP57
Reviews.Content: Back in Orlando on business for a two night stay. This Holiday Inn is one of the most consistant hotels around. They have made the parking more secure which is always a plus. The gift shop that has been under construction for maybe a year (?) is open and looks great. The staff is wonderful as usual. The rooms are clean which I appreciate more than anything. Slept like a baby! Fridge in room, flat screen, balcony and great shower. Workout room is still like new (couldn't find the TV remote). Didn't visit Downtown Disney but can see it and fireworks from the balcony. This hotel is a stones throw from I-4 which makes in very convienient, plenty of shopping and restaurants very close. Still #1 with this traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at how great the service was”
Reviews.Author: Phillyvero
Reviews.Content: I never really write reviews, but I was so impressed with this hotel that i felt the need to pass on the goodness. We originally had booked a room at the Dolphin/Swan property, but after reading the reviews on this hotel, we canceled the reservation at the Dolphin/Swan hotel and booked two nights here. We know we made the right choice! The positive experience began as soon as we pulled up to the hotel. We were a little early and Spencer was very friendly, getting us into a room right away. We had requested a tower room, but since that was not ready yet, he put us in another room until it was ready. In addition we were offered an upgrade and we were very pleased with the service at the front desk. Besides the clean rooms, comfortable beds, fantastic pool and overall friendly staff, the one person who really stood out for us was David. He was a friendly smiling face the moment we pulled up to the hotel.
