He noticed that my grandmother was having a difficult time getting around, and he called us to give us information on a company who rented scooters, and delivered them right to the hotel. It was like he read our minds. We did rent a scooter from this company, and it was a great experience. My grandmother had a blast, and was able to keep up with me, my husband and the three little ones at the parks and in the hotel. David was just genuinely kind, and a wealth of information. The hotel was very nice, but the reason I will come back is because of the excellent customer service. We got the package that included breakfast and parking. We found it to be a great value with the kids eating for free as well.

Reviews.Title: “I wanna go back again!!”
Reviews.Author: nanpink
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location from August 10th - August 13th. Arrived very late in the evening and was greeted so nicely by the valet & the girl behind the front desk. (Sorry, I do not remember her name). The room we were given was a King room overlooking the Downtown Disney area. Nice view. I loved the room. It was beautiful and so new. The bed was so comfy!!! We checked out the pool - even though we did not have time to use it - it looked great!!! Not a big crowd and plenty of lounge chairs. We ate breakfast there one morning at the buffet. My only issue was that they only have 1 person making omelets. We had a long wait for ours because the chef was making omelets for a very large family. Good selection of breakfast items. We left for a cruise on the 13th of August and found ourselves bumped on our flight back home on the 20th and would not be returning home till the next day. We needed a place to stay and choose this location again because I just loved it. The valet even remember my husbands name when we drove up. Very friendly staff. Can't wait to visit this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafForever
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in August 2011 for my first trip to visit the Magic Kingdom. From our first encounter with hotel staff - when we pulled up our car to unload to check in - to our last, the staff were friendly and extremely welcoming. We opted to self-park, but even with that the valet who first greeted us on arrival remembered my name and addressed me by name everytime he saw me through our four day stay. I thought that that was exceptional! The check in was quick and easy, and our room was ready without delay. The hotel has recently been renovated and it shows - the rooms were nicely decorated and had a real new feel to them. My only issue with the room would be the small counter space in the bathroom, but that is really a minor issue. We were located right beside an elevator, but had no elevator noise, which is pretty unusual. The table lamp did not work and they fixed it very quickly - overall, great great service. We visited the pool one night and it was also very nicely maintained, as was the jacuzzi tub. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Our rate included breakfast, and the buffet offered a great range of choices from cold cereal to eggs made-to-order. We had breakfast there each of our four mornings and the variety made sure that we did not get bored by having to have the same breakfast every day. The Disney shuttle does stop here, which is a great bonus and because it is only the second pick-up spot for the shuttle, it's easy to get a seat.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Orlando, and definately going back next summer!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dezaraelachney
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Orlando, and The Holiday Inn Disney was awesome, excellent service, friendly staff, nice and very clean hotel. We really enjoyed our stay and We would like to let yall know we will be back next year. I rate this hotel 5 Star. I am from Louisiana!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! I couldn't have asked for better.”
Reviews.Author: amanda11288
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boyfriend's birthday in August 2011. We are huge Disney fans, so I knew he would like it and my son was with it, so I knew I couldn't go wrong. We usually stay at the Regal Sun, now the Wyndham Lake Buena Vista, but the rates were kinda high and their resort fees are ridiculous. I booked here because I work for an Intercontinental hotel and was able to get the employee rate. I booked the King resort view and asked to have cupcakes and balloons delivered to the room before we arrived. The price on that was a bit high, but I know that you pay for convenience, so I could not complain. I received an e-mail before I got there asking if I would like a free upgrade to a pool view, so which I replied, "ABSOLUTELY!". Who doesn't love free. Once we arrived, I go to check in, and find out that I was upgraded AGAIN, to a Disney View room, for FREE! I thought this was awesome. I worked with Crystal at the front desk and she is the one who helped me set up the surprise for my boyfriend. She is amazing. The room was superbly clean, great amenities, great view with a balcony, large flat screen TV. I didn't get to check out the pool, but it looked nice too. The breakfast was pretty decent. It is $14.95 for the full buffet and $9.95 for the continental. We didn't spend much time at the hotel because we went to the park, but I am sure that we would have had fun staying there all day just as well. It is a beautiful place and I will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one of the best around.”
Reviews.Author: Adkins_jen
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 1.5 days (we left at midnight to drive home). The free transportation to the parks was awesome, staff was courteous and helpful. Kids eat free at the restaurant with a purchasing adult... What more can you ask for? The hotel was clean, pool looked very nice. Our room overlooked the restaurant so it was a little noisy, but we didn't care. They sell tickets to the Disney Parks in their Disney store, no waiting in line at the park!

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault anything - definately recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: ilovedisney123
Reviews.Content: We had read really good reviews on here before the holiday and the hotel definately lived up to it! We had told the hotel that we would be celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary and on check in they upgraded us to a room with a balcony over looking Downtown Disney. Every member of staff we came across at the hotel was so friendly and helpful - nothing was ever too much! Rooms were new, clean, good size, with everything you need inclduing coffee machine, fridge, hairdyer etc. On the day of our anniversay the hotel sent a bottle of champagne and strawberries up to the room - such a nice suprise! The complimentary shuttle bus from the hotel to the Disney parks was great. Runs every half an hour and always on time. Buses leave well before and after park closing times. Pool was great, very clean pool area and plenty of towels. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney which was great and also only 10 min walk in the oppposite direction to Crossroads where there are plenty of different restaurants. Overall the hotel was excellent and we will definately return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjl5026
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, both times for business. On the 2nd occasion to facilitate a group meeting. I cannot offer enough praise for the outstanding service, food, accommodations and attentiveness of the staff. And it was genuine!! All of us at the meeting commented everyday on how exceptional EVERYTHING was. Thank you for going above and beyond in everything you do..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - excellent location, wonderful holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Liamsmum123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks at the end of June/early July. We had a two week ticket for Disney and this was a perfect choice of hotel. We chose not to drive on this holiday as the free shuttle service was fabulous. (every 30 mins from before the parks open til 90 mins after each closes). They all have wheelchair lifts also. Very efficient service. Downtown Disney was a 5 min walk and the crossroads restaurants and small supermarket only 10 mins in the other direction. The hotel also has a free shuttle to the outlet stores but not great times and the lynx bus stops outside taking you to seaworld or the Florida Mall. Not so convenient for universal studios it would be a few buses or a taxi (about $30 each way). The hotel itself was spotlessly clean, great customer service; well beyond the call of duty, very friendly. The rooms were fine; if only a little small. The restaurant was reasonably priced with decent menu, open til late and there was a convenient little grab and go for snacks. The pool is nice and clean with plenty of beds and towels. The jacuzzi was very hot but not very strong. Overall this is a fabulous hotel at a very good price, in an excellent location. We have been to Orlando 6 times and this is our favourite so far!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, perfect for families visiting Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: LyndyMB
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had 2 interconnecting rooms with Disney fireworks view. The rooms were clean and comfortable and recently refurbished. The balcony was great to sit out and watch the fireworks. Its a great location considering Orlando is so spread out. There is no such thing as being close to everything in Orlando. So this hotel suited us fine, as it was close to Disney parks with free well air-conditioned bus transport to all Disney parks every half hour. The buses were on time and easy to use. The restaurant has kids eat free all day every day (one child free per paying adult) so this made prices very reasonable. The breakfast buffet has everything you need to get you through a big day at the theme parks. Plenty of other restaurants in the same general area. We thoroughly recommend families to stay here for value for money and location. If we return to Orlando, we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price and location to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: NarFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to see the Cirque du Soleil in Downtown Disney. The drive from hotel to venue was great...only a couple blocks on Disney roads...very very easy and no getting back on the highway nightmare (if you're familiar with Orlando, you'll know what I mean.) The hotel was clean and the staff was SUPER friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again and I am one picky hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Spot & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ShooneJameson
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot! Kella at the front desk will work hard to make sure your stay is a great one! Stayed in a room with a view of Downtown Disney and Pleasure Island, well worth it. Great facilities, personable staff, and wonderful service! Stay & enjoy. Travel Tips: 1) Self-parking is $10 while valet service is $16; don't go cheap and just splurge for the extra service. You will support the valet staff that work hard in the Florida heat, and at the same time, you'll get a great level of service for just a few dollars more. Travel Tips: 2) Be sure to join PriorityClub; this way you'll earn points and might eventually qualify for some upgrades and premium services.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Trip and Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane33375
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Trip Advisor about this hotel before I went and was particularly impressed that the Holiday Inn is rated #15 out of the hotels in Orlando. I was definitely not disappointed when I got to the hotel. Firstly, the location is absolutely ideal. It is only a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney and there are other hotels nearby that are great for dinner and a supermarket a short walk in the opposite direction. The hotel also runs free shuttle buses to the disney parks and these are really convenient and much better than the overcrowded disney buses. Universal is a 15 minute ride away in a taxi which only costs about $30 to get there. Secondly the staff in the hotel are fantastic. The man who checked us in was very friendly and when I asked for later check out this was not a problem. The staff in the bar and the restaurant were also extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. Finally, the hotel itself is also fantastic. The room we had was on the 14th floor and was amazing with extra room and two large king size beds. The view from our room was of the pool (also great and never overly busy) and also Downtown Disney. We also saw the fireworks from Epcot if we were in the room at around 9pm. The restaurant and bar serve really tasty food and there is a small self serve section where you can buy drinks, pastries etc most of the day. My only criticism and this shouldn't take away from my positive comments above is that some days the room was serviced late in the afternoon and twice it wasn't cleaned at all. However, as soon as I contacted the Front Desk they sent someone up asap. All in all a fantastic hotel, in a great location with very friendly staff. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Close To Disney Parks -- Less Expensive Than Most "Inside The Park" Disney Hotels”
Reviews.Author: rockdrums
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just outside of the actual Disney Parks, but is extremely close. They have a complimentary shuttle sevice that runs every 30 minutes that picked us up at our hotel and dropped us off by the Downtown Disney area of the park. The shuttle makes several stops along the way at other hotels, but they do it quickly, so it was not much of a hassle. Our room was very clean and seemed newly decorated. We enjoyed the extra special bed linens. Rooms have balconies, flat screen t.v. and the normal amenities that most hotels have these days. The staff was helpful and friendly. We only stayed one night, but we felt it was a slightly better value than most of the actual Disney hotels and we were still close to everything. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Customer090
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our Disney trip with our 11 year old daughter. This hotel was awesome!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel!!! From check in to check out, we were impressed with the staff, the cleanliness, the room, the food, the pool and the bar etc. Our room on the wing looked out at the beautiful pool from the 5th floor. Our daughter ate for free, the coffee was great and the made to order omlette station was superb. What I think impressed us the most about this hotel besides the aforementioned was the friendliness of the staff. Edwin, Freddie and the other waiters and waitresses from the restaurant are the best!!! Alex in the bar was awesome too!! It is a very modern yet elegant hotel that has the shuttle service to all the theme parks and the water parks. I had never used Trip Advisor in the past until choosing this hotel. We are so glad we read ahead and made the decision to choose this hotel. One final note, the beds were awesome and so were the pillows, I slept better at the hotel than at home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, location and service. We will be back !”
Reviews.Author: ronaldski
Reviews.Content: Wish had arranged a longer stay as the longer the stay the better value deals you get. Hope to be back

Reviews.Title: “Finding a Budget in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: ShoestringGuru
Reviews.Content: This my first trip to Disney World and it was also my boyfriend's first time. Because the object of our trip was to go to at least four parks in three days, we didn't opt for the official Disney hotels to save some money. The hotel room was clean, we got a room with a view of the lawns across the street. I've been to a lot of Holiday Inns here and outside the country and found that it's true, Disney nickle and dimes you anyway they can! There's no complimentary breakfast and there's no microwave and refrigerator in sight (so no luck saving money with leftovers and buying groceries)! I'm from New York and I was still taken aback by the price of a pizza and burger at the hotel's restaurant. However, the pool and jacuzzi appeased me because it outside. My boyfriend soaked the sun while I did some laps. Another great thing about the hotel is the free shuttle to and from certain Disney Parks, like Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The hotel is also ten minutes away from Downtown Disney if you want to get a more decent meal.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here after checking out of a disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: OIA65
Reviews.Content: Hopefully this review will not be removed but I went on tripadvisor.com originally and noticed that this hotel had a ranking of 17 out of 300 plus hotels in Orlando and the other hotel had a ranking of around 114. My daughter wanted to stay at a Disney resort (and in the past we did stay at a TRUE WDW resort and we were very happy) so I decided to compromise in the hopes of saving money. I so wish I had gone with the Holiday Inn-in the Walt Disney World Resort to begin with. We started off at the Dolphin with a dirty room, we found someone's nail clippings all over the counter, tiles missing off the wall around the floor area, a sticky floor entrance, and missing closet door upon entering, summed up not a room worth 600.00 for 2 days. After day two I checked out and decided to go with the Holiday Inn. Friendly staff from arrival to departure (the guy that checked us in was great). The room was nice and clean, and believe it or not the view was actually as described (we wanted a view of the fireworks since we missed it while at the Disney and while staying at the Dolphin). I would not stay at the Dolphin again but I would definitely stay at the Holiday Inn-in the Walt Disney World Resort.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel... fill the club member by internet.. good and clean”
Reviews.Author: policemanpr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to down town disney.. all clean and nice the only thing is the parking... why pay for this? no one is check that.. but... in high floors... nice view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Very Clean and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: obtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 40 to stay here the week of July 18-22. The hotel is immaculate in cleanliness. The pool is wonderful. Sitting area around pool is relaxing.Restaurants are within walking distance but you will have to cross a busy street. There is a crossing light at the intersection. The beds are heavenly. The balcony should have been built with bars that you can see through. If you sit in the chairs you cannot see over the balcony. The surrounding area was clean, safe and quiet. I needed some plates for pizza delivery, the on duty person gave me some from the sundry downstairs. The rooms are large. When I got there my fridge & lamp was not working but it was soon taken care of. DTD is within walking distance for those who like to walk. We opted for the shuttle-too much traffic to walk.I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Orlando, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AT_sireN
Reviews.Content: My younger brother and I live overseas. We were visiting Orlando for the first time on vacation and chose to stay at this hotel. It was worth every penny, the shuttle bus services were very convenient (and free). They stop regularly at the hotel so we took it to Downtown Disney the following night from arriving and saw a movie then again the following day to the Disney theme parks. The staff was friendly and informative, especially the waitress who served us dinner (and remembered our order from the night before) as well as the bartender. It was easy to arrange for transportation to and Florida mall (the taxi service they booked for us was very comfortable and straight forward). I was antsy before arrival but everything turned out perfectly, the only "downfall" was that the menu didn't have a vast selection but that wasn't a problem. We told our mom that we'd definitely want to stay there again if returning to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great staff, perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: SarahTony2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 16 nights from 1st July 2011, and had a wonderful time. The location of the hotel is just perfect for guests visiting WDW. Easy access to the parks using the regular and convenient shuttle buses, yet far enough away to get away from the hustle and bustle. I loved coming back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel after a busy day fighting the crowds in the theme parks. The hotel never felt crowded. Fabulous pool area for relaxing, and the pool was always a perfect temperature. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the beds were so comfortable I wanted to bring mine home with me. The staff were always welcoming and friendly, particularly David from guest services / reception area, who always found time to have a chat with us. Perfect location for a safe 5 min walk to Downtown Disney or to Crossroads for a meal in the evening. We definitely hope to stay here again when visiting WDW, and definitely prefer it over the hustle and bustle of the on site Disney hotels. A massive thank you to all the staff at Holiday Inn who made our stay such an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: daddyschamp
Reviews.Content: A great stay for a last minute booking. Not sure why you have to pay for parking, there was plenty available, but oh well. Hotel was in excellent shape and clean throughout. A short and safe walk to Downtown Disney was very convenient as to not fight the traffic and finding parking during the busy months. The pool and hot tub were very relaxing. Not sure we would stay for an extended Disney vacation with small children, but definitly for a short trip or with older childen or even for couples only. We did not utilize the bus service to the parks, but they seemed to be running quite frequently back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: McBurney_treetops
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 2 week stay at this hotel and it was magnificent. I don't normally leave reviews but felt compelled to here. From the moment we arrived off a 9 hour flight, all the staff went out of their way to welcome us and ensure we had everything we needed. This high standard continued throughout our stay. The hotel is clean, modern and welcoming. The restaurant serves great food at great value with kids eating free. The pool is great and a lovely place to unwind after the parks. This hotel ticks ALL the boxes and offers a genuine 5* service. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a vacation in disney. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Descent at the best, - definitely not number one!”
Reviews.Author: traveler85_BostonMA
Reviews.Content: No airport pickup. Taxi from airport cost $50 + tip, on the way back - $55 + tip! Why the difference, who knows. If you decide to rent a car, parking costs $10/$16 a day. Front desk staff was completely ignorant! We arrived early in the day and guess what? Our room was not ready. We thought, OK it is kind of early so I left my cell and asked to call me when the room will become available. We went for a walk and came back a few hours later just to find out that the room is still not ready! I asked again to call while we were sitting in the lobby near the front desk. Two more hours passed by and when finally I started to loose my patients I went back to the front desk. Guess what? It turns out the room was ready for some time but no one bothered to inform us even though they saw us sitting right here in the lobby! The room on 11th floor was clean and beds were comfortable. The view was fine, nothing special. The cleaning lady while doing a great job some days seem to be absent on the others. The trash was left full, the hair still on the bathroom floor and she did not refill the toiletries. Restaurant downstairs had decent food for dinner and was reasonably priced. We did not eat breakfast there, since we decided to try different places every day. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance. Shuttle buses to Disney parks were running late most of the time and almost always full. Once we had to wait for 50 minutes and than three of them showed up at the same time. The bellboy was nice. He arranged for our taxi pickup and when we showed up earlier, he called the taxi to come sooner to the hotel. So, my advice - stay somewhere else where the parking is free, the cleaning people do their jobs on a daily basis, and the front desk staff actually care about the clients!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY way to do Disney”
Reviews.Author: cdxskier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were thoroughly impressed with the Holiday Inn. The staff was professional, the rooms were big and nice, and the shuttle service was prompt and convenient. At $80 a night, this is a screaming value!!! One tip: skip their $15 breakfast buffet and go to Winn-Dixie and stock up bagels and cream cheese. The rooms have refrigerators and microwaves and you'll appreciate the extra dough for the parks. =)

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: luvchocolate
Reviews.Content: After having many bad experiences at hotels with cleanliness issues, I spent a long time reading reviews before choosing to stay at this hotel for a trip to Disney. The reviews were very good but I was still afraid of what I would find. I feel compelled to write this review for all those who are concerned with the cleanliness of the hotle they stay in. From the moment we walked in the hotel was bright and clean loking with the most personable of staff. The halls were clean as was the dining area we passed as we walked to our room. Again as I opened the door I was afraid of what I would find .t I was blown away!! The room was absolutely immaculate. The bedding was clean and fresh and new looking with not one mark of any sort on anything. I undid the beds to inspect as I always do and the sheets too were immaculate. The bathroom was spotless as were the towels and cloths. The carpeting in the room did not have one stain on it and I had no problem at all allowing my daughter to walk barefooted which I normally don't let her do in hotel rooms. I cannot recdommend this hotel enough, our stay was PERRECT and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again on our next trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Best 'NEW' Kid on the Block!”
Reviews.Author: hapitrvlr
Reviews.Content: I 1st stayed here 11/13 & 11/14/10 & realized I hadn't made my review after my recent stay on 6/19 to 6/21/11. This hotel is awesome! The staff from the Front Desk, Valet Guys, Breakfast/Dining, Housekeeping & especially (my favorite person of all) Ashley Mayo (Sales Director) are all very professional, go out of their way to make sure your stay is just right, down right good people! You can really tell they love their jobs! I didn't take a lot of pictures this time round but the ones I had taken last year are just fine. The hotel hasn't changed but don't mistaken that for 'old or run-down'. Completely the opposite! This hotel is in a great location and being among one of the other great hotels on Hotel Plaza, I must say I feel it's the most quiet/comfortable & the value to be on-par. Ok there's no breakfast included, you have to pay for parking and the Disney Store in the Lobby has yet to be opened, that shouldn't hinder your decision for staying here. I've stayed several nights now and I have yet to be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing to get excited about”
Reviews.Author: dgerson75
Reviews.Content: My family just came back from a Disney World vacation and this was the hotel we stayed at for seven nights. We stayed at the hotel based on the reviews and all walked away feeling underwhelmed. While the hotel was nice and the rooms were clean there were a number of issues I didn't see raised that I wanted to pass along. First, while we had originally planned to take advantage of the shuttles we decided at the last moment to rent a car to make it easier to get four adults and three children back and forth in a timely fashion. The hotel charges $10 a day to park your car - not valet, just the right to park your car in a lot that seemed to have plenty of open spaces. Second, the hotel seems to market itself as a Disney member and while we weren't expecting the levels of amenities one gets from an official Disney hotel, I do think we were disappointed at the level of service. There is a desk in the lobby to provide info on Disney World. Great, right? Except that EVERY question we poised got a curt, confused, or befuddled response. Do you have info on the attractions at Animal Kingdom? Nope (delivered in a bored, please go away manner). Which parking lot would be best for eating at the T-Rex restaurant in Downtown Disney? I don't know, I think I have a map. (seriously confused young woman, who while pleasant seemed as knowledgeable as my 6 year-old). Third, walking distance to Downtown Disney??? Really??? Are all you people writing this coming from Manhattan??? It's summer, it's hot, three tired and whiny kids. No I don't think that's a walk I'd advise every night. Do-able, but I don't think it's a selling point for real. In summary, there's nothing wrong with the hotel but I think that people are better off viewing it as a run-of-the-mill Holiday Inn. We all agreed on our way to the airport this morning that all things being equal we'd have probably got the same service at a hotel in Kissimmee. You'd still drive 10-15 minutes to the park and you'd be less annoyed when it's just a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 20th Annual Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Maurice090
Reviews.Content: I sponsored my family's annual Family Reunion 16-19 June in Orlando. It happed to be the 20th anniversary of our family reunion and wanted everything to be perfect. After checking out hotels for weeks, I decided on the Hoiday Inn- Walt Disney Worl Resort. The hotel has been remoled and looked great. The rooms were specious and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Ashley, Marty and Kathleen from the sales and cartering departments were extremely helpful and cooperative. Their willingness to help with food and room pricing made it possible for me to have a larger family turn out. Everyone had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jen2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value with a great location for Disney World visitors. It is within quick walking distance of Downtown Disney and the shuttle comes every half hour to go to the parks, running from an hour before they open to an hour and a half after they close. The hotel was clean and the pool was great. Front desk and valet staff were wonderful! The only disappointing thing was the restaurant. After we checked in we decided to grab a late dinner ( around 8pm). We went to the restaurant and were seated promptly, but that's where the promptness ended. There were only 2 other tables occupied in the restaurant but it took forever for our order to get taken and for our food to arrive. The menu is very limited as well. We stayed 3 days but only ate at the restaurant that one night do to the super slow service and staff. There are plenty of other restaurants close by to go to instead of the hotel one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DougieDaddy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the weekend of June 24th and had a nice time in spite of the rain that weekend. The hotel was nice, the rooms were clean and every staff member we spoke with was friendly and helpful. We ate dinner at the resturant in the hotel (due to a downpour at dinner time), and were pleasently surprised by the nice dinner we had. The food we ordered was nothing fancy (pizza and burgers), but everything was very good. The pizza was actually really good, and kids eat free from the kids menu (1 free kid entree with each paying adult entree). Got a nice room with a balcony. Our balcony had a metal railing. Some balconys have a 3 foot cement wall, so if you want a full view even when seated, you should ask for a room with a metal railing when checking in. The pillow-top beds were comfortable. Not too hard or soft. I saw a few complaints about this hotel from other reviewers, which made me nervous about this place, but they were totally unfounded. I honestly don't know what some people expect some times. Its a holiday inn, not Disney's Grand Floridian. For a hundred or less you can't beat the value of being on Disney property with full park shuttle service (even if you have to pay $10 a day for parking at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and very Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: karlitoways
Reviews.Content: The service was great. We were pleased by the Manager Miss crystal for her special care to our family and always willing to help and called to make sure that everything was to our satisfaction. Room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. There are many restaurants nearby and the hotel have a bar and a nice restaurant . The restaurant has good food and very friendly staff. There was no extra fee except $10 per day for our car parking. We love this hotel and will certainly come back again every time we visit Desiney world or Sea world.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice-would come back again”
Reviews.Author: DoloresZ
Reviews.Content: Although I was there on business and didn't 'get out' much, the location is perfect if you are in Orlando for the Disney thing. Easy walking to Downtown Disney with lots of great restaurants. Hotel facilities for the conference were great, as was my room. Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Location in WDW”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheRock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days early June 2011 for a visit to WDW. Clean, large rooms and great pool/jacuzzi. Restaurant and bar are great too. The shuttle to all 4 parks and both water parks is free and every 1/2 hour. You can walk (10 mins) to Downtown Disney and Disney Quest (20 mins). A 20 minute walk in the other direction is supermarket, restaurants and shops. The hotel is next to a few other hotels (Hilton, etc) and they also have restaurants. IMPORTANT : For a fraction of the cost (I paid US$95/night) you get all the same as a Disney Resort but the pleasure of a lot more peace and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, pleasant staff, will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kbdonohue
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the staff was very nice, and it was close to Disney. The shuttle buses were good. The restaurant had really good food and really, really nice staff that went way out of their way to serve you. My husband said their food was great. Kids ate free, which was a plus. We had the breakfast buffet every morning. It was very nice. The only downside was when we first got there, we had asked and paid for a balcony view. They put us on the bottom floor. We ask them to change us to a higher floor. They immediately changed us to a higher floor. One night, there was a fire alarm at 3:00 a.m. that was a little freaky. We had to go stand outside with our kids for 30 minutes in our pajamas. It was a false alarm. The security guard told us it was a false alarm and then proceeded to ask us if we had a cigarette he could have. I'm in my pajamas at 3:00 a.m. with my children outside having rushed out of our room. No, I don't smoke and didn't have a cigarette and just wanted to get back up to bed after a long day at Disney World. Everything else was great. The pool was great. It was a great experience with a hotel. We wil plan on staying there again when we go back to Orlando. It's also by tons of restaurants and Downtown Disney. My husband didn't care. He thought the food in the hotel restaurant was great and didn't want to go anywhere else. Our deal included free parking and free breakfast buffet. It was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: explorer020
Reviews.Content: The conference members were well taken care of by the staff and the lunches provided were very good. To fill in the evening hours for attendees, Downtown Disney is a convenient and comfortable 15 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel staff was both gracious and friendly. I would most definitely stay here for leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: avkatnet
Reviews.Content: I held a small, 3 day meeting at this hotel. It was not my first choice but what a pleasant surprise! The rooms are nicely decorated, clean, and sound proof. The meals were delicious, and the banquet and events manager could not have been more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: clothlover
Reviews.Content: It's been many years since I have stayed at a Holiday Inn. I was very skeptical because in my opinion Holiday Inns had declined in quality. This hotel location was up to par from the moment of arrival. The hotel had undergone a complete renovation. Staff was out front to greet guests, unload bags and would hold bags until check in time. The room & bed were very comfortable and clean. Spencer (at desk) and Frankie (at Grab n Go) were the two I had contact with. They were friendly, polite and willing to make my stay comfortable. THANKS GUYS!!!! Complimentary roundtrip theme park shuttle. The hotel stay would have been better with a complimentary breakfast or lower cost for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We spent 2 weeks here and loved it.”
Reviews.Author: AndyC1980
Reviews.Content: Not one for reviews, however it must be said that this is a great hotel. The staff were very friendly. Pool is great. Good location, just a couple of mins to Downtown Disney with regular free shuttles to the Disney Parks. There are a couple of bad reviews on here, but I would seriously ignore them. This is certainly one of the best hotels in the area and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last 3 days of our trip, with the first 3 at Animal Kingdom Lodge. While I did miss the novelty of AKL, this hotel was perfectly adequate if you want a clean, safe place to sleep at night that's not too far from attractions. The rooms were nicely updated and clean. We did come back to the room one afternoon to find that all the toilet paper had been taken by housekeeping. Not sure what that was about, but they brought 2 more rolls soon after I placed a call to the front desk. We had a pool view room with balcony which was a nice, large balcony with a small table and chairs. It felt kind of weird looking at the other balconies across the pool with people sitting on them looking right back at you. The buildings were a little too close, IMO to have them facing each other. I wasn't crazy about our room location either because we were in the wing building in the room at the very end. It was quite the trek at the end of the day. Luckily, we had laundry facilities on our floor, although you have to go the 4th floor to get detergent. I think it would be pretty easy to put detergent machines in each laundry room. We ate at the buffet each morning, and I thought it was decent. Would've been better if free, but that ain't gonna happen in the Disney area. I loved that the kids ate free though! That was a big money saver, especially since I have to force mine to eat anything in the morning. The walk to Downtown Disney was easy and convenient. We ate at Fulton's Crab House the first night, which I found to be extremely overpriced with limited selection and bland food. Wish I'd just gone to Capt. Jack's instead. We only used the shuttle buses on one day, since we went to Universal the rest of the time. The ride there was fine, although a bit crowded with standing room only by the time it left our hotel. The bus to go back to the hotel at the end of the day was 20 minutes late with no explanation or apology from the driver. We'd already gotten there 25 minutes before the bus was scheduled to arrive, so we waited 45 minutes for the, once again, standing room only bus to arrive. The only other gripe I have is that we asked valet to call us a cab to take us back to the airport on our last day. He called a shuttle, which I really don't know if there's a difference, but it was $65 one way to the airport. I didn't expect it to be that much, and am not sure if a cab, which I'd requested, would've been cheaper. All in all, the hotel is clean, convenient, and very reasonably priced. If you don't need all the hooplah of a Disney property, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: MKSB
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with a nice large pool. The restaurant service was extremely friendly but very slow. There is a shuttle every 30 minutes to Magic Kingdom but they drop you off at the monorail station/ferry station so then you have to take one of these to the park enterance (just like everyone who drives their own car). While free shuttle is great, plan on 40 minutes from the time you leave the hotel until you are actually in the park. My 6 year old found the whole process to when added onto all the other excitement of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Chooses this hotel for it's value”
Reviews.Author: Gr8erEscapes
Reviews.Content: Spent nine nights here with a large family group. The value made it possible. Breakfast buffet included in the price really helped. The staff was pleasant, though some appeared to be quite inexperienced. The biggest problem was the bus service to/from the parks - different answers on scheduling depending upon whom you asked. Location near Downtown Disney was a real plus. Would stay here again if I was on a budget - and, who isn't?

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing place.”
Reviews.Author: GrannieB43
Reviews.Content: I selected this Holiday Inn based on Tripadvisor reviews and I'm glad that I did. This hotel was the rendezvous spot for our group of 11 before we hit Wilderness Lodge and Disney World. After a 2 day drive for some in our group, this hotel was just what we needed in the way of comfort, cleanliness and quiet rooms. The staff members we encountered were very helpful. Some of the past reviews complained about the cost of food at the hotel's restaurant, Palm Breezes, but we found many restaurants nearby that gave us other options. Another surprise was the close proximity of Downtown Disney, which was within walking distance. For my 5 grandchildren, the swimming pool was the best feature. After 2 days of rest and relaxation at this Holiday Inn, we were ready to tackle Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: zimaaaaah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a cruise departure because we wanted to be close to Downtown Disney. Check-in was fast and accurate. Room space was adequate for one night but would not want to spend a week-long vacation. Room was very clean and updated. Only big problem I noticed was that the counter in the bathroom was extremely small. No room for "stuff" on countertop at all which is a big issue with 3 females in party! Location was right across from DTD which is what we wanted. Didn't plan on the excessive traffic issues however. It was literally gridlocked for part of the night. Not sure how much of that was due to being Memorial Day weekend Friday though. Might not always be that bad?? Pool & bar both looked very inviting, but did not experience either due to time constraints. One negative was parking. They charge a $10 parking fee for self-parking but then do not provide adequate spaces for paying guests. I am sure they want the higher fee for "valet" parking they offer, but from the looks of the "valets" that were hanging out smoking and being loud in the front of the hotel, there would be no way I would leave my car ( even my rental!) with them. My youngest daughter commented that they creeped her out when we walked by. Goods: updated property, comfy beds, reasonable rate Bads: Scary "valets", charging for subpar parking

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant !”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando with my mother and aunt. The hotel is very well located, closed to Dwntwn Disney. From the outside the hotel looks updated, but the inside is very modern and nice. We arrived early and the room was ready, the self park for $10 p/night and we took the bus that stops at the hotel to Magic K. We have continental breakfast for $10 p/p and dinner the night we arrived for the park late and everything around was closed and everything was great and well served. All the staff was very nice. We also have wi fi . Overall it was a very pleasant stay. I will reccommend this hotel absolutely !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!! Downtown Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: STEAMBOATWILLY1
Reviews.Content: Brand new renovated, clean new rooms, wonderful atmosphere, walking to downtown marketplace, buses to park available....Highly recommended! WE WILL BE GOING BACK!........can not go wrong for 99 a nite

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but check were your room is!”
Reviews.Author: sticks60
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 day stay. Only problem was check-in. I called ahead looking for a high floor room and facing a certian direction. On arrivial I ended up with a low floor room right on #4, the wrong direction. Check your reserviation and there is different costs for different rooms. Front desk staff took care of the problem the best they could. Ended up with 2 queens not 1 king. Great breakfast!! Close to the park at half what Disney would charge you. Also the business center is closed. I had to use the front desk system to check e mails.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aicirtapc5
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location on Disney property without paying the high price. The rooms were very clean and the staff was helpful. Pool area was nice with plenty of room for everyone. Parking is a bit hard to find and annoying to pay $10 per day. Always hot water in the shower but the pressure was lacking and the same goes for the toilet. I appreciate a quiet flush from a but it could barely even get toilet paper down. No major problems. All in all it was a good a hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NearlyRetired68
Reviews.Content: We are senior citizens who appreciate a quiet environment. We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 5 nights and have only positive things to say about it. The employees were pleasant and consistently helpful. The room was fine. Internet was free, which was great. The location was great as we could easily walk to Downtown Disney or to a non-Disney strip mall which had several restaurants. We only used the restaurant once, and we thought it was over-priced, so after that, we ate elsewhere. The shuttles worked as described (every 30 minutes). We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Successful Conference”
Reviews.Author: mccutcha
Reviews.Content: We held a conference for 105 people at the location and could not have been happier with the service, food, location, and the room accommodation. The staff was highly professional and went above and beyond to meet our expectations. I would definitely use this hotel again for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Holiday Inn Great Pool just a little too hot”
Reviews.Author: grandmamajoy
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at WDW resorts but wanted to be around Disney not in DIsney But we really were in Disney they even had a shuttle for teens to go to parks I laid out by pool all day Pool was a little too warm for me which usually hotels not on WDW grounds are not really heated Breakfast bar was a rip off waiter explained it different than what the real price was language barrier Emailed hotel 4 times on breakfast bar matter and still haven't gotten a response

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy but avoid the Orange Lake Time share trap at all costs”
Reviews.Author: shewill50
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are just back from a wonderful four night stay at Holiday Inn at WDWR. The location is a 7 minute safe walk to Downtown Disney. Our room was clean and safe. It is bare bones but very sufficient for a comfortable stay. I loved the 4 pillows on each queen size bed. The shuttles ran frequently. The pool was cool and the hot tub hot just as it would be in May. The expensive breakfast ws over priced at 14.95 for cold scrambled eggs and so so buffet. Don't eat there. The hotel itself and stay was was perfect. But be very aware of the Time share trap known as Orange Lake. It is disguised as a ticket seller right next to the main desk at teh Holiday Inn . I was stupid enough to take the tour promised to be a mere 90 minutes. It took 3 hours of hard sell pressure a total waste of time at the most rock bottom of all possible timeshares. Orange Lake eems to specialize specialize in tattooed, poor black and red neck families who can not possible afford $90 a month and $800 a year in dues forever. I am a 60 year old recent widow with out grandchildren. I should have been an poor prospect but that did not seem to matter. I had to say no to four different pushy sales men. Do not buy tickets from the Holiday Inn buy them from the park. You will save yourself a time share nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good value and recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: RichR49
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the hotel was uneventful and efficient. The hotel appearance and room condition was remarkably nice. Plenty of room with a balcony facing the pool. Pool closes late, around 11 pm, and not full of kids when we were there. Lots of chairs and towels. The hottub was too hot for us. 10 min walking distance from Downtown Disney, and bus service to the attractions. Getting back was a problem as the bus didnt show up at the specified time. Standing for an hour on a blazing hot parking lot waiting for the A bus was no fun, but not the hotel's fault. Breakfast is either $9.50 for an omlette/waffle, or $15 for everything. The omlette station had limited ingredients to choose from, but was good value, coffee and juice are included. Waitstaff was good. Internet is fast, setup is a bit confusing. Gripe: to management: Self-parking 1s $10/day, and not in the most convenient spots. Those spots near the entrance are blocked by traffic cones, taken up for the valet parking people who run to bring the cars to the entrance. Go figure. The paying guests who walk to their cars should get the good spots, let the valet parking kids park their cars out back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: emma∼on
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8-22 May 2011. We are both mid to late twenties. We stayed on the top floor and in room 1401. I initially looked for us to stay here because I had previously stayed here prior to the building being closed due to hurricane Katrina. The hotel is based on Hotel Plaza Boulevard; it is a 10 minute walk (maximum) to Downtown Disney and in the opposite direct 15 minutes to the Crossroads complex. DTD has lots of restaurants and Disney themed stores. DTD can get pretty busy for eating, it’s probably best to go relatively early or then wait for the rush to decline to minimise wait times. The crossroads has a 24 hour supermarket, crazy golf (great fun) and many very reasonable restaurants. We booked to stay here via Florida4less and felt we got a good deal. On arrival we were impressed with the reception areas modern decor and the friendliness of the front desk staff. Check in was quick and hassle free. Our room was very spacious. We were facing the I4 and initially concerned the road noise would keep us awake. Fortunately it did not however, a lighter sleeper may struggle. The road noise was prominent in the background but did not cause us any problems. The room had 2 queen beds, HD TV, mini fridge, desk and an armchair. We felt the storage for clothes could have been a fraction bigger. The bathroom was spacious and had a very convenient cubby hole behind the door to store wash bags etc. The hair dryer was excellent and I’d recommend you leave yours at home to save the luggage weight. I didn’t use mine once! The only very minor point worth making is that we felt the cleaning standard / regime seemed questionable at times. There was some dust and marks on surfaces etc and upon our final room check before leaving we found a receipt under the bed from 3 May (5 days before we arrived!!). The beds were made / changed and clean towels so we weren’t overly fussed and didn’t see it as a huge problem but think it’s worth mentioning. The pool is very nice and large. There are plenty of loungers and towels available but limited parasols for people who like shade. A plus is the pool fountain to drain out any road noise. The pool is open late too. The front desk staff are excellent and very helpful. The day before our departure we planned to check in our flight on line but the business centre was down. They allowed me to use their front desk computers free of charge to check in without a hint of inconvenience. There is a complimentary bus to all Disney parks that runs every 30 minutes. Getting to the park it’s great but can seem to take a longer period of time to get home. Tip - the water park bus only collects you at 4 and 5 so if you want to leave earlier you can catch the Disney transportation to Saratoga Springs. If you get off the stop titled Congress park it is a short walk to DTD and the hotel. Quite frequently the Saratoga Springs bus does also stop off a DTD so always worth checking with the driver. There is a bus stop 5 minutes away from the hotel where you can catch the 55 to Seaworld (20 minutes) or 111 to the airport (50 minutes) for $2 pp. The hotel is a 20 minute cab ride to Universal (about $25 each way) - tip order a Mears cab and do not use Star that have slots outside the hotel. Our single journey with Star was not enjoyable (poor control of bodily functions and appalling driving!). Overall we had an amazing holiday in Orlando and great stay in the Holiday Inn. I would happily stay here again when we return to the sunshine state!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: panterka27
Reviews.Content: It was great , until we checked out and my husband forgot his cell phone in the room . When we came home after 9 hours flight I called to your hotel right away to check if they can go to the room and see if the cell phone still there. But in the reception I was told that they can't go into the room because it was occupied already.....So I called next day - got same answer...On the third day security called me and said there was nothing in the room . Of course after 3 days the cell phone has been stolen . I didn't expect this kind of service from Holiday Inn . The hotel was clean and nice , but customer service is disgusting .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with wrong people particularly in the Hospitality industry.”
Reviews.Author: ZubinD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel in May '11 with my wife and son. The Hotel is nice (not very friendly ONLY proffessional) people at the reception. One expects to see some smiling faces after a tiring flight ! Well the rooms are great and so is the pool. Most importantly, the restaurant is an absolute farce considering it's a 'Holiday Inn'. Their franchise in Mumbai has much better food with a larger variety ! N friendly staff. The choice of food is very poor, not even 5 Pasta dishes, no Continental, Chinese, and NOTHING for the vegetarians ! I think not many hotels consider vegetarians particularly Indian travellers who are today one of the biggest spenders compared to the Americans themselves ! The waiters in the restaurant will ONLY give you good service IF they are happy with your tips. God forbid if you leave a Dollar less, be prepared to be royally ignored the next day EVEN if you call out to them. Do I smell Racism here ? Hotels round the world can learn a lesson or 2 from Indian hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST SERVICE IN ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: todski85
Reviews.Content: 8 Family members, 3 rooms, 2 weekends. from Albert at the front desk to Edwin in the cafe. service was the best. every rooms clean, modern and quiet pool was great and the hotel is very close to the parks

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: MoodyPoint
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day Orlando vacation. We stayed at this Holiday Inn before the hurricane several years ago and were anxious to see the newly refurbished hotel. The central court rises up the full fourteen floors. At the base is a restaurant. For a hotel restaurant, the food is good. There is a large zero entry pool with a lap lane at one end. It is surrounded by a very spacious deck area with plenty of chairs. We were on the fourteenth floor with a Downtown Disney view. We could see the fireworks at Epcot from our balcony. The room is spacious with a nice bathroom. The hotel is right next to I-4 but we did not hear the traffic with our patio door closed. The bed was very comfortable. What gets this hotel the rave reviews is the very friendly staff. The front desk representatives were extremely helpful. The wait staff in the restaurant was very attentive. Just about every employee we encountered had a smile or a greeting. Many went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. We had one maintenance problem which was resolved within minutes. All in all we had a very pleasant stay and we plan on returning to this hotel next year. Its reasonable price, close proximity to Downtown Disney and regular free shuttle to the Disney Parks makes it an ideal vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - when they say "balcony" they don't mean "balcony."”
Reviews.Author: ihrtVT
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a fine place to stay. It's just average - nothing overly glitzy or standout about it, but it is in a convenient location (they say the walk to Downtown Disney is 5 minutes, but it's probably less than that and the complimentary shuttles are a bonus). However, I just wanted to give folks the heads up that if you pay extra for a balcony room with view (of pool or Downtown Disney), they also consider a ground-level patio to be a "balcony." So if you truly want a "view," you must talk to someone before you get there to ensure that you are getting what you want. They did change our room, after putting us in a room with a patio, but first tried to convince me that it was the balcony that I had paid extra for. Other than that, I agree with what other reviewers have said about the breakfast - it's overpriced for what you get. $9.95 for the continental buffet, which you get for free at most places (like a Hampton Inn, for example). The food is generic (had one lunch and then breakfast each day there). The pool area is nice and our room was VERY quiet - we slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “It is clean, quiet with comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Lan998
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed there for a week. It is very clean and quiet. We were on 4th floor facing the beautiful pool. Had a good view from the balcony. The pillow-top mattress is super comfortable. With two sets of pillows (firm and soft), we got good night sleep every night. The hotel food service is a bit slow, but the food tastes good. The staff is friendly. We requested an extra blanket, and received it the same day. Ask for the shuttle bus schedule if you need one.The buses are on time. There were no buses go to the water parks after 10 am. Took us long time to get there.

Reviews.Title: “The best Disney hotel outside of Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Mcnunu
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic, it's within a 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney, it has shuttles to the various Disney parks every 30 minutes, the pool view is gorgeous, the rooms are clean and bright, the decor is new and service was brilliant. My significant other and I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at this hotel. For cheaper than what you'd pay to stay at a Disney budget hotel (read dingy Pop Century) you can stay here. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the shuttle service was excellent. It's not like those hotels which only offer 1 shuttle pick up and return a day, it offers them every 30mins until 90 mins after the parks close. Even if you miss that last shuttle because you got too caught up in capturing those hard to come by empty park photos, you can just grab any Disney shuttle that goes to Downtown Disney and walk back to the hotel because it's so close! They have an arcade and a fitness room, not that you'll need it with the amount of walking you'll be doing at the parks all day and the pool looks simply amazing, I wish I had the opportunity to take a dip in it. I would definitely return here on my next trip to Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: s246002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 1 block from Downtown Disney. From there you can travel, by bus, to any of the resorts and transfer to a bus going to the parks. Great location if you don't want to stay at a Disney resort or want a cheaper alternative. The hotel was remodeled in 2010. The room was very nice and clean. We were on the second floor right above the pool, during our stay it was not loud but I assume it can be. Bathroom was large and modern. The restaurants on property seemed to have reasonable prices. I would recommend this hotel due to its wonderful location to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick on the Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: CHEERNMOM55
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great pool and a really good breakfast buffet. Beds are too soft for my liking. If they upgrade them , I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with very friendly staff and a great pool”
Reviews.Author: BLS13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Disney 3 extra days after a trade show. This hotel was recently redone and is in great shape. The restaurant is great for breakfast. Wegot delicious room service pizza one evening. The pool area is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: KellyRae411
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, quiet, and not overly kid oriented which is exactly what I was hoping for after a day at the parks with my 10 year old. No rental car needed as free shuttles to Disney parks running every 30 minutes and a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney and a 15 minute walk in other direction to shops and restaurants. Room was sufficient, fridge only- no microwave. Lack of quality workmanship of the cosmetic remodel was apparent. We stayed a week and will stay again. Tip: Be flexible about your Disney experience. We got the park hopper which was wonderful because we found out rather quickly that there is a mass exodus at Animal Kingdom at 5 p.m. and little to no wait at Magic after 8 p.m. There is an "A" and "B" shuttle based on which side of the Plaza Blvd your hotel is on. Take either and walk a block back to your hotel or if you want to go straight to Downtown Disney from a park, exit at the Hilton (A) or the Plaza (B) as there are no shuttles from the parks directly to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service made for a successful meeting!”
Reviews.Author: FAA_AFS640
Reviews.Content: Ashley Mayo and Marty Cleveland made sure that our seminar meeting went without a hitch, and we look forward to coming back again this year.

Reviews.Title: “center of it all”
Reviews.Author: RyanBader
Reviews.Content: I went during school break so i guess the hotel was packed with kids.. a bit noisy but fun and the service staff was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveCruising
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Holiday last Saturday, mostly because of the great reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. Extremely friendly staff, everyone had a smile on their face. Hotel is very nice, beautiful pool area and the MOST comfortable bed we have ever slept in at a hotel! We walked to Downtown Disney, took less than 10 mins, even though it's a very busy street the nice wide sidewalks are more than ample for walking. Bus from the hotel runs there as well. We would most definitely stay again and would recommend it to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Disney World”
Reviews.Author: dorothy0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about center on Hotel Plaza Blvd. Hotel Plaza Blvd. had Downtown Disney on end end and a shopping plaza with a grocery store and less expensive restaurants on the other end, all within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hotel restaurant had good food but the service was lousy. The pool was very nice. It was large and had a zero depth entrance that works well for very young children. And the patio around it was very spacious with more than enough furniture. The shuttle buses to and from the Walt Disney parks worked great. The Holiday in is the second pick-up stop so the bus was never full, which I was worried about. Another nice feature was being able to escape the Disney hoop-lah at the end of the day. This hotel also caters to conventions so it was not over run with children.

Reviews.Title: “Jsut stayed here for the 5th time!”
Reviews.Author: MikeP57
Reviews.Content: If you've been to Orlando you know you have many choices when it comes to hotels. The Holiday Inn on Hotel Plaza Blvd. has become my #1 place to stay when I come for business or on a vacation with my family. It's home away from home. The staff is friendly and helpful, top notch. The rooms are clean and well done, the beds are perfect for a good night's sleep (not all hotel beds are)! The shower is plenty hot.The workout room is always open and never crowded. There is a bar in the lobby, a restaurant and a great "grab and go spot" that has huge, tasty muffins for $1.50 (are you kidding me). Pleanty of parking. The hotel is right off of I-4 and a shuttle bus ride or a 5 minute walk to Down Town Disney. If you get the right view you'll see a great fireworks display around 10pm. I know it sounds like I own the place but after 5 stays and consistantly great experiences I will always stay here when in Orlando and I strongly suggest you give this Holiday Inn a try. These folks know what excellent service is, for me a perfect 10!

Reviews.Title: “Smiles”
Reviews.Author: TechGirl57
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have ever been so warmly greeted by hotel staff. On arrival (many hours before official check in time) Kella instilled confidence that she would work to find a pleasant room and have it cleaned as soon as possible. Even though it was several hours later before my room was ready, Kella kept me updated and inspired confidence that everything that could be done was being done to get my room ready. Because of her lovely smile and enthusiasm, she made the wait less unpleasant. She is the perfect example of excellent customer service. I must also commend the staff in the restaurant where I had breakfast two mornings. Every single person there was enthusiastic and eager to help make it a pleasant breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: puglover11
Reviews.Content: Despite the prominently displayed "award for best remodel" this Holiday Inn did not live up to our expectations. The room was pleasant and clean, but lacked any means to hang up swimsuits or wet clothes. The laundry facilities were inadequate and poorly placed. The soap machine was out of Tide and nobody bothered to put a sticky note, not even after we asked the front desk because the machine ate 5 quarters. Room service trays sat outside rooms for over 18 hours before being picked up. The dining room was disorganized. There is no internal stairway that lets out inside the building: it opens straight to the outdoor patio. The portico drips and left a treacherously slippery puddle that dropped one member of our party to the ground. The location is convenient to Disney attractions, but the hotel itself is disappointing. We were frequent refugees to the next door Hilton for provisions and decent meals.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay again”
Reviews.Author: fcsomers
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff is great. The were very pleasant and eager to assist. The rooms were clean as a whistle. We had a great room overlooking Downtown Disney and were able to watch the fireworks every night. The only drawback was the restaurant. The food wasn't bad, but the restaurant seemed extremely understaffed, especially during dinner hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near Disney”
Reviews.Author: rbourn
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great bargain - I was impressed with the various staff, their menu and the overall property. If you're in decent shape its within walking distance to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: wingingpom
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms at this hotel after reading about it on trip advisor from walking in and meeting allan on the front desk who couldn't have been more helpful to seeing the rooms it was all good. the rooms we booked was one standard and one downtown disney view both on the 14th floor both rooms were large with desk and sofa at one end and balcony the view down through the centre of the hotel to the dining room was a little scarey from 14th floor. the standard room was $109 a night the other was $132 the only thing with the standard room is that it faces the busy I-4 motorway so you hear the traffic ate breakfast which was extra but good one morning but with so many eateries just down the road at Lake Beuna Vista it's nice to try a few olive gardens and longhorn steakhouse were both excellant but Hooters was poor both service and quality

Reviews.Title: “One word....Amazing”
Reviews.Author: metfanatic11
Reviews.Content: Can't find one negative thing to say about this place. We got a great deal through Expedia ($109), the location is perfect (right on Disney grounds) and the hotel itself is amazing. Spotless from the second you walk through the door, it even smells great in here! They let us check in over an hour early so we were able to go out and enjoy the pool and hot tub. Everything in the hotel looks brand new. I will definately be staying here on our next Orlando trip, even if I have to pay a little more...it'd be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Book with Confidence...We had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: The_Ontario_Family
Reviews.Content: We have not written a review before but we are so pleased with our stay that we had to write one. So many times people write reviews because of their poor experiences but we are writing this one to spread the warmth of the staff at this Holiday Inn. We stayed 11 days at this newly renovated hotel and we ate every day in the Palm Breeze restaurant in the center of the open concept tower. Exceptional service by Fouad and Que is second to none and we honestly consider these two invaluable employees friends now. Great food with even better service was a pleasant surprise. Ask for them by name and you will not regret it. I know that Alex and Que make great Pina Coladas because my wife does not usually drink but she managed to take a liking to their tropical refreshments. Bonnie, the Food and Beverage manager is professional and truly cares about making sure their guests are looked after...and yes, a manager that listens. We would recommend a room in the tower with a view of Downtown Disney and overlooks the pool. The view is great and you see the fireworks at night. Thanks Rondell for the great room! The hotel is walking distance to downtown disney and the shuttle bus service to the parks are very efficient and right on time. This is a great door to door service that is available right in front of the hotel. Special thanks to Fouad for going above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. Have a great and well deserved holiday when you go back home to Morocco. Can't say enough and we were truly sad to leave...we will be back. Brenda, Andy, and Logan

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable experience, great service”
Reviews.Author: Robert0100
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The staff, especially Chad, were super nice. The location was good. We even changed a reservation in another hotel so we could stay an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently I'm so valued a customer I get the noisy room”
Reviews.Author: KTB75
Reviews.Content: I happen to be a priority rewards member, which I only mention because the front desk went on and on how much they value me and how they "upgraded" my room. The beds were way to soft, the noise was constant all night, and the serving staff in the restaurant were condescending to my mother. Not a great night; not worth the money to me.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel excellent for location and value.”
Reviews.Author: rdwoodard
Reviews.Content: Service was very good, and the room was clean, comfortable with very comfortable sleeping accommodations. The location was great, and the amenities met or exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff, great deal, will never stay at disney again!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferHighland_IN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 21/2yr old son just returned from Disney. We were very impressed by the Holiday Inn, the hotel newly remodeled, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool was heated and great for little ones with the zero depth entry. The room was very roomy, larger than Disney's moderate priced hotel rooms and also quite a bit cheaper as well. The hotel and room was very clean and had no problems with housekeeping. The free bus service to Disney attractions was a plus. This hotel is definietly giving Disney World's hotels a run for there money. After staying here we will definitely be back and will not stay in Disney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel blemished by little things...”
Reviews.Author: InAces
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of it's excellent rating -- which it more than lived up to in everything but service and attention to detail. The view of the pool was beautiful, the room was quiet to extraneous noises, the bed was extremely comfortable and the in-room coffee and coffee maker were among the best I've ever had period. Oh, and let me not forget the wide-screen HDTV - a real treat for those of us still tied to the tube. Our one visit to the dining room was fabulous, although pricey at $40 for breakfast buffet for two, juice and coffee. The waiter was politely pleasant, and the omelette, prepared on the spot for you by a world-class omelette-maker made it quite worth the price. The bartender, with a quite empty bar, was attentive and quick to recommend an alternative wine when the ordered wine was not in stock. Where the hotel fell short was in the housekeeping department -- and it's those little things in that department that can make or break a guest's perception of a hotel. First night - no extra roll of toilet paper or extra box of tissues. A gasping moment for a person suffering from intense allergies. The toilet seat was unfastened on one side, making utilization of the throne not only an endeavour in paper conservation, but a physical balancing act as well. Chalked it up to, "oh well, maybe they're running low, and will discover the missing seat fastener when they clean tomorrow and will promptly fix it." Yeah. No such luck. The seat never was fixed during our stay. No, I didn't call to complain about it because I believe things like this should be taken care of without guest intervention. Housekeeping should have alerted necessary staff to the problem and it should have been fixed without us having to call about it. Not that calling would have gotten us anywhere -- as eveidenced by the call we DID make to the desk about the toilet paper situation. "We'll be right there," said the voice on the other end of the phone. No toilet paper ever came, necessitationg a trip to the public restroom -- outside -- on the other side of the pool deck -- where we swiped a roll of toilet paper to replace the empty roll in our room. You know what? A call about a lack of toilet paper would be considered an emergency if hotel staff suffered from a bladder infection. Third night -- the extra roll of toilet paper and extra box of tisses (over which we celebrated jubilantly) was quickly tempered by the lint explosion left behind on our bodies, clothes, hair and eveything else in the room after using the towels after a shower. Seriously. Like sand. Everywhere. Again, I wish to chalk up these little disappointments to an overwhemled staff or a fully packed house or a very busy week or whatever. I will be back -- and will hope for the best.

Reviews.Title: “Can Not Fault this hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: indie1444
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at this hotel for 14 nights. I absolutely recommend this to other people looking for hotels in the Walt Disney area. The staff are extremely friendly and always willing to help you. Was always welcomed with a friendly smile and greeting. The room I stayed in had 2 queen size beds , LCD tv and was very clean. The cleaners do a good job. Good size room too. Very spacious. The telephone in our room was slighly crackly so we informed reception and we had another one brought to us within less than 5 minutes ! Swimming pool is very clean and hot like a bath ! Restaurant in hotel is reasonably priced too and food is nice. There are restaurants , a supermarkey and Downtown Disney all within walking distance. Shuttles to the disney parks run twice an hour and always on time! Just note that Universal Studios/Island of Adventure , Wet n Wild and and Seaworld are not part of Disney so you have to get cabs there. Shuttles do not go there. I would most definately stay at this hotel again. The staff here are a credit to the Holiday Inn chain. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, and overall experience for families”
Reviews.Author: budsfan29
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights and wanted to be in Walt Disney World so as not to rent a car. The Holiday Inn is in a fantastic location, just a 10 minute walk to the shops and restaurants of Downtown Disney. It has shuttles to the Disney parks every 30 minutes and the trips are about 20-30 minutes in length. The rooms are very comfortable with two queen beds (as opposed to two doubles at many Disney hotels) and a nice sized and updated washroom. The only downside to our room was that it faced the freeway so it was a little noisy during the day. However, none of us had any problems sleeping at night. The pool is very nice and large with a very warm water temperature. Our two young children really enjoyed playing in the shallow beach entry side. The service in all aspects was excellent, but particularly in the restaurant. It has a great deal for breakfast. Kids eat at the buffet for free, even if the adults only purchase the continental or eggs / belgian waffles station instead of the entire buffet. So our entire family could eat breakfast heartily for $20! I thought it was great that they let me fill up a carry out cup with coffee and take it with me each morning. Especially considering the very low rate we paid, we would definitely stay here again next time we come to Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, non-existant staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCates365
Reviews.Content: There's nothing positive I can say about my experience. Multiple issues with horrible customer service, profane language from staff around kids and general lack of helpful amenities and services. Pay the extra $50 and stay at the Hilton next door, they obviously have a better thing going there.
