Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: mominzona
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Disney with four adults and four children. Albert (he is awesome) greeted us when we arrived, checked us in quickly with the adjoining rooms we had requested. Everything was clean and bright and just what we needed! Pool was beautiful and the transportation to the Disney resort was a really nice featuree.. The only issue we had was the hotel restaraunt - with only two other customers, at nine at night, we waited for over an hour and a half to be seated and at least another 45 min to get served. We did not try a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Front Desk! Ready to go..”
Reviews.Author: deltadarling
Reviews.Content: I am actually leaving on Saturday for Orlando. We are staying at this hotel for four nights. I called the other day with a million questions and the lady who answered the phone was more than happy to answer every little question that I had about shuttles, food, rooms, walks, parks, everything. We talked for awhile and she did not make me feel rushed at all. It made me feel like we had definitely made the right decision to stay at this hotel. We are ready to get there!

Reviews.Title: “ROOM SERVICE NON-EXISTENT”
Reviews.Author: TripJim
Reviews.Content: I called for food room service at 9:00 PM. A recorded message said to leave my room number and a return call would be made immediately. I called again and left a message, since I was starving. I never received a call back.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor service not to Disney standards”
Reviews.Author: Mrkevinburgess
Reviews.Content: We stayed Feb/March 2011. The room is very clean, and bus to Disney parks on time but the service here is very poor and not to Disney standards. They won't change traveller chq's, or order you a taxi, the porter have to order the taxi and they must have a link with this small company who have dodgy cars and drivers, they couldn't even fit the cases in the car on the wait to the airport. Had to wait 30 minutes to get a drink in the bar. Although they mention they are a Disney partner hotel the service is not to Disney standards and they don't have Character breakfasts as advertised, and the Disney shop closed, so not great for the children. If you like swimming just a point if you have children no lifeguards at all here, and parts of the pool are deep. Overall depends on what you want but this is by far the worse service I have had in any hotel in any country and would recommend you stay somewhere else where you can easily get same or better room and hotel quality but with good service as you don't want little bits of bad service when on holiday. Final point if your in a room facing the road you hear the cars all night, so not so quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in an incredibly convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Swygertr
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family recently to Orlando to see a Wicked show and do a little downtown Disney shopping. This hotel was fantastically reviewed and fairly reasonably priced so I decided to give it a try. First of all, let me say that the location is phenomenal, right off the interstate and convenient to ample dining, gas stations ad the all desirable Downtown Disney. This hotel is also on a shuttle route with Downtown Disney which picks up every 30 minutes which was nice. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was very inviting and you are presented with a nicely decorated modern lobby, which leads into the bar/restaurant downstairs. The hotel has a very clean modern look to it, and the recent renovations definitely shine. We opted for a balcony with view of Downtown Disney, which was gorgeous at night but not a necessity (especially not for the extra 25 or so dollars). My only suggestion is to request a room above the 7th floor or so, as the noise from the restaurant tends to travel upwards in the morning. Overall, a very clean hotel with just the right amount of amenities in a perfect location. If you register for their free priority club membership (which takes all of 5 seconds to do) you also get a $10 room credit, which we excitedly utilized for a fantastic Eggs Benedict the next morning. Don't overlook this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good things we found out from our stay”
Reviews.Author: CrosbyArch
Reviews.Content: We (family of four, two kids 9 and 11) stayed at the HI Downtown Disney president's weekend for four nights (disney vacation). Found the hotel to live up to the positive reviews on this site. We enjoyed the convenience, proximity and comfort of the hotel. I find after staying there that there were several things that are positives which haven't been mentioned yet: - Hotel is short walk from Downtown Disney, but also a 12-15 minute walk from the Crossroads restaurants and stores with numerous restaurants as alternatives to the macro downtown disney (Chevy's, BUff wild wings, fuddruckers, McD's and many more plus a grocery store) - there are also nice restaurants at the Hilton property close nearby (and a disney gift store there) - Hotel restaurant was good...at times slow but food good. very convenient alternative at the end of a long day at the parks. - Elevators work fast - Hotel's official online photos seem to be drab and uninspired, but the pool is nice, there is a small bar and grill (indoors) next to the pool, a nice casual sitting/dining area next to the pool where one can have a bite from the grill or a drink. - Clientele is mix of business and some family -- not teeming with kids but many seen with families. - Don't forget kids eat free and free wireless. - Disney buses every 30 minutes to the big four parks -- we didn't need a car. There is a decision to be made on whether a disney property is what you want (extra park hrs, theme, etc)... but we found this to be a very comfortable, convenient alternative that allowed us to get a lot of park time in yet come home to a very civilized hotel. Staff is very nice and responsive too as stated throughout this site.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Comfortable right in Downtown Disney Area”
Reviews.Author: mermaiden27
Reviews.Content: Convenient to Downtown Disney with shuttles that run like clockwork to all the Disney attractions! Hotel was clean, staff was super friendly. We ate breakfast at the buffet and had a nite-cap poolside at the lounge. Nicer than many of the Disney hotels we have stayed at and would definitely recommend to anyone going to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay near Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: gyea98
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and we were very glad we ended up staying here. We got a great deal on the room and the hotel was newly renovated and very clean and modern looking. Our room had a king size bed and a small couch that had a pull-out bed that our son crashed on. Our bed was very comfortable, the only issue we had was with the pillows (they were all pretty firm for our tastes). Our bathroom was very nice and extremely clean. The hotel pool was very nice as was the hot tub. We were able to take a free shuttle to the Disney resorts and were within walking distance to downtown Disney. Every person in the hotel was extremely nice and helpful, we highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AuldCom
Reviews.Content: HI Disney World is a good hotel that I would maybe more recommend for business purpose rather than leisure. Anyway, I can’t really fault it. Room was large and clean, friendly staff, nice pool, etc. It’s located 10 minutes walk from very popular Disney Downtown. A free shuttle leaves every 30 minutes to main Disney parks, good deal. A very good value compared to overpriced “official” Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jannymac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting the Disney Parks. The Complimentary Buses to the parks was great! They came on time and we had no problem getting to and from all the parks. The hotel is within walking distance (5-10 min) of Downtown Disney which is great for shopping and restaurants and entertainment. They also provide bus service in the evenings to Downtown Disney although we chose to walk it. We ate in the hotel's restaurant for dinner one night and it was good and not too expensive. We also ate breakfast there a few times. Loved the grab and go food area also. The pool area was very nice and the hot tub was wonderful after walking all day. The staff was always friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel. The only thing I missed was a microwave in our room. We would have liked to heat up some left over food. The refrigerator was great to have.

Reviews.Title: “Just the most ideal place to stay when visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: cleminternet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I normally stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress, which never disappoints. However, due to the room type we prefer being unavailable, we checked out other options and stumbled on The Holiday Inn in the WDW resort. What a find. We reasoned that a close location, that offered comfortable, clean accommodation, with a decent breakfast, would be ideal, after all we were not looking for a hotel that provided other services, due to the nature of our visit i.e. to visit Disney World. A search on TripAdvisor provided us with this option and a King size bed in a room over looking the pool was available. That's it - the hotel was everything we hoped for - and more. You can't fault it - and the staff were just great. The Hyatt Grand Cypress is still a very good hotel but for pure value and more than adequate facilities for this type of stay, the Holiday Inn offers twice the value in real terms. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: missy53
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. Nice staff, newly renovated, all nice & clean. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made out vacation more enjoyable. We will return to this property.”
Reviews.Author: Beezbol
Reviews.Content: The property staff accommodated our every need. They handled an issue with our original room very well and made our vacation more enjoyable. Allan helped with the original reservation and made us comfortable choosing this particular property. Rondell at the front desk and Kevin, one of the bellmen, were very helpful with directions and helping us understand the transit. Crystal in the Customer Service role was especially helpful is addressing an issue with our original room. All in all this is definately a prpperty we will return to and recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Lake Buena Vista- Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alex1217
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed a hotel before but when you receive excellent service in a truely immaculate place to stay I felt it was time to express myself. First I would like to thank the bartender Adrian, hope I spelled his name correctly, for helping us find local places to visit for shopping and dining. He was spot on with his recomendations. Also he was well versed in many different subjects and was very interesting to talk to. We felt very comfortable visiting the bar when he was on duty. Thanks Adrian! Also I would like to thank the front desk for being very helpful and always smiling and the tech support guy that helped me get on the hotel free internet (this was my computers problem not the hotels service). This guy spent over 30 minutes with me and fixed "my" problem allowing us to us our laptop. Last but not least the hotel. This hotel is brand new, completely refurbished for 6 years, and now beautiful. You can go next door and spend a lot more money and not have as nice a place to stay. To get to Downtown Disney was a 6 minute easy walk in a beautiful neighborhood. Transportation to the 4 Disney parks was effortlessly easy being that the shuttles stopped right outside the hotel front door every 30 minutes. We rented a car to eat and shop outside Disney but really wasn't necessary with so many stores and restaurants so close. Another thing we liked was the hotel had laundry facilities so we didn't need to bring so many clothes. I could keep going but at this time I'll just say thanks to the staff at this wonderful hotel that saved us a lot of money staying off-site and visiting Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “Is a great hotel guests love”
Reviews.Author: Katie_KaYan
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel looked renovated; everything looks and feels new. Housekeeping was very detail with what they were doing, they even keep my blackberry charger wire exactly how I left it (on top of the bed after they made the bed). You look out and there's downtown disney within a walking distance. The bartender was friendly, quick, and willing to make any drink you like. This hotel is everything you want with an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “As others have remarked...excellent quality/price relation”
Reviews.Author: DrGeePee
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from 7 days there and an excellent stay as others have said below. Nice big rooms (recommend Disney Downtown views - worth the extra mullah) and toiletries (barring the rather odd smelling bars of soap - gel is much nicer I think). Little to add to these reviews really: the bus works very well on the half hour to the different parks and stops just outside the hotel door. Takes a somewhat roundabout route to get to and from the parks, which makes coming back all that more tiring - but hey it IS free. We ordered food from Garden Grocer.com and I highly recommend them - they worked very well delivering all the essentials just before we arrived and the fantastic reception people put everything in the room and fridge for when we got there. Nowt like Florida Orange juice after a day negotiating the IBERIA airline's innate incompetence (avoid them like the plague travelling to the US from Spain - they have shall we say a rather fuzzy awareness to put it mildly about what passports are valid entering the US). Had the room service breakfast been a bit more imaginative and permitting selection (bagels??) we would have eaten from that. Just used the GardenGrocer food and the coffee machine (lovely filter coffee provided) and we had breakfast done and dusted. We ate once in the restaurant and thought it excellent value but clearly needing a bit more publicity to get the punters in. Special mention to the lovely Chrystel who managed to get us back to the hotel after Gatwick's inability to clear snow in two days meant that on our first attempt in early December BA pocketed all our fares money (and the equally deplorable Gatwick Sofitel the overnight room money) as we were unable to get to GWK for the outward flight. So we tried again but avoided BA - it worked! Also used Quicksilver taxi service Orlando airport to the hotel and back and they were excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best if you're there for the obvious reason, but fine for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: melted_snowball
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting at this hotel this month, which was actually pretty great. They served us very reasonable food (if too much, but really, it's the South), were surprisingly cheery people, and gave great advice for how someone who doesn't care for the Mouse could still have a good time with the free time I had at the conferenec. Downside: I was on the second floor of their "tower" wing, which was very noisy. The tower wing is around a restaurant on the first floor. The first morning, I woke up to a bunch of loud kids shouting while eating their breakfasts; this, after I'd heard loud people coming home to the hotel the previous night. This pattern continued through the whole visit. So I think it's a fine place to stay, but don't let them put you on the low floors in the tower.. It was nice to have Downtown Disney walking distance away, and just "off-campus", there's a 24-hr grocery store. It's a good location (well, it's a good location if you like Disney).

Reviews.Title: “Family with 4 kids from Australia. Very happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelJunkkie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean. The rooms are good. The staff at the front desk in particular were absolutely fantastic. Best I have experienced anywhere outside of Asia. Its a pity the restaurant wasnt as busy as it could be. I think their chef is Malaysian. Maybe they could add laksa or Beef Rendang to the menu. Something a bit different. Beni Hana next door was really busy so Asian food seems popular. Anyway, we would be back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Already like it and haven't stayed there yet.”
Reviews.Author: Janjan3108
Reviews.Content: We have an upcoming business trip in February at a neighboring hotel. That hotel couldn't accomodate us before and after the conference we're attending so I booked the Holiday Inn for those days. I called Holiday Inn to make a change and realized I had mistakenly booked one of the nights in January and had already been listed as a "no show". After thinking I would just have to "eat" that money, I talked with a manager who promptly offered me a full refund (The other hotel had rooms open up to accomodate us, so we no longer needed the Holiday Inn for before the conference) We will still be staying there after the conference though, and look forward to it. That may all sound too complicated but the short story is they were very understanding and I appreciated it. (I had to rate the trip with stars even though I haven't stayed there yet, in order to post this. I'm sure it will be all 5*'s though)

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: amy_ernest
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with overall stay. Friendly courteous staff, nice meeting facility, good food, updated/clean building as well as rooms. Stayed in room with King size bed, enjoyed layout of room with love seat and ottomon facing the TV, enjoyed granite in the bathroom and glass in shower. The fitness center is very nice with new equipment and faces the pool. I actually stayed at the Buena Vista Palace Hotel & Spa for 3 nights where my business event was originally scheduled which was double the price and was no better than the Holiday Inn. Plus, with the Holiday Inn, you do not have to walk for days from the parking lot if you do use valet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverMn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at this hotel with a girl friend on a "girl's vacation" to Disney and Universal. The staff was very friendly, room was very clean, comfortable bed and pillows, nice and quiet. Restaurant was pretty good, friendly service. Nice touch was getting a cup of coffee to go in the AM without even asking for it. Special standouts were Edwin, the restaurant manager, and Demaris, a waitress, who went out of their way to make sure we were well taken care of. Definitely would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. Just a block or two from Downtown Disney, easy walk, a little farther to Crossroads shopping center but walkable distance. Good shuttle buses every half hour to Disney parks, on time and reliable. Also, after 6 PM the hotel offers shuttle buses every half hour to and from Downtown Disney. Very nice. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MJBBoise_Idaho
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, and friendly!!! The only negative was the food is mediocre, but otherwise it's wonderful....

Reviews.Title: “A real sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Manatou
Reviews.Content: Everything great, only complaint is the parking charge. Just made reservations for 3 days in May 2011

Reviews.Title: “good location for pleasure island”
Reviews.Author: surfsup2
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Thanks given and the staff were very welcolming. Room was in the 12th floor tower.The rooms were nice very modern and what you would expect from a Holiday Inn.The only problem was the noise from the freeway it took a few nights to get used to the sound of cars 24/7.We enjoyed the pool area and lunch at the bar. The staff were very friendly .We used the bus to go to Pleasure Island but found it quicker to walk as only about 10 mins.As the time the bus goes to all the surrunding hotels to pick up you are quicker to walk.We went over at night for both meals and drinks as we did not have to drive.We also went to the cinema so it gives you things to do nearby.The hotel had a lovely xmas tree and decorations so very festive.The only thing we did not like was you had to go downstairs to use our computer for internett /emails.And the business centre was a pain as you had to pay and use card...probably so children did not abuse as near disney lots of children in the hotel.We needed to use the business centre due flights being cancelled due the uk weather but again can only thank the front desk staff for being great and assisting us printing details ect. We would def return but would want a pool view next time as really hate noise when trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, superb location, excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: Backpackertraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay if you want great value just outside the Walt Disney World Resort area. The hotel is impeccably clean with comfortable rooms. Pool and jacuzzi are nice perks. Service was exceptional, everyone was cheerful and willing to be of assistance. Shuttle buses are convenient but make sure you keep track of the time. This is a great place for all: families, couples, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Still tops!”
Reviews.Author: dotsomeis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn last March just after it reopened following a renovation. Back then I was very impressed, and now having just returned from a 4-day stay, I can say the staff at this hotel are still hustling like crazy to satisfy guests. The location is just great, walking distance to Downtown Disney, and if you watch for advance purchase rates or internet specials, you can get excellent value here. The heated pool and hot tub are nicely designed, and you can sit in the bar and view the pool activity. Albert at the front desk wants you to have a good time at his hotel, and that attitude extends throughout the housekeeping staff, bartenders, etc. The only thing I can think of that I would change would be the outdated pay-for-internet room for people who don't bring a laptop/netbook/smartphone. Even though many people do travel with their own internet access, it would be nice at a hotel near Disney to provide a couple of free pc's for vacationers to do a quick email check or print out boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “KINDNESS, GOOD ATTITUDE TOWARDS THE CLIENTELE”
Reviews.Author: Max11618
Reviews.Content: We got to Orlando and our reservations at another hotel for some reason did not exist so we went to the Holiday Inn with slim chances of finding a place to stay given the high Christmas season. When we got there the Holiday Inn was not the exception and there was practically no rooms left but we found two persons that helped us with such quick thinking and good attitude that we took the offer and stayed there during our vacations and had a great time by the way. Thanks to Terry Carlton (valet/bellman) and Rondell Cadette (front desk).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Christian012
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect vacation at this Holiday Inn. We spent the first week of January 2011, 6 nights total at this hotel. I'll just go ahead and enumerate the pros and cons; Pros: The pool, it's big and very warm. We spent a few hours each day in the pool and really enjoyed it. The hotel has been completely renovated and it looks great inside and out, very contemporary in style. The rooms are very nice. The beds are comfortable, our room had an lcd tv with good quality tv (no picture noise). There's a safe which I used to fit a laptop, ipad, and the usual passports etc while we were away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I forgot my toothbrush and they got me one right away, with complementary toothpaste. Daily housekeeping was very good too, the room was always kept clean. I also had a billing issue related to the parking pass (see further below) and the front desk resolved it at my satisfaction which I think is exceptional. The location is very convenient. It's a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney. There are also free shuttles from the hotel to each Disney park running every 30 minutes all day long. The service is reliable, and did I say FREE. The shuttles are also a direct connection to any Disney Park so no need to transfer buses on the way there which is nice and better than some of the other Disney resorts. There are two shuttle buses and each bus covers two parks. Buses are operated by Mears. It takes the shuttle between 30 and 45 minutes to get to the park. The buses were not very crowded either when we were there so it's a comfortable ride. The on-site restaurant serves very good burgers and food was very good overall, as was the service. The bar service is also top notch. We got to enjoy a glass of red wine every night and the selection was good. Kids eat free at all times at the restaurant which is a nice touch too. Wifi internet was free and very fast too which was a nice touch. Cons: Well there's nothing really that would prevent me from recommending this hotel. We did find the bed pillows a bit on the thick side so we'll bring ours next time around. We were there on December 31st so of course people were partying out later than usual and on that night we found the room walls' noise insulation insufficient as we could hear our neighbors shouting and having fun. But the remaining 5 nights were perfectly quiet so no big deal. When checking in I was presented with some papers to sign and I mistakenly signed the parking pass form. This resulted in a 10$ per day fee being added to my bill even though I didn't have a car all week (we flew to FL and took a limo to the hotel). I had to dispute the charge at the end of my stay and the front desk resolved the situation to my satisfaction. I guess the con here would be that they should present the parking pass as being an extra and not an item included in the price of the room - which I thought was the case and is why I just signed it and whatnot. So just be aware that you'll need to specifically opt out of the parking if you don't want to incur these charges. The breakfast buffet is only on weekends, and is never free unlike some other Holiday Inn Express hotels. But kids always eat free and the food is very good. Overall it was better than I expected and I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and a superb price for your Disney experience!”
Reviews.Author: goldenvision942
Reviews.Content: We booked a weeks stay at the Holiday Inn Downtown Disney for our trip to Disney. I received a great rate from the hotel's website. we checked in late on a Saturday night and we were warmly received by Alan at the front desk and Gino who helped us with our luggage. The lobby is adequate but the hotel has beenr ecently renovated and looks good. We booked a Disney facing room with a balcony that also had a pool view. The pool by the way was heated, which thekids loved, considering that this was one of the coldest Decembers on record for Florida. There'a small shop to buy coffee, cokes, chips and muffins. The Disney shop is still under construction. There is a basic gym and a small games rooms for the kids adjacane to the dining area. Service at breakfast was outstanding. John, Fouard and Que were great!!! John made such an effort with my kids - he is a credit to the hotel! The hotel has a free shuttle service to the Disney theme parks and Downtown Disney too. Very convenient indeed. The rooms were good, flat screen TV, comfy beds, clean linen, no bed bugs and the mouth wash in the bathroom was a nice touch. My only gripe was the fact that the free wifi was not working in the rooms. We had to go to the lobby or sit poolside to use the the internet. Apart from that, we had no issue with the hotel and will certainly be back when next in Orlando. We had a hassel free transfer from the airport using Mears and easily catched cabs to Florida Mall and the Outlet Stores for some pre-Xmas shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a cot in the room or service from management”
Reviews.Author: DrC55
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel early before rooms were available. Planning the day at Disney, we checked our bags until a room was ready. After the day we got back to the hotel about 11 pm and was given a room, the bags had not been put in the room so we brought them up ourselves (no big deal, but not good service). We needed a third bed because our daughter's boyfriend was with us and when we requested a cot we were told that the hotel does not do cots. I requested a second room and since none was available, I slept on the floor (I was brought additional bedding). The next day I called Priority Club and was told to speak to the hotel manager. I was told that he would deal with the problem or I could transfer to another Holiday Inn property nearby that could provide a cot. I went to the front desk and asked for the manager and was told that he was busy and not available. I wrote my name, room number, and cell number and asked that he call me when available. I never received a call. When I returned that night I had to pay for a second room to avoid another night on the floor. I have never been contacted by the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: angelgarciabroker
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn exceeded all of our expectations. We were apprehensive when when we made the reservation at first but when we arrived, we were very much elated with not only the cleanliness of the hotels surroundings but also the rooms itself. The staff could not have been any friendlier. We always go to Disney the last week of the year to celebrate New Year's and have always stayed at Disney Resorts for its convenience and treatment. Holiday Inn; at 1805 Hotel Plaza Blvd., outdid themselves. I hope that they maintain the same quality throughout for next year as well because we will definitely have that location on the very top of our list. We had 3 other couples that were with us and stayed at other locations within the Disney surroundings and all agreed that by far we had made the best choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great Hotel and short walk from Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: Ermoalfa
Reviews.Content: Amazing value for a great hotel, all new, great service and excellent breakfasts.... It's just outside Downtown Disney (5 min walk) but easily accessible to Route 4 to go everywhere else.... For the very first time i didn't feel ripped off staying in Disneyworld... Jose at the Valet team gave us a great tip for a Colombia Restaurant across from Gatorland as well! Thanks Jose it was very authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent! Remodeled to Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: Linda Margaret
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that this hotel has been remodeled to perfection!!! Everything is NEW on the inside and beautifully & tastefully done. Lobby is smallish, but in marble with several areas to sit/wait for your car, etc. Parking costs per night, valet service extra. Once your car is parked, you never have to move it again. Front desk was VERY accommodating and curteous. Hotel has a bar and menu selections into the wee hours. A lovely restaurant fills an inner area with a ceiling that soars upward to the 13th floor area. Staff is very pleasant and the menu sports just about anything you might want. We opted for the "breakfast package" and could order ANYTHING from the menu, including the $12.95 steak and eggs. Saturday and Sunday morning was a buffet with made-to-order waffles and omlets. You are responsible for the breakfast vouchers presented upon arrival and must give these to your waitress. Three elevators available to take you to your floor. All new carpeting in the halls/paper and paint fresh. Rooms were beautiful with big bathrooms, marble floors & sink tops, fluffy towels, minty soaps, etc. Water HOT and plentiful. We had a balcony on the ninth floor (well worth the small extra cost) which overlooked Disney Village. At 9:30 pm we could watch the fireworks in Epcot. Balcony has two chairs and table. Ask for one with the open iron grill-work so you can watch the sunset, etc. and still sit in a chair. New bedding with soft mattresses, four pillows, feather comforters, CLEAN-new carpeting, thermostat heating/cooling, well lit, computer locking safe, refrigerator. (no microwave). Staff wonderful! Heated swimming pool open late and shaped like an hour-glass. Hot-tub offered outside. Water sprays add soothing sound. Shuttle service every 30 minutes takes you from the hotel to any Disney site you want to go. One con here, though, and that is the Hilton Hotel which is the first pick-up stop on the route. At 8:00 AM, seating on the bus is no problem, but at 8:30 or 9:00 Hilton people fill every seat and then some. Usually, standing room only when it gets to the Holiday Inn! But, on the flip side, the shuttles run like clock-work with destination schedules clearly marked on the outside of the A & B bus. Loading and unloading docks everywhere were marked on the pavement & included attendants to guide you. Bus drivers know everything...ask them when in doubt. One day we took a shuttle to Animal Kingdom, from there a shuttle to the Boardwalk, then a boat to Epcot, then a boat back to the Boardwalk, then a shuttle to Disney Village and from there the "A" bus back to the Holiday Inn. Scheduled every 5 and 35 minutes, we never waited any longer than 10 minutes for any one conveyance. I only mention this because you should not let the thought of traveling by shuttle in anyway influence your decision to stay at the hotel. We are country-folk and were rarely at a loss to get to and from the Holiday Inn during our five day stay. The cost of $179.00 per night (which included the breakfast package for four adults) and the brand-new-ness of the place was short of miraculous. Anyone who has gone to WDW knows how expensive it can be! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and consider myself lucky for taking the Tripadvisor's advise on this one! It is truly a hidden gem all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: suredev
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 kids had a wonderful time in Orlando, thanks to Holiday Inn. It was the place to come back to after a long day at the parks. The room was clean and spacious. The staff were helpful and friendly namely Alex, Edwin, Chebliz, Steve and Fouad. I would recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: jpfunn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a 10 minute easy walk to Downtown Disney. The hotel is clean and modern with a nice big pool area. Every employee that I encountered was very nice and helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. There is a charge, however, to use the computers for online access which is 3rd party owned BUT if you bring your own computer then its free, they have wi fi and free ethernet connection in the room. We brought an entire baseball team to the hotel for a tournament at ESPN Wide World of Sports and they were accomodating in every way. This hotel is a 5 -10 minute drive to the fields of Espn Wide World of Sports. We give it Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location but very expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife 14 days in the Holiday Inn. You can get free buses from disney each 30 minutes, tha't a plus cause the taxi is about U$ 40 a round trip to go to the parks. Loved it because the buses was not very full and I could often find a seat to me and my wife. I think its not good to use the buses in the vacations because they probably will be very full and you'll have to be standing up. Im sure you won't find anything better in this price range (if you doesnt use the internet). My big complaint about this hotel is the internet. You can use it free in your room, if you bring a nettbook with you because the room only have a RJ45 connect. There's no wi-fi. I had to use the internet near the lobbly. It's a safe and closed room that you can open with your room card. If I remember, its 1 dollar for each 4 minutes, but the system doesnt work correct. When you remove and insert your card or log in or out you loose 0,25 cents. The real thing is you'll spend about 1 dollar for 2 minutes. If you need to use the internet a long time maybe its gonna be better to get a more expensive hotel with free internet. I stayed in Ramada Inn when I was in Tampa and payed half the price of the Holiday Inn with free Internet and free Continental breakfast. Sorry for my poor english.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Parks AND downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: gram777
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good. We arrived the Sat. after Thanksgiving and checked out just this morning. The decor is just okay (I actually find it ugly) and the rooms are small but they serve the purpose. The pool is very nice and heated, nice hot tub as well. If you want to stay in the Disney area and you are able to get a good rate, this hotel is worthwhile. The day of arrival we called to the front desk for extra towels and they arrived within 5 minutes. The room was very clean, but the housekeeping did not do such a great job on a daily basis (the powder my husband spilled on the bathroom floor still remained after they had cleaned.) We only ate at the hotel for breakfast. If was very convenient. The breakfast buffet is expensive, but worth it if you choose one of the options (hot or cold) over the entire buffet. Make sure you ask for the waitress "Que." She is a bubbly, outgoing server who does her job well and goes out of her way for you! FYI: If you don't already know, you will be charged for parking, $10 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Danny Galeano went Above & Beyond! Excellent Property! (But No Room WiFi)”
Reviews.Author: RoomInspector
Reviews.Content: #1. Driving up from a week in the Keys my "SmartPhone" and the Priority Club website refused to work together! Very frustrated, I walked into the hotel to see Danny Galeano at the front desk! He's an Angel! He is truly Genuine! Very Caring, Sincere and Professional! Danny went above and beyond any Hotel Guest Service Rep. I have ever encountered, and that's been hundreds! I hope IHG knows what a gift they have in Danny Galeano and use his talents appropriately! #2. The property is lovely! But needs more attention to Detail! (Elevators) That's the difference between laborers and real craftsman doing the rehab work! Paint splatter all over the out side of the glass elevators. Concrete in elevator shaft needs to all be painted black, not just in patches. Ceiling really needs help! It has a huge beautiful skylight, but is over shadowed by the tacky uneven finishing work done that was all painted pale yellow! #3. No in room WiFi-Very surprised and disappointed! Rooms are beautiful and clean! Nice side with great comfy beds! The balconies are an added bonus! Very Nice! (My Opinion-Note to housekeeping...., if you see marks, scuffs or spills on the wall wipe it off. I know your time is very limited, but it makes a difference. #4. Restaurant,. We never used it, but the menu displayed was very over priced for nothing special. We never saw anyone eating there. Several people enjoying the bar and patio cafe by the pool. (My Opinion-Note to Food & Beverage....., Maybe you need to rethink the whole restaurant thing. Find your niche! And do it well! Combine with the bar to enjoy the pool area. When dining, people love a view. Cut down the Fabric High Back booths! I for one will not sit in them. They're not comfortable and you feel closed in. Not to mention the sanitary issue of my head touching where others have! #5. Over All...Excellent Property!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: MWR92
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the Downtown Disney Area. It was affordable and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. The Breakfast Buffet in the restaurant was also great and the staff there were wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay at it again on my next visit to the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler99
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Holiday Inn. As with any Holiday Inn, it is not some type of luxurious hotel but the rooms are incredibly comfortable and SPOTLESS. As mentioned by previous reviewers, the hotel has recently gone through a major renovation and it really shows (the elevators seem like they were not updated for some reason though). The bath products were nice. The bed was comfortable. Our room, 301 (and it looked like all of them), had a balcony. Unfortunately the balcony face a parking lot and highway (which could be a bit noisy when standing outside). But as soon as you closed the door to the balcony the sound was completely gone. The sound-proofing on those doors/windows was great. Frankly, I would have loved a room on the other side with a view of downtown Disney, but I'm a realist. . .I paid about $90 a night for the room. . I can't have it all. The pool area is very nice. Also, clean and modern. I was determined to get some time in the pool but started becoming reluctant when it seemed a bit chilly outside. However, the pool was heated to a perfect temperature and the hot tub was a great touch for spending some time in the later afternoon breeze. The bartender in the lounge area (Jon I believe. . ??) was very friendly, talkative, asked about our stay, etc. Plus he made good drinks that were perfect to relax with for a bit after a long day at the parks. Little things like that make the stay much more enjoyable. The breakfast buffet was a bit over-priced, but no more so than any other dining option in the disney area. The only thing I was not too fond about was after leaving the room one morning (9:00 AM) to go to the Animal Kingdom and returning at 5:00 PM for what was supposed to be a rest, I was surprised to find that the room had not been serviced. After we walked in, someone knocked on the door to take care of it. So we had to go sit in the lobby for a bit. However, I just considered this an isolated insident (maybe a lack of staff that day or something). This didn't happen any other day. The shuttle buses to the parks were very efficient and the walk to downtown disney is less than 10 minutes. There really is no need to rent a car whiel staying here if you intend to spend all of your time in Disney World. (Helpful tip: a taxi from the airport will cost about $60. There is a public bus (lynx 111) with an stop directly across from downtown disney that will get you to the airport in less than an hour for $2.00. It certainly is not as efficient but it does spent several parts of the journey on the highway and only makes a few stops along the way). You are going to be spending a LOT of money while in Disney. So why not save where you can.) Overall, this has to be the best hotel value in downtown disney. If you see this room (probably only in the "off" season) for less than $120 a night, don't even bother looking any further, because you have found the best value you can possibly buy in the area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR A BUSINESS MEETING”
Reviews.Author: jbahr18
Reviews.Content: We held our Regional Meeting here in September. All of our attendees were very impressed with the meeting rooms and the guest rooms. They did a wonderful job in renovating this property and the staff keeps it well maintained. Our meetings went very well. The service from the staff was excellent! Very friendly and helpful! We would definitely return and recommend this hotel for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli02
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in Disney resort hotels but we were looking for something a little more reasonable in pricing. This hotel was fantastic! We stayed one night for a girl trip to go to the Epcot Food & Wine Festival and could not have stayed in a better location. All staff members were extremely friendly and helpful and the hotel was immaculately clean. We did have one issue in our room with the toilet, and the manager immediately brought us keys to another room (maintenance had left for the day) and we were upgraded to a better view. The next morning we were given breakfast vouchers because of the inconvenience of moving rooms. This was a nice gesture but it wasn't really necessary since they handled it so well. So, we ended up getting free breakfast which is a buffet (I believe they have items you can order instead but I'm not sure), which would have been $15 per person. The breakfast was very good and included a waffle and omlete station. I will definitely stay here again for my next trip to Disney. There is also a free shuttle to the Disney parks every 30 minutes. We didn't make the trip to Downtown Disney but it is within walking distance, not a short walk but it would probably still be easier to walk then to drive over and park unless you had small children. One more thing, the hotel has a great pool and hot tub... we didn't use it but it looks very nice. This hotel is a great find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Isabel2706
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days in Walt Disney and I rate this hotel on excellent for: 1) location; 7 min walk to downtown disney 2) best shuttle service with 30 min departures and pick-ups throughout the whole day!!! 3) fantastic beds! 4) Water in pool very hot pool, even if it was very cold! Like swimming in one's tub!! 5) service friendly 6) Breakfast very good with hot and cold buffet choices. I ate a freshly prepared Belgian waffle everyday!! My favorite! The negatives are more minor; 1) charged $1.00 for orange on top of $14 for breakfast. It's just bad business....why not ask for $15 for breakfast instead. 2) Supper menu is just basic cuisine, nothing special, probably better to eat in downtown disney. I would definitely return though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: oscar031
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at this hotel and i have to say i will return again. From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We have visited Florida on several occasions and stayed in different areas and i have to say location wise this was the best. Just a few minutes walk from Downtown Disney and a five/ten minute drive from the parks. The hotel has undergone a huge refurb and is spotless in every way. I am very fussy about accomodation and the cleaniness of rooms but our room was faultless and the beds are so comfortable that you just don't want to get out of it! No mold in the bathroom, fresh towls and bath products every day! We upgradred to a Downtown Disney view room which was very nice, we had a great view of the Disney fireworks, our room being on the 11th floor. Pool area very nice and clean, plenty of beds and a great hot tub. Now don't get me wrong it's no massive pool with waterfalls and slides but it does the job at the end of a long day at the parks. Hotel breakfast was really nice $9.95 for continental or $14.95 for the full buffet which included the omlete and waffle station, it is a bit pricey for a breakfast but what hotel isn't and the bonus is kids eat free. Didn't use the Disney shuttle bus as we had a car but plenty of people did. The hotel on the whole is very quiet which is what you want especially at night. Now if you want a hotel full of kids and hussle and bussle then this isn't for you, probably an actual Disney hotel would be better but the way i see it is when your visiting Orlando you are only in your room to sleep and shower. We travelled with our five year old and he always managed to make a friend each time we went to the pool so when i say about kids i don't mean there arn't any just not over run with them screaming and shouting. The only problem we did have was a noisy air con unit in our room, they did send a repair man to fix it but it didn't seem to make any difference, they did offer for us to change rooms but it wasn't bad enough for that so what they did do was only charge us for one weeks room upgrade instead of two saving us $200 which i thought was fab! On the whole a great hotel with great staff at a great price, we shall definately return here on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: jwilgis
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in Walt Disney World Resort is the best hotel I have been too by far. The staff were so friendly and the restaurant was amazing. I accompanied my mother on her business trip with the ARC of St. Augustine and we were from Wednesday, November 3, 2010- Sunday, November 7, 2010 and went to Disney on the 6th. The distance from the hotel to the park was great, and the staff at the hotel were nicer to us then the staff at Disney. From now on we are staying at your hotel. It was amazing and the outstanding staff made you feel right at home. Thank you so very much for a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright hotel”
Reviews.Author: seealltheworld
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the price was right, the service was excellent, the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “What a "hidden"gem”
Reviews.Author: martinmatousek
Reviews.Content: ...booked Sun Regal Resort for my vacation in Walt Disney World...canceled Sun Regal Resort ( read my review why)...and booked Holiday Inn in WDW. Bingo !!! This new place just few minutes walk from WD Downtown is just delight. Friendly staff, big and clean rooms ( with pillow "menu" ), fab pool deck, hot jacuzzi and fast efficient free bus service to all Disney Parks. Hardly think about something negative, because everything was just too good ( which is normally not ! ). Maybe the breakfast is bit too pricey ( paid the same in Hard Rock Universal Studios last year for better selection ) and the barman looks overworked ( he was there all the time ) send him for holidays please! But the valet guys always in good mood and smiling. Reception staff knew everything I need to know about Disney Theme Parks. I am glad I didnt' choose Disney hotel...they look boring and very isolated from anything "normal".! 10minutes walk right from hotel is nice supermarket and small shopping area with souvenirs if you dont' want spend fortune in WD Downtown ( you will anyway .-) ) And thanks all the Bus drivers...they do magnificient job and have to deal with all those unfriendly Britons and moody Americans. Dont' think twice about booking Holiday Inn in WDW...dont' expect Mandarin Oriental, but solid, spacious, clean and friendly place in unbeatable location !!! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but not as clean as expected”
Reviews.Author: lizzie561
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn- Downtown Disney last weekend for a short getaway to the Magic Kingdom. The hotel is a nice, no frills, hotel with bus service to the Disney theme parks. It is within walking distance to Downtown Disney, which is a real plus. Was were able to get our 2 bed room for $99 a night. The price was right but the room was not very clean. You could see dust on all the surfaces throughout the room. But the worst, was the bathroom. The shower curtain smelled of humidity. So much so that we had to close the bathroom door at night to be able to sleep without the nasty odor. We would have called and complained, but by the time we got into our room (pass 11:00 PM), I doubt that they would have changed the shower curtain for us. The only other disappointing thing about the hotel was the $10 per night/per car parking fee that we were charged. Not sure why it is necessary to charge a premium for parking?

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Convenient But...”
Reviews.Author: Empress5150
Reviews.Content: There was absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel, the rooms or its convenience to Downtown Disney/the parks (really appreciated the complimentary bus transportation). Our room was nice; king size bed which was super comfy (first time I've ever been in a room where the pillows have "firm" and "soft" labels attached to them!) decent enough bathroom and a safe and mini fridge. On the 5th floor, it opened out to the pool area with a small but nice enough balcony (two chairs and a very small round table). Smoking was NOT allowed in the rooms (or anywhere, it seemed) except out on said balcony. We did smoke a cigar out there but were told to keep the door to the room firmly shut or else risk a cleaning fee. No problem, we completely understood. No, my only issue with the hotel was, when I'd looked into booking about a week before we arrived, the rate was $79 + taxes but it had to be prepaid. Since I wasn't 100% sure we'd be able to go to Orlando (in FL visiting family), I didn't want to risk that. When I booked it the night before, the exact same room for the same dates had shot up to $117 taxes. So, less than a week later, a $38 dollar increase/48% increase. I figured the place might be packed, but, it was fairly empty. So, because of this, I just cannot give it a good rating overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarsieB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Holiday Inn on Hotel Plaza Boulevard, Lake Buena Vista and had a wonderful stay. The reason we chose this hotel was that we wanted to make our trip first trip to Disney World and Universal as economical as possible. Staying at Disney World itself (where the theme parks are located) made the trip too expensive so after much searching on the Internet we chose this hotel (which is a Disney hotel) near the Downtown Disney area and we were not disappointed. The hotel is about a 10 minute leisurely walk to Downtown Disney (which are full of shops and places to eat) and approximately a 15 minute (sometimes a little more) bus ride to the various Disney theme parks. We weren't sure how we would find the free bus rides to the theme parks but these were just fine. The buses always arrived on time and came regularly throughout the day and evening. Due to the age of our children, 9 and 10, we would catch the 9.00am bus to the theme parks and return anywhere between 5.00pm and 8.00pm in the evening. The hotel rooms were well appointed (they even had a bar fridge) and were extremely clean. The housekeeping was done daily and to a very high standard. There was a soda vending machine and ice machine in the hallway to our hotel room which was very convenient. Our children loved the pool area (and so did we). What also really impressed us about the hotel was that children who are 12 and younger are able to eat at the hotel for free. This made a huge difference to our holiday budget. Breakfast was always well catered for and very fresh. Every morning we started our day with the buffet breakfast which was just lovely (the omelettes were delicious). We also chose to dine in the restaurant each evening rather than queuing at the various Downtown Disney restaurants and paying the high prices there. Although the choice of meals in the evening were slightly limited the food was cooked to a very high standard. The restaurant staff were always extremely friendly and accommodating and nothing was ever too much trouble. We regularly asked if a fresh salad or a bowl of fruit could be prepared to go with our children's meals and this was always made possible. Our children were always made to feel very welcome at the restaurant. During our stay at the hotel we also spent a day at Universal's Island of Adventure and this was about a 20 minute taxi ride, from the hotel, which the hotel staff organized for us. The taxi driver charged us a round trip fare of $50 for this and we arranged a time and place to meet him after our day at Universal and this worked out very well (The Wizarding World of Harry Potter is a must see for any fans of the movies). Also for those of who are interested when we arrived at Orlando International Airport we went to the taxi area where a fee of $52 was confirmed for the drive to the hotel from the person organizing cabs. At the end of our stay we needed a hire car and very conveniently across the road and a 4 minute walk from the Holiday Inn, there was a hire car counter for Dollar Rent a Car at the Regal Sun Resort Hotel so we were able to conveniently collect a hire car for our drive out to NASA. We would definitely consider staying at Holiday Inn when visiting Disney World at a future date due to the value, cleanliness, location and welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Location”
Reviews.Author: mbmb81
Reviews.Content: Got a great discounted rate on this hotel. Rooms were very clean and I am super picky. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Booked for a Disney trip with my husband and toddler. Location was exellent for Magic Kingdom. We used the shuttle once which was pretty good. It was about 5 minutes late picking us up in the am, but ran every 30 min. Did stop at 3 other hotels and 2 parks. Round trip was 30 min. We drove our car one day and it was easy to get to the park. Room was on the smaller side. Had 2 queen beds which were comfortable and plenty of pillows. The mini fridge was not cold enough to keep anything that would go bad without the proper temp. We were on the 2nd floor and did have a lot of road noise from I-4. There is an extra fee for parking. We did not eat at the hotel. Plenty of dining options close by. Would definately stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Average - Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianP36854
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and in a good location. I was shocked to find the rooms did not have microwaves. I have have stayed in a lot of hotels, and 99% of hotels have microwaves today. Also, the hotel that was this nice didnt have wifi. I feel it should have. Other than that, the hotel is very nice and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay outside the park”
Reviews.Author: jimjsr55
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one nite but liked the service we received.The front desk was great and from the time we got to the bus stop to Epcot was about 20 minutes not bad.I stay inside Disney most of the time we come down but for just a few days this is a great place to stay. they have done a great job renovating the place.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bynbyn
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Holiday Inn for 8 nights and the whole time the staff were friendly, professional and went out of their way to help us. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with every convenience we needed and the restaurant, bar and pool were all fantastic and all shuttles to the Disney resorts ran on time overall a fantastic hotel, great staff in a wonderful location

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel with excellent service and in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NessySomerset
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes walk to Downtown Disney and free half hourly shuttles to the Disney Parks. Very friendly and welcoming staff, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan1955
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 1 night before checking in to OKW...we were greeted as we pulled up and then again as we entered the lobby...our room was ready when we arrived and I had asked for an upper floor. We were in the tower 9th floor. Room was clean and cool upon entering. beds were awesome comfortable! Internet was nice to have. we walked to DTD for dinner...each time we entered lobby we were greeted. we will stay here again, and would recomend to our friends and also to DISboards!

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel for Brits! Great location! Helpful and friendly staff! Home from home!”
Reviews.Author: buddy13IOM
Reviews.Content: The service we received was fabulous. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and they did it with a smile. From reception, bar, room and dining room everybody was courteous pleasant and very attentive. The room was spacious, comfortable with nice sized beds, nice bathroom. Coffee making facilities provided. The swimming pool is beautiful, a nice size with palm trees and nice landscaping. What did we like best? Everything we had a fabulous stay! Thank you Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderer_not_lost
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The buses to the Disney resorts was very convenient, the bus drivers were extremely friendly and helpful. Convenience stores a fair distance if you want to have your own food. The room was very clean, small but clean. I would definitely stay again and would recommend to others. Wish the pool was open later. Beds were comfortable, and room temperature controls were great.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a hotel that lives up to it's pictures”
Reviews.Author: Blessed47
Reviews.Content: Finally a hotel that lives up to it's pictures on their website. This hotel was refrub in Feb., 2010 and at times was a little old. However for the most part it was beautiful. The room I had was on the 6th floor over looking the pool, nice size balcony. There was a frig and safe in the room which I was not expecting but happy to have. The bed was comfortable and your choice of hard or soft pillows. The bath was nice, rain shower, room to move around. The room was cleaned each day and looked as if I was entering my room for the first time each time. Also I never heard around guest shower or toilet as you do in some hotels. The staff was excellent. I felt at home and traveling alone it was nice to come back to the hotel at night and feel safe. The staff greeted me each day/night with a hello. I stayed 5 nights and 6 days and it really felt like home, I did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and Accompodating”
Reviews.Author: shanankue
Reviews.Content: I planned a business conference at the hotel for 60 people coming from all over the country. The hotel staff were friendly. The decor was modern and updated and clean. The conference center had great lighting and sound systems. The conference center planners were accomodating to every request, including those last minute requests. The pool was refreshing. The food was incredible. Location was great to walk to Downtown Disney Area with buses to all Disney locations. They assisted in direction on airport to hotel transportation as well as group tickets to Epcot. Beds were VERY comfortable!!!

Reviews.Title: “10 Funfilled Days”
Reviews.Author: Disneygirl718
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Holiday Inn and were blown away by how beautiful the hotel was and how clean and new it was! The staff were very welcoming and charming. They bent over backwards to accomodate our every wish. We enjoyed the lovely pool area every day we were there. We also enjoyed the wonderful frozen drinks brought to us by the bartender--- yum! The location on Disney property was very convenient to both Downtown Disney and all of the theme parks. At the end of the day our charming room welcomed us with very comfortable beds and bedding. The bathroom was extremely clean and modern, I should know being the clean freak that I am. The whole experience was so delightful that we are going back for another visit in October.

Reviews.Title: “Better than u would expect”
Reviews.Author: axola2009
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fantastic, Extremely big and with everthing you need. The hotel has a pool, a jakuzzi, a gym...and there are buses every 30 minutes to Disney. Just a couple of details, to use the business center is a dollar for every 4 minutes, thanks god i was travelling with my iPod and they offer wireless for free. Plus, dont try to go out of Disney without a car going anywhere by taxi will cost u at least 15 dollars Per day. Overall a great hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “100% an excellent option”
Reviews.Author: spyke_10
Reviews.Content: clean and big rooms, excellent rate, breakfast with the best omelette I ever tried, very serviceable and courtous personnel and staff. only minutes walking to Downtown disney in lake buena vista, this is the first time I wrote a comment for a hotel and this deserve it Reinaldo Ugarte Caracas, Venezuela

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, newly renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelesquegirl
Reviews.Content: It is very apparent that Holiday Inn did their homework on what Orlando travelers presently want in a hotel. The renovations were current, fresh, whimsical and classy. The staff were professional, the rooms were clean and fresh, the television was modern/flatscreen and the decor was tasteful. The breakfast buffet was a pretty good deal. You could order cooked-to-order omelets with endless coffee and juice for $9.95 or you could order the complete buffet with bacon, omelets, pancakes, muffins, fruit, cereal, etc. for $14.95. The fitness center was fully equipped with machines that mirrors some of the top gyms nationwide. It also has a mounted television and VERY cold spring water. The game room is small but equipped with well-functioning, fun games. Disney's shuttle service runs every 30 minutes from early in the morning until 90 minutes after the Disney parks closes. Keep in mind that after picking you up, the shuttle will stop at other Downtown Disney resorts such as Hilton and Doubletree. On the down side, we went inside the business center and there was a fee of .25 cents per minute to surf the web and .75 cents per copy if you need to print something. We immediately walked out after reading this considering this is the only hotel that I can recall that charges to use the business center. No wonder it was always empty.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel near Downtown Disney -- give it a try.”
Reviews.Author: cookieladyangel
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights over the Labor Day weekend at the new Holiday Inn across the street from Downtown Disney. I didn't arrive until midnight but was checked in with no problems. My room with the king size bed, sofa & desk (can hook up to free internet) was very comfortable. The bed was great & had the choice of firm or soft pillows on the bed. There was a small refrigerator and safe in the room. What I noticed most about the hotel is that in the halls & my room at night --- it was so quiet --- no noise to keep me awake. I never had to wait long for an elevator. The only problem I had dealt with their breakfast buffet. They have a lot of new people and not all of them knew what the buffet included. First day, I didn't get charged for tea with the buffet, 2nd day I got charged which I thought was unusual (even asked the waiter about it), saw the manager that night and he gave me credit on my bill for the tea, and the 3rd day I was charged again - spoke with a different manager & it was taken off. Everyone seems to blame it on the new help so hopefully the servers will get trained on what is included. I've never had an all you can get buffet breakfast where tea was charged extra & coffee wasn't - normally the waiters are always asking if you want more. Plus, for the price there should be no question that it should be included. So they need to be consistent in what they do. If you eat breakfast there --- make sure you ask for waitress "Que" --- she is a wonderful server. Everyone I spoke with wanted to correct the situation --- they are trying hard. The Disney Store inside the hotel was not open yet - Disney is responsible for it so seems to be dragging their feet. The pool looked nice but I don't swim so didn't check that out. I always stay at a Downtown Disney hotel so was happy to give Holiday Inn a try this trip. As with other hotels on Hotel Plaza Blvd - it's walking distance to Downtown Disney and free shuttles to the Parks.

Reviews.Title: “If I could rate it higher, I would!”
Reviews.Author: bssigirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick weekend and got a super rate. I was a bit doubtful, despite the amazing reviews I read on TA before booking, but the Holiday Inn Downtown Disney was just as good as previously reviewed. Check in was quick and very friendly, our room was very clean and the beds were probably the best I've slept in. The fridge was oversized and kept items cold from the start (which often does not happen). We were not the only ones in the hotel, but it felt like we were --- super quiet, despite overlooking the pool and restaraunt. I love when hotels space guests out --- for guests' comfort and not for the convenience of housekeeping. We were given extra pillows and towels, the shower was great. Hotel was very convenient to everything --- grocery store just across the street, plenty of restaurants, easy access to I-4, and very easy parking at the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel or swim in the pool, but both looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: Joanfd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn from August 24 through August 28 with my three children. I read other reviews on Trip Advisor prior to staying so I was expecting good things. The hotel and its staff did not let us down. We had an excellent experience. Check in was a breeze. The room was immaculate and comfortable. It had a nice size fridge which is not mentioned on their website, but was a nice amenity. The hotel has only been open for 6 months and everything is brand new. The beds were very comfortable. The room was very quiet, as we could hear no other hotel guests when in the room. Granted, the hotel was relatively empty because of the time of year, but it still seems as if it would be quiet during more crowded times. Being a Holiday Inn, children eat free with a paying adult. This meant for all meals - breakfast, lunch and dinner. I actually felt bad sitting down to a meal and not having to pay for anything but my meal. The service in the restaurant was great. The food was also excellent. My children loved all of the menu selections. There were nice options of substituting veggies or fruit salad as a side instead of always having fries. The adult fare was just as good. It was nice to be in a place like Orlando, where you expect to be eating a lot of burgers and greasy park food, to sit down and have healthy and delicious food. The restaurant is in the main lobby which is open to the interior of the hotel. You look up 14 floors to the glass pyramid at the top. You can also see the two glass enclosed elevators making their way up and down. The hotel has great facilities. There was a grab-n-go snack area which had basic quick selections like yogurt, muffins and pre-made sandwiches, in addition to a coffee station and other drinks. There was what looked like a very nice bar that was open any time we passed by it, but I didn't get to utilize it being with three children. There was also a Disney gift shop. However, it was undergoing renovations while we were there and was closed the entire time. I would have liked to see its contents, but then felt like it was a blessing in disguise because I didn't have my children walking by it each day asking to look around. The pool facility was excellent and very relaxing. I saw another post saying it was too small. I cannot see anyone calling this pool too small. It is a great size. Landscaping is beautiful and there is ample seating around the pool. Music was playing at all times which I enjoyed. It was never too loud and I loved whatever selections were played. There is also a hot tub next to the pool - very relaxing. The one negative thing I have to comment on is the mandatory $10 per day parking fee. I knew about the fee prior to checking in, but it still seemed like a rip off. The parking lot was empty, but they had the bulk of the spots near the main entrance coned off for valet parking which comes at a $16 per day price tag. I just factored the daily parking fee into the price of the room for the night, and I felt the hotel was still a very good value for the price I paid. All in all, we all loved this hotel. My children said it was the best hotel they have stayed at. I have already told several people about our stay and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good value in Orlando. I know it doesn't come with the perk of Extra Magic Hours, but it did have free shuttles to all Disney parks. We did not use them as we tried out Universal Studios on this trip. Even though the rides at Universal are excellent, we definitely missed the "Disney magic". I would stay at this hotel on our next trip to Orlando hands down, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: twinky211
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my friend during a 3-day trip to Disney in August. The rate was great and the hotel was clean. The staff at this hotel is quite friendly... we missed the elevator on the way to our rooms and one staff member saw that we seemed lost... she walked us to theelevator and up to our rooms. This actually stuck with us because we would have been perfectly content if she pointed us to the elevator and walked her merry way. A very nice way to start our weekend. The location is great, but we were only in town for a few nights so couldn't take advantage of the nightlife in Downtown. We used the hotel just to sleep for the nights we were there. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast on weekends (about $15pp) which is quite convenient if you have to head out fast. But I found the options limited...and was really surprised that not even a glass of juice was included at this price. We had dinner at the restaurant once because of a rainstorm... we had the free range chicken. I expected the food to be terrible hotel food... and so was pleasntly surprised when it as actually good. Not the best meal I've had, but for the price, the quality was good. The only *minor* negative was that the place itself was really bland, especially for a hotel located in the center of the "magic" of Disney and other theme parks. I realize that they have to cater to both leisure and business travellers, but the overall feel was too business-like for me as a leisure traveller. The walls are all beige and cream...very boring. I wouldn't liek to stay here if travelling with kids for Disney because I feel like it "dials down" the fantasy that all these parks work so hard to create. I wouldn't mind staying here for business, but for leisure, I'd look for something a bit more cheery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room on Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: pogitraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this newly renovated and re-opened Holiday Inn, which is located on Disney property. It is very convenient to Disney attractions. Downtown Disney is a 2-minute car ride/10-minute walk. To our surprise, the hotel provided free Disney buses to all theme parks. Each night we returned to a spacious, comfortable and tastefully decorated room. The beds are among the best hotel beds we've ever slept in. And it's quiet: no kids running down the hallways at all hours. The front desk staff was very welcoming, friendly, and consistently helpful. Our room featured free Internet (wireless in the lobby; a connector is in the room). We also enjoyed the refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave, and flat screen TV. The outdoor hotel pool is huge. Our only criticisms were minor. First, the hotel charges $10 per day for parking. When we asked why, one of the managers told us that since Disney owns the building and the land (it's actually on Disney property), Disney requires the daily parking fee. Second, the hot water dribbled out of the sink faucet in our 8th floor room. The shower, however, was perfect and produced plenty of hot water. When we are not able to stay in a Disney-themed hotel, we will return to this Holiday Inn. The convenient location, quiet, comfortable room, friendly staff, and free buses to the theme parks won us over.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: JunksterAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights. The hotel is located 5 min to downtown disney and 5 min to restaurants and grocery store. Rooms we very clean, quiet, well maintained. The staff were awsome. The bus service was very good for a non-disney resort. Always on time, helpful and friendly drivers. We had a tough time getting to Typhoon Lagoon after 11:00am(but that was it). Had great sleeps in the nice beds. I would recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: jefnail
Reviews.Content: Just about to leave hotel after 16 days (24th August) at Holiday Inn - Rooms #503/502. Phoned ahead and asked for rooms next door to each other. Had 2 families, 3 adults, 3 kids - 16,12,11. Great service and very good staff, always friendly and always around to help. Been to a lot of hotels in America over the last 20 years and this is up there in my top 3. Rooms also a decent size and all close to Disney. Bus picks up outside for all the disney parks. Would stay again but will book direct instead of online agent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay!”
Reviews.Author: dontstayathome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn/Downtown Disney for 2 days nights before moving to a larger villa for the remainder of our Orlando vacation. Our rate was $99 a night plus $10 per night for parking which I feel is ridiculous that you have to pay to self park (valet parking was $16). From the time we checked in (9 pm) until the time we checked out 2 days later (late check out of 2:00 p.m.) our stay was perfect. Rooms were fantastic, staff was courteous and the view of downtown Disney from our outside balcony was fantastic! We are platinum priority club members and this is the only downfall of our stay. Even though we were given a complimentary upgrade from poolview room to a Downtown Disney view room NOTHING else was offered to us even with our status. We still had to pay for parking, we received no "treats" when we checked in and received NO complimentary breakfast for any of us on any day we stayed which we have NEVER experienced in any of our Holiday Inn stays. When we returned home from our vacation we received a call from the hotel asking us how our stay was and I did explain to the manager my concerns over not receiving any perks as a priority club members with platinum status. He assured me that they are in fact working on those issues and hope to institute them sometime in the near future! I was happy to hear that! We ate in the restaurant both mornings (buffet) and found the food to be fresh and well prepared. Also, we enjoyed the outdoor pool before checking out (did receive a late checkout because of priority club!) and found the pool to be quite lovely and in great working condition. Our room was extremely clean and very large with 2 queen beds. We would definately stay here again and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and New Place to stay near WDW”
Reviews.Author: disvaca01
Reviews.Content: Everything a family could ask for on vacation....new and chic hotel with clean rooms, that's near Disney, it's reasonably priced with an excellent pool, on well manicured grounds equipped with a friendly staff...the list goes on. Although, I would of liked free parking and wi-fi in the room, not just in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The best service attitude you could find in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReinaldoHoffman
