Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an extraordinary hotel, pretty close o Magic Kingdom and other parks, superb guest services and excellent value, Holiday Inn at the Walt Disney resort is the answer. A beautiful lady named Chryrstel Mattli took care of me at the checking and I think she probably is nicest person ever encounter in a Hotel…I was certainly a +5 star treatment. The Hotel has it all, excellent rooms, services, etc. but the best was the bed! I was having problem with my back and after only one night sleeping, my back pain was gone! I am not exaggerating; I just wanted to take the bed with me back home. I highly recommend this Hotel to anyone that after a whole day of walking, wants to be pampered and rest like a king.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: pattidube
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at the Holiday Inn. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The hotel has undergone some major renovations and everything was new. The pool area is small but well maintained. The shuttle service is excellent. They arrive on time and run continuous until the parks close. It is a close walk to Downtown Disney and other restaurants that are a little less expensive. We will definitely stay there again. Just remember when you go to Disney, you spend very little time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel value, clean and new!”
Reviews.Author: gscardona
Reviews.Content: We were in Disney last month. After days of going online, checking reviews, pictures of hotels, locations we decided to stay in a hotel within Disney. We reserved and were all set. Well a week before our trip, I went online and was very lucky to come across great reviews of this Holiday Inn. Did my calculating and debating on what to do and changed the reservation. Since there was a free shuttle and we went for the option online for the breakfast brunch, kids eat free was great, night and day, we cancelled and reserved here.. The service was amazing, the rooms were new and locaction was great, it was clean. The pool was nice, the breakfast buffet in our package was perfect, many choices and all yummy. The shuttle service was timely, etc.. I would only say that the parking I thought should have been free as it is offered free in the other hotels near by. The location is great for disney and outlet mall shopping. My in laws dont speak spanish only and had no troubles with communications. The managment and staff were great, I had a dilema with a pizza delivery, and the staff in the hotel helped me out greatly. It was not even their problem. Would totaly recommend this hotel and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff,front desk terrable,”
Reviews.Author: Raj7122
Reviews.Content: Stay room#706 very noisy,morning 8am somebody nocking door for house keeping.ck out time my car didn't start due to discharge bettery.f desk not want to help out, not even maintain . Find other hotel not helpfull,attetude .I visit from pa .

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: happy4311
Reviews.Content: The staff, food and lodging was great at the Holiday Inn at Disney world resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: br1524
Reviews.Content: This hotel recently reopened after being closed for about five years after some substantial hurricane damage and an ownership change. The hotel is definitely a good value and probably, in my opinion, the best place to stay in the Downtown Disney area of seven hotels. I've had some trouble (particularly with mold) with the other hotels. Because this hotel was gutted to its core and rebuilt (can't really say the hotel was renovated as that would not do the hotel justice), it is clean, comfortable, and a good value. I attached a picture from the panel on the back of the door to show the room layouts. Note this is for the tower (the wing is a bit different). Basically, rooms 01-04 are at the back of the hotel and have balconies and face I-4. Rooms 05-09 have balconies and face the Downtown Disney area and the Hilton next door. Rooms 10-13 also have balconies and face Hotel Plaza Blvd and the Epcot area (can probably see Disney fireworks from these rooms). Rooms 14-18 do NOT have balconies (except on the 14th floor) and face the Royal Plaza next door and I-4. As you can see, it looks like room 18 has a smaller living area as the service elevator is in that area also. The windows and sliding glass doors are of a strong glass so you don't hear the traffic from the road. The common areas of the hotel are well-maintained, modern, and clean. The restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Lunch and dinner feature an asian-inspired menu. The bar serves the restaurant menu as well as its own small bar menu with bar-type foods. The bar also has a small outside area beside the pool that is good for eating, drinking, or hanging out. The food is very good, and a decent value compared to what one would pay at the parks. The Disney gift shop remains under construction. The Grab 'N Go selection is limited, and better options can be found at the neighboring hotels. The Royal Plaza next door has a better Grab 'N Go area with fruit, sandwiches, salads, etc., and the Hilton next door also has a decent selection of prepared sandwiches for quick meals. Also, the Doubletree hotel two hotels down offers a limited Pizza Hut menu. The Holiday Inn also offers a small fitness room and business center on-site. As for the rooms, they are roomy and the housekeepers do a good job keeping them clean. The LCD TV offers a generous selection of channels (35 or so), although I don't think they were in HD. There is no LodgeNet-esque service so there is no pay-per-view or video game option. The rooms offer free wired high-speed Internet, a nice work desk, plenty of lighting, an in-room safe, and an in-room refrigerator. Some rooms have a stand-up shower stall whereas others offer a traditional tub/shower combination. The beds are comfortable and the triple-sheeting is a nice touch. The maintenance staff members were extremely outgoing and friendly. The housekeeping staff was a little too persistent about getting into the room to clean. The front desk staff were generally helpful and friendly. Overall, since this hotel was rebuilt it is going to offer the best rooms and amenities. You can most likely find cheaper options at some of the other hotels in the area on the popular hotel price finding web sites, but it's worth paying a couple more dollars to stay here for the quality and service. My only suggestion for improvement would be to enhance the Grab 'N Go area to be comparable to what other hotels in the area offer -- you don't want your guests to have to go next door to get a snack.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: I was a little upset when I first checked in, since my room wasn't ready until exactly 4. That is their check-in time, but I was hoping something would be ready a bit earlier. Aside from that, however, it was a very positive experience. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly, and the location was great. I got a great deal through Expedia, and I felt like I definitely got more than my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again - great find.”
Reviews.Author: BonnieND
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a great place to stay for our Disney trip. The hotel is so clean and so was the room. The first thing I do is look at the tub and sink - if there is hair they clean it again! Surprise - no hair! Of course, the place has been renovated which helps. The staff is very friendly. We had breakfast each morning of our stay and it was very good. They have an omlet/waffle bar or a cold cereal, yogurt and pastry bar for $9.95 which includes the coffee (omlets and waffles were great but pastries were dry). I found this to be a great value and time saver. BUT we found each morning that the waitress tried to give us the $14.95 breakfast which was both sides with juice. REALLY - who could eat all that! So when they ask if you want juice when you sit down say no until they explain the buffett prices to you. The last morning my daughter noticed that the waitress charge my husband for the $14.95 buffett and she did change it to the $9.95. You can also order off the menu which some did and the food looked great. Downtown Disney is only about two blocks from the hotel. Very convenient to walk to at night. The bus to Magic Kingdom, Epcot, etc. is right outside the front door and runs every half hour. It was great not to have to drive and pay for the parking (of course we paid parking at the hotel). FYI......My daughter has Celiac Disease and we had our lunches and one dinner inside Disney (Magic Kingdom and Epcot). They could not have been nicer and to our surprise both resturants had GF Buns for sandwiches/burgers. Also, fries are made it separate fryers. Pizza Uno also has GF pizza which is great (that is outside of course). When we return we plan to stay at this hotel. The price was amazing for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, close to the parks and Downtown Disney!”
Reviews.Author: gyron
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and a great value. Their pool is excellent, the staff is fabulous, and the amenities are very nice. The location can't be beat for the price. You can walk to downtown disney and they have free shuttles to all the Disney parks. The only thing was the resturant was a little expensive for a hotel of this price. But if that's the only complaint, there are a lot of returants right down the street that are fast food, etc etc etc.... Our family loved the pool, the staff was excellent and very helpful. Everyone was extremely friendly and always smiled and made sure to chat with us as we passed. We had small children with us and this hotel was perfect for them. The pool is a beach style pool where the children can walk in and play in the shallow water and also excellent for the adults wanting to lay in the water and sun. There are also palm trees providing some shade in the pool in the afternoon. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. As I understand it this hotel was recently renovated and they did a great job. It looks brand new in most parts of the hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Clau26
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a tower room, and it was very nice, the room is brand new, and the housekeepers maintened it always tidy. For breakfast, there was a very nice buffet, for 14,99 for person 12 and older. Every half an hour, a bus takes us to the disney parks. I certainly recommend this hotel. It was a very pleasant stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings....”
Reviews.Author: happydays410
Reviews.Content: This hotel appeared to be new and is actually located in a great area. The breakfast and the pool were great. I wanted to love this hotel, but I just couldn't. We constantly had an issue with the towels and bedding. Almost every towel that we were given was soiled with old stains. Housekeeping did replace them with different towels, but this issue occurred daily! The same thing occurred with the bedding... I brought this to the attention of the hotel management, but they did not seem too concerned. Not sure if I will be returning to this hotel in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Yes, pick this hotel for your Orlando stay!”
Reviews.Author: evdeb1
Reviews.Content: After carefully looking at various Orlando hotels online and reading all the reviews, I chose this Holiday Inn for my stay. I booked it through Sam's Club and got a great deal on the hotel and car rental. All the good things that I read about this hotel are true. The whole place is very, very clean. The staff is very friendly and took care of any issues we had immediately. My whole family loved the pool which always an ample supply of towels. There is a hot tub too! The hotel is close to all the attractions (the theme parks, outlet shopping, places to eat and Downtown Disney is just a ten minute walk away). Internet access is free (wired or wireless). My son's 15-inch laptop, with a little twisting and turning, just fit in the room safe. There is, however, a $10 per day charge for parking, so keep that in mind. The morning breakfast buffet we thought was a little pricy at $15 per person, so we just ate there once. The food, however, was very good and the service was excellent. I thought the beds were super comfortable (I like a firm mattress) . My husband and son thought the matresses could have been a little softer. We just loved our stay and if we return to Orlando, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you're undecided about choosing this hotel, CHOOSE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrimeaway
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel From July 15 thru the 19th for a family trip to Disney. The hotel was perfect. The rooms were very very clean. The pool area was very much enjoyed by my entire family and was beautiful. This hotel looks brand new and is super clean. We payed for our room in advance and got a pool view room which was 89 dollars a night. I think the price for this hotel was a steal. The location was amazing, so close to restraunts and stores if you need everyday things. They have buses that leave every half hour to all the parks and they were always on time. We did have a rental car that my teenage children used because they were doing the universal parks while my husband and I were taking the younger children to the disney parks and there is a 10 dollar a day parking fee that I was unaware of until check out. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will without a doubt stay at this hotel again. Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, great location and the price was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, exceptional staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: loveisbliss
Reviews.Content: Our original plans were to stay onsite at Universal for eight nights. Within a month of our departure, I received an email with an exceptional offer for this Holiday Inn. After much debate, after speaking with Vika at the front desk, I decided to cancel my Universal hotel and book this Holiday Inn. I was quite nervous about my decision, but after spending nine days at this hotel, I certainly made the right choice. We arrived extremely early (9:00) and they were able to accommodate us in the exact room type that I had requested. We were unpacked by 10:30 and walked over to Downtown Disney! The location is perfect (actually better than many on-site Disney hotels). Every member of the staff was polite and helpful, especially Vika. The pool was great. The room comfortably accommodated our family of five. After many years of this property being closed, Holiday Inn did a great job of renovating and reopening a fantastic operation. I wish them continued success and would recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “NEW, CLEAN & Great VALUE”
Reviews.Author: sirsteve03
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about what to expect for the very low price we paid but we were very pleasantly surprised .The Hotel seemed like it had be recently refurbished. A guest laundry was a useful feature which missing in a lot of hotels. A free shuttle to the Disney resorts also operated every 30mins when we stayed which is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4th!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiseboys
Reviews.Content: Decided at the last minute to spend the July 4th weekend in Orlando and found the Holiday Inn had reopened after a big renovation. Wow! This property is, without a doubt, the nicest hotel on Hotel Plaza Blvd. Had some initial trouble booking but the staff took care of all the details even calling us back to confirm everything. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday2012
Reviews.Content: Our stay was incredible!!! The location is perfect, the staff members are so friendly and go out of their way to make you feel at home. The restaurant is moderately priced for breakfast, lunch & dinner and the food quality and service is over the top!!! We travel to Orlando twice a year & we have found our hotel for years to come.......... Thank you to the Holiday Inn Disney for making our stay the best ever, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property-Great Service-Awesome Deal!”
Reviews.Author: IowaDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay one night before getting into our villa. I searched for something near the airport and then started surfing around. I found that this property had recently been reopened after an expensive rehab! They sparred no expense. The colors, decorations, carpeting, fixtxures, etc. are out of this world. What even made it more attractive was they had a great deal called the Family Quest Package. It included one night plus 4 tickets to Disney Quest (which are at $41.37 per adult)-the rate on the room was $129.00 plus a $10.00 parking fee (which I think is silly) but it included 4 tickets which comes to just over $160.00. We have been wanting to take the kids there for years. The pool is clean and big. Zero entry with a bubbler fountain at the entrance. Sprinklers at various sides of the pool. Towels at the pool. We had one slight mishap at check-in but front desk went above and beyond giving us $20.00 in food/drink vouchers! I didn't see a need for them to do that but again, very good service. I would recommend this place to all. They have shuttle service to the Disney parks but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Disney World visitors!”
Reviews.Author: Patti4
Reviews.Content: After staying four nights in a Disney World resort as part of our "package", we switched to this hotel for our final three nights in Orlando. Can't say enough positive things about this hotel, which was completely remodeled last year. Spotless housekeeping, friendly and helpful employees, a great walk-in swimming pool for younger children, within walking distance of both Downtown Disney and several restaurant chains for economical dining, and free bus transportation to all Disney resorts offered every 30 minutes. We would MOST definitely stay here again, and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: serenaide
Reviews.Content: I knew from the moment i booked this hotel that I wouldnt be disappointed and returning from a week at this hotel I was soooo right! It is a very clean hotel... you can literally smell the clean off the whole place :) I dont know where to even start... ok... the staff was very friendly... every employee i walked by smiled and said hello... whenever we walked to the front entrance whoever was at the front desk would also say hello and make small conversation... the pool was great... not busy at all.. shuttle to disney came every 30 minutes to the hour... short walk to downtown disney although never had time to do so... never had the chance to try the restaurant/bar... but looked great... the evening staff.. never got their names.. the ones who worked over night from june13-18 were extremly friendly... they might remember me as the girl who ate up their quarters.. lol.... the only bad thing that i have to say.. not really bad just annoying... is the self laundry services being located in the west wing (we were located in the tower)... floors 2, 4, 6 with the one on the 4th floor having the supplies... i also hated that it was coin operated.. $3 wash $3 dry and $1.25 each for detergent and softener and there was no change machine... very annoying when the front desk didnt even have enough quarters to begin with.... the washrooms were a little on the small side.. but a family of three with a 3yr old had no problems... and there were no microwaves in the room! overall though i would defintely come back in a heart beat... room very clean and spacious.. thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: cubanman2
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Disney Resort was not as accommodating as I would have liked for it to be. First, from the first night at check in, we were locked out of our room. Somehow the door's bolt was blocking the door, so we could not get in, mine you, I have one disabled child and two other little ones freezing outside the room waiting for someone to open the door at midnight. Not very pleasant when we just drove 16 hours straight. Second, when we called about breakfast, we were told kids eat free, but we were not told that an adult had to purchase a meal for the kids to eat free. We found this out on the following morning. Not good when we had a budget for eating expenses, and this pretty much threw out our budget. Third, I understand this place is designed to inconvenience customers, so we can spent more money on amenities, but amenities should be convenient and accessible, such as a washer and dryer. I did not expect to spend so much on washing clothes, and to have to deal with only "3 washers and dryers" for the whole entire building. Not good for a customer that has an extended stay. Fourth and Fifth, no where in the website does it say about parking fees, not sure why you would charge a customer parking fees, when your already having to spent money on everything else. And lastly, it would have been nice if there was a microwave in the room, since we had to rearrange our eating expenses. Unfortunately, this Holiday Inn did not meet my expectations, and believe me we have stayed in many holiday inns. This is one customer that will not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Klubkid13
Reviews.Content: For those travelling to WDW this is a great location. After the major renovation this hotel is a must stay. The staff is absolutely amazing, friendly and hospitable from start to finish. We had not one complaint and highly recommend this be a place to stay when visiting the Orlando area! Thanks Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! The cleanest hotel I have ever...”
Reviews.Author: kimpedirn
Reviews.Content: Loved it! The cleanest hotel I have ever been in. The staff treats you like you are royalty. They go above and beyond to make your trip perfect. Shuttle busses to the parks were excellent. The return busses usually ran about 20 minutes late and were standing rooom only, but that was typical with the Disney shuttles when we stayed at a Disney hotel in past. The Hotel was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay with Some Minor Annoyances”
Reviews.Author: RickNP
Reviews.Content: I most assuredly do not regret our decision to stay at the Holiday Inn, Located within walking distance for our evening at Cirque du Soleil, with nicely appointed surroundings, accommodating staff and a fair price tag, I am a satisfied customer. The minor annoyances, perhaps more puzzling than annoying, included a "king-size" bed, which was actually a mid-king, part way between king and queen size, and more significantly, a very small bathroom. The bathroom measured only 5x8 feet, yet crowded a full size tub, toilet, and vanity, along with a full complement of toiletries and many towels into this tiny space. There was no available wall space for even a towel rack, and the one wall hook was located awkwardly above a piece of framed art. The room itself was spacious enough, but this bathroom setup would have been awkward for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: GillianC54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight after 4 weeks in SouthWest Florida.The hotel has been recently upgraded and it certainly shows! Lovely comfortable rooms,breakfast area etc etc. Front desk staff in particular were very welcoming and helpful too.They really couldn't do enough for my partner and I. Long may it continue.I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great new renovation”
Reviews.Author: JohnJerseyCity
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are gay and we were in Orlando for Gay Days, the weekend when 50,000+ gay people descend on Disney and the other theme parks. Folks may not know that this is probably the largest attended group event in Orlando every year. This Holiday Inn was full with mostly gay men, who can be the most discerning (fussiest?) travelers on the planet. Well, we only heard very good things all around. The pool area is nice, the food in the restaurant was good, and the staff very nice. The new renovation is very good. Rooms are more basic and big than posh, but who hangs in their rooms with the theme parks outside anyway? The only hitch may have been slow elevators, but remember the hotel was packed and the pool was busy with parties from morning til late night - boys were traveling the elevators constantly. So there was a lot of activity that the new staff handled very well. We paid $8 a day for parking, no big deal, but that may have only been for our event - check with the hotel ahead. It's only a few minutes walk to Lake Buena Vista so location is perfect for Disney. Highly recommended and we hope the Holiday Inn is a host location for this event next year. Progress has come a long way with most major hotel chains now fighting for this business. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch Service!”
Reviews.Author: dcsoldier82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn last week during a large event. The service provided by the staff was flawless from start to finish. My reservation was easy to make, I was greeted by friendly people at the front desk who checked me in quickly, and the dining and housekeeping staff exceeded my expectations throughout my stay. Thank you Holiday Inn WDW for providing a superb facility for our event!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn @ WDW Showed they wanted the business”
Reviews.Author: JAlan73
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at the Hotel were welcoming and accommodating from the moment we arrived to the time we left. We even found that if we were not able to find items we wanted on the restaurant menu, they would see if they could create something special- and they did! The rates were reasonable and the recent overhaul/rehab to the hotel looked fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Hotel with OUTSTANDING Service”
Reviews.Author: SgtVitalucci
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two weeks on a business trip I originally talked to the sales mgr and little did I know that she squarred me away with a beautiful room. And I want everyone to know that I had a fantastic time at the hotel. Tthe staff is very upbeat and outgoing and friendly they really know how to treat their customer. I mean every single person that works there is awsome. I didnot have a bad meal at the restaurant everyone of the bar tenders makes an outstanding drink and from scratch. It is very obvious that the management here has a vigorous traing plan laid out for their people I will be telling everyone in every state about this fine Hotel in Orlando. My e-mail is gvitaluci@rocketmail.com and I'm on facebook as well. Again my hat is off to everyone that wotks at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful new hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Wilson2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weeks mid may 2010. This new hotel is spotless, welcoming and delivering first class service. Rooms are modern, beds comfortable and views (if you ask for Disney view) are splendid. Pool area is pleasant with a bar terrace adjacent. Pool is safe and warm. Location is excellent midway between Downtown Disney and Crossroads, both walkable. Free regular shuttle to the Parks and great restaurants close by. Try Sweet Tomatoes, Kobe, Bahama Breeze and the Orland (Millers) Ale House.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: IAHawks4Life
Reviews.Content: Obviously this is a brand new hotel in a great location, but it is the service that makes this hotel truly outstanding! Everyone from the room cleaner to server to the front desk was exceptional! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN DOWNTOWN DISNEY,GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: hotelguide1950
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff , very clean rooms, central A/C, lovely pool and deck , great service around the pool , kids love the fact that the pool slopes like a beach , so easy to get in and out , very nice spa , breakfast buffet very good , cooked to order items very well done, free bus to disney parks every half and hour all day and late at night , easy walking distance to downtown disney, (5 minutes or less) ,lovely balcony to have morning coffee , free high speed internet , HD tv with HBO, we enjoyed every minute of our 4 day stay, and will be back , having stayed at all of the other hotels in this area , this is the best value .

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jtins
Reviews.Content: Everything was superb here. We arrived very early midweek they were slow at the time and let us check in early. The bus service was great it ran every 30 min. so waiting was never a problem. I have to say the most pleasant and friendly staff I have encountered. The hotel is in a great location and the pool is perfect for both seniors and children with the zero entrance. We did have dinner in the restaurant one evening the food was very good as well as the service. The rooms were large, very clean and comfy. Management can be proud of their great staff!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best service!”
Reviews.Author: riss850
Reviews.Content: After travelocity screwed up our reservations and we had to find a hotel room at 2am in Orlando this was a dream come true so to speak. The hotel staff was extremely accomodating especially when we asked for a room and they didn't have any available. After some discussion between managers they offered us a room on a floor they were currently renovating at a reduced price! We were so grateful just to have a place to sleep after the 3 hour flight that we didn't even notice the construction noises the next morning. We continued on to Cape Coral where our rental house was after more rested than we would have been on the air port floor.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Plus!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauramilr
Reviews.Content: Can't be beat in any way! A truly professional staff took care of our every need and then some. Rooms, services, meals are all top quality. Location, location, location. They walked us thru 3 banquets in 2 days! We had over 240 in attendance during a 3-day event and the staff didn't slow down one iota. Thank you so much, Christine Burns, Marty Cleveland and Sasha! All these people and not one complaint. We love you all - also, Que - you are just too sweet. Laura Miller and the Stingaree Jamboree

Reviews.Title: “Awesome And Cheap”
Reviews.Author: AnshumanGoyal
Reviews.Content: This is the best Hotel to stay. It is Cheap and really good. Rooms are clean and tidy and beddings are really good one. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights here as our flight cancelled due to UK ash cloud. Decided to stay at a Holiday Inn as we are Priority Club members and were so happy that this is the one we chose. We walked in to the hotel to check the rates and found it a little expensive, however as we are Platinum members we were given a discounted rate and upgraded to a fantastic room on the top (14th) floor - everyone wanted a room on the 14th floor ! Great view of the pool and Downtown Disney and not much noise from the nearby road. Staff were all friendly and efficient and this hotel really felt like a home from home for us. ALL staff were always friendly and courteous and made us feel very welcome. Lovely pool with great restaurant and bar - Matt is the best bar tender an Orlando ! Easy walk to Downtown Disney and also Crossroads in the other direction - didnt really need the car at all. We had a problem with noise one night from the next door room which kept us awake but when we cpmplained to the manager he was very apologetic and gave us $60 vouchers for the restaurant and credit our Priority Club with 25,000 points - how good is that ? Thank you Edward Lopez !! Overall this was a fantastic stay - do not mistake this hotel for any of the other Holiday Inns in this area as this one is by far the best. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay brilliant - keep up with the good work, we will DEFINITELY be back

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn - in the Walt Disney World Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1805 Hotel Plaza Blvd, Lake Buena Vista, Orlando, FL 32830
